t64EDZLQuOCqNh9w7Jl7kQ.text: All the pancakes are great. They have different varieties of pancakes they depends on what you are craving. Either sweet and/or salty. Pancakes are very creative. Since it's a breakfast/lunch/brunch restaurant, they are always busy and wait times can be up to an hour. It's a very popular restaurant. You can always call in an order in advance and pick it up if you don't want to wait for a table.

iQ9VcQhvvIGP-kV62UeATQ.text: Best breakfast ever!  All the pancakes are great, with the carrot cake being my favorite.  The fried rice omelette is unbelievable.  Although it may be crowded, the service is fast and tables open up relatively quickly.

0XYQ4ofyd1mQHm1Bi8xc0A.text: This was the most incredible breakfast that I've had in Las Vegas. I'm originally from Chicago and breakfast places like this are dime a dozen. They served the most fantastic breakfast and have the greatest amount of choices. The plates are very well proportioned everything was cooked to perfection. the flavors match very well with the food on the menu. The prices were normal the service was absolutely excellent and friendly and the cooks obviously know what they're doing. The pancakes are absolutely unbelievable. I had the banana cream pie pancakes they are phenomenal. It was the best pancake I ever eaten! I will be back many more times especially with folks from out of town or looking for that type of food and not the typical Hotel buffet food. They have a plethora of choices and everything we ordered was prepared very well and quickly. Try it let me know what you think.

FqstaLLNimB9eADgVIcFVg.text: I came in at 12:12 on 3-10-16. I was greeted immediately and was sat as soon as the hostess was done giving change to another customer. My server Danielle was AWESOME! She was super nice and always made sure I didn't need anything multiple times. I had the country fried steak and eggs. The eggs were cooked perfectly (I asked for over easy) and the country fired steak was amazing ! I love their gravy! I also upgraded to the pb and jay pancakes , BOMB!  Overall food was amazing and so was the service!

SQz3yUVDLphj7H9MTiNvZw.text: I really love the food here and that's even when I don't get the fancy pancakes.  Benedicts here are great, even the omelets are good.  I'm a big coffee fan and it's always fresh and hot.  It's a very small place so come early, call ahead or be prepared to wait.  It's worth it though.  The small space lends to attentive service and the staff is friendly.  Get here and stuff yo face!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington omelet!  The pico here is awesome

Xe0cltYIqsCtt4DSPr8TGw.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is always yummy, and the service is on par. I see many complaints about the wait times, but you usually get seated before your est. wait time. This location is very small, so be prepared to wait at least 10 minutes. I've never had a bad experience here, and I always recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey toast is always my go-to. Always delicious!

9JgEXmDugVnNnKE6WbgF_A.text: OMG!!!!!  The red velvet pancakes are A M A Z I N G!  Also tried the lemon ricotta, and those were a hit as well!  Loved this place, and will be back next time we visit Vegas!

s6Zxad-flc3w2Is-S4GD1Q.text: Excellent service, delicious and abundant breakfast, and very casual atmosphere.  Reasonable prices.

ZMNco6jzTENPkrK61-Qanw.text: Visited Babycakes after purchasing their groupon offer.  My favorite breakfast place is Egg Works so they had a lot to live up to. The verdict? Thumbs down.   The eggs benedict was terrible. It was overcooked and hollandaise sauce was bleh. Seemed like maybe it was made from a powder mix? It was definitely missing something. The seasoned potatoes were okay but salty for my taste.  Also ordered an omelet that had veggies and a variety of meats. Once again, lack luster. I felt I could have made it at home and for the price, it was smaller in proportion to what Egg Works serves. The hash browns that were on my plate were probably the best thing but once again, small in portion.  We also ordered a small stack of plain buttermilk pancakes. This was probably the best thing we ate at our table.  Although I wanted to like Babycakes because of their cute logo and reviews, I must sadly say that I will probably never be eating breakfast here again.

w2XLim8eKDNqHkElX1rsYQ.text: Love the Red Velvet Pancakes & Rick's Adobo Rice.  Wait is always really long but soooo worth it!

fpnLblSNik-JYIKyeX44Ew.text: Red Velvet Pancakes with Cream Cheese syrup! Yes! It's amazing! I am not a big fan of cupcakes but I had to try these out and I am hooked! The pancakes are nice and fluffy topped with chocolate shavings, whipped cream and Cream cheese syrup! This is a must try! I can't wait to go back!

WND6p2MuUQTl8MGFKY74Hw.text: Awesome food. Filling portions. Def get the red velvet pancakes if u got a bit of a sweet tooth

VJbPZXGwzC60Y_0kqeSc8w.text: Thought I'd take a slow down in my hussle bussle of a life and have me a nice sit down early breakfast. A few co-workers of mine told me of this place called BabyStacks Cafe. Not to bad of a little cafe, but that was the only bad part... It was a VERY little cafe. Maybe about 7 or 8 seats. Don't get me wrong, the food was stupendous.The skillets are amazing and the red velvet pancakes are heaven on earth, just wish the cafe was a little bit bigger. I felt as if I was literally rubbing elbows with my stranger of a neighbor. I like roominess when I eat.

BV5gx5JQt3ZFIwTAnFrfdA.text: Awesome! Loco Moco with the garlic rice was delicious. Husband had the Banana Foster pancakes which he left no evidence of on the plate....we will definitely be back!!!!

FHmohzAfxyqsflT4JRWM8A.text: The wait was 45 minutes.  The hostess let us know that it could be longer.  We walked around the block, then sat outside.  The food was adequate.  I had the hazelnut pancakes and my guest had the grilled cheese sandwich with pork.  He said the sandwich was unique and delicious.  The server took our order right away since we had plenty of time to decide what to order while we were waiting to be seated.

8LHS35ypHTizBfsIHUNWAw.text: The food was great! The smores pancakes are to die for :) The only negative thing I have to say is the wifi was pretty bad.

e-YfFSHv0yTpNd4-_QoWDg.text: This place has yet to disappoint. Service is great, food comes out hot and fast. Love love the Red Velvet pancakes!

kM6ZV5lwmUzrqYSuBEnUHg.text: This is one of the best hideaway spots for breakfast in Las Vegas.  I probably past this place on several occasions without thinking twice.  They got all types of pancakes from red velvet to carrot cake.  My favorite thing to order has to be kalua pig eggs benedict because I'm a sucker oozy eggs and salty pork.  This place is small so expect a wait up to 35 minutes at least!

OBBEOqFWOx2vT82ElVBS_w.text: This place is so awesome!! I love that their foods are based on Hawaiian dishes. First thing I want to say is.. RED VELVET PANCAKES!!!!! It's so awesome!! Also try their spam fried rice. It's so good. Everything on their menu is good.

4zvVe0jC2NjZEDazCHnaJQ.text: Aaaaaaaamazing. I had the orangecicle pancakes and of course the works with all the sides! Demolished. I scarfed it all down like a fatty. Didn't snap one picture. !!! But next time . :)Reggae much good vibes great food.

aE-0lmzMGBtnMV99DTpBfQ.text: They are known for there red velvet pancakes. In my opinion it tasked just like a regular pancakes. They crepes were really good.

uYDXoti1F1-9XBtPi2lwgA.text: I'm sorry but I don't get the hype about this place. I read the yelp reviews and got excited because it's close to where I live and I've been looking for a really great and convenient breakfast spot... but after my two experiences here, I will never go back. Even if it was across the street from my house and offered free breakfast, I would never ever go back. It is that disgusting.   How do you mess up any egg dish? That blows my mind. I had a denver omelet and it was mostly egg, hardly any cheese or peppers, and just had maybe 10 ity-bity bits of ham. Other than the loud-mouthed waitress who had no manners, what I noticed the most from this visit were the cheap crappy plates and tableware. Never seen anything so cheap in any restaurant ever in my life. I felt dirty using them.  On the second visit (yes, I stupidly gave it a second shot), I had steak and rice, and both were absolutely inedible. HOW DO YOU F UP RICE?!! The rice was hard and dry. The steak was like the meat I would imagine you would get in prison. It was tiny, round, and charred to the point where all you could taste is charcoal. The meat was so hard that the cheap flimsy fork wouldn't penetrate it.   But that's not the disgusting part.   I reached for the steak sauce so I could try to choke this charred crap down and nearly dropped the bottle. The bottle looked like it's been used and refilled for at least five years without being cleaned in any way. The opening of the bottle was so clogged with nasty, crusty old sauce, I'm sure the sauce that was left in there would only trickle out. Not that I wanted to use it after seeing that. Then I reach for my straw to drink the nasty water and the straw was stained with what looked like blood O_O. I quickly dropped that too, completely appalled. I waved the waitress down to get another straw, and she grabs another from her dirty apron and throws it on the table and guess what?... it's stained and crusty looking too!   At that point I decide I'm done. I didn't eat, didn't drink and I just wanted to run out of there as fast as I could. I grabbed my stuff and paid and got the hell out of there. I didn't raise hell or demand to speak to a manager because... how do you tell someone everything about their establishment is repulsive and they should be shut-down. I'd be embarrassed to even have to say that to a place of business. They should be ashamed. Yelpers beware.

H6SS1sWhjKgB_e8HHIdLtg.text: Tried it this morning and boy it was delicious!  I had the Wheat French Toast. I love the crunchy bite! A little hard to break apart, but good.  My love had your Red Velvet Pancakes and it was DIVINE! I had a bite, not going to lie haha. I think it tasted better without the chocolate toppings, but very good. I'll be back and I'll try some of your pancakes next time.

7u-63w_sSCdmfuLRsGqTmw.text: Too busy with too much wait time  Food was just ok. This is a classic example of what people perceive as a good place because it was a blind mouse leading another blind mouse  No it was not worth the wait. Next door brunch is just as good.  IHOP is just as good no kidding.

4g9S2GZ0lCJHFaPSlGeZXw.text: My wife and I had b-fast at Baby stacks yesterday. Very well done. I had the carrot cake pancakes and we both feel they were even better than the red velvet. The coffee was very good as well as the eggs and potataos.

8yvN0xXQBre9DYSBIXBElA.text: Babystacks is my favorite breakfast place in Vegas. The red velvet pancakes are phenomenal with the cream cheese frosting, and their seasoned potatoes have awesome flavor. This is the only restaurant I have cleaned my plate at continuously. Be warned about the wait though- it's often 30+ minutes, even on weekday mornings, but well worth it in my opinion!

uie_c9lIWpi6ANenzp8HoA.text: Really really yummy food!  This tiny little restaurant is great.  I've eaten here for breakfast.  We were able to walk in and get a table right away but there was quite a crowd when we left, so I imagine that could be hit or miss.  The food was great!  Red Velvet Pancakes?  Are you kidding me?  So stinkin' good.  We also tried the omlettes which are equally delicous.  I can't wait to go back and try the S'mores pancakes.  And the Peanut Butter and Banana.

QhgnFhagmv33_sDJXjnVkQ.text: I think they must write their own reviews. Just a very average place. I just had lunch, wafer thin chicken breast, so over cooked I could barely cut it , with frozen seasoned fake fries.  I have had breakfast here once and that was so so too. Over rated!

DM9xjSYYZ4jACKqGl-D_QQ.text: Gr8 breakfast place in near Desert Shores.  Hawaiian owned.  Egg dishes, pancakes, crepes-all top notch.  Kahlua pig eggs benedict, red velvet pancakes and nutella crepes are good.  Service is fine and portions are generous.  Decent prices.  A little congested and noisy.

0TJHiDaOTCB9X7Rs_0uPWQ.text: I ordered the Banana's Foster really good!! I also ordered the Baby chic omelette it was ok lacked seasoning, seasoned potatoes were ok. Overall food was good.

10rq3cBCyjwwEodsl_Nn6w.text: Only thing I don't like is the wait, but you can get around that by ordering to go.  Outside the different kinds of pancake options, the rest of the food is just ok. The pancakes are the real winner here. Amazing combinations! I love the Banana's Foster personally, and the carrot cake. Great place to take out of town guest to give them something different.

sZHIbiL0rcBrm64u0Yv-Gw.text: Even on a Friday at 11 am this small location is packed!  We had German chocolate short stack and bananas foster short stack with sides of eggs and Portuguese sausage. Everything was perfect and delicious. Pancakes came out still steaming. I had never heard of Portuguese sausage but it reminds me of kielbasa - so much flavor. Highly recommend earing here! Flawless.

2I4dniBKxR0Wv-bcL2ldVA.text: I've been here a few times while I was in town, and I would definitely give them 4 or 5 stars for the food, but maybe 3 stars for the prices, which is kind of expensive.  Everything is close to, or around, the $10 range.    I always get the infamous red velvet pancakes that everybody else gets and they're definitely pretty good.  Loco moco is also good, but nothing to write home about.  The same for the portugese sausage and eggs.  If it's a weekend, go early to avoid the crowd and long wait!!  Like before 8:00.  Everybody and their grandmother is there on the weekends!!!

lXg3Y7HS8dfyeee_9toc9w.text: Very nice staff and my daughter absolutely loved her Cinnabon pancakes. I got the biscuits and gravy (my all time favorite) and am quite disappointed. Perhaps I am spoiled, however there was not enough gravy to eat all of the biscuits, no sausage chunks in the gravy, and the gravy had a sweetness to it. I also got the seasoned potatoes and those were awesome! $15.94 for breakfast, not too bad, however not worth it for me, personally.

qWJlu9-mScP44np8LepIOA.text: This place is only 5 miles from the strip and luckily we rented a car for the weekend. I had the breakfast burrito with spinach instead of meat and it was very good. Nothing too amazing, but good! (the 4 stars are also a result of the lack of interest our waitress showed in our meals and questions) The reason I'm really writing is to tell the world that everyone needs to add red velvet pancakes to their bucket list! Don't trust other bad reviews. They are by NO means too sweet! Infact they are very mind...perfect id say! The cream cheese sauce even comes on the sie so u can add to your liking!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes breakfast burrito w/spinach and ranchero

rE2pN-5h2kqHFCQjQCLCmA.text: This place has made me a BELIEVER!!!  I normally never EVER get pancakes as my breakfast entree, but these are the best pancakes EVERR!!!  These pancakes were light, fluffy and not overly sweet.  My friends and I came here for brunch during our girl's vegas weekend and we were NOT disappointed in the least.  We ordered the red velvet, banana cream pie, and strawberry pancakes and they were all delicious.  My personal fave was the banana cream pie.  All the pancakes were served with homemade whipped cream and the red velvet came with a cream cheese syrup (YUM!!).  Aside from our sweet entrees, we also ordered a side of garlic friend rice and french fries, both were also great.  I am definitely returning next time I'm in vegas!!

fKGPAvQoePtVRdHb6Iz1Gw.text: Heard about this place from the local las vegas newspaper, so my husband and i thought we should give it a try. For one we had never heard of a place having red velvet pancakes.. second it is a locals place. a little hole in the wall and thats exactly what we were lookin' for.  Was easy to find. Heard about waits, but we got there around 11am-ish and got seated right away. I can understand some peoples complaints about waiting because there isnt much seating. But then again, when its a small owned business that serves good food, a wait is expected.  The service was good. Lady was friendly and helpful with menu. I ordered something boring [eggs, bacon, regular pancakes]. Didnt want to go over board since i was pregnant and still had morning sickness. My food was good. The hubby ordered the loco moco and bacon pancakes. He raved that the pancakes were delish, but said the loco moco should have had more rice.   Overall was good and we shall come here again :)

mYbF0u8nWDMHgX1TKa0OLw.text: My wife read a review someplace that raved about pancakes. She loves pancakes. So we went, she ordered bacon pancakes, a short stack. I like corned beef hash so that's what I ordered.   She said her pancakes were okay but too thick for her, too cake like. Okay that's a personal preference.  The menu says the corned beef hash is homemade. It tasted and looked like it was from a can, maybe doctored a bit but from a can. It tasted okay but nothing special. I ordered seasoned potatoes and I swear they were a commercially available brand. I also had an order of sourdough toast but where was the butter? I slight splash of butter? C'mon.   I can say the service was excellent but all in all we didn't find the place a stand out. We'll keep looking.

hUvQ3yejxTYELiUFxhv-Ag.text: ONE OF THE MOST OVER RATED RESTAURANTS EVER! Gosh, Im not one to wait an hour, Party of 7, food was a not that great, should have when to I hop, gravy was poor with no taste. the rice omelet that I got excited about horrible and only one of our party had any thing good to say. Hostess was rude , but waiter was trying but after we had our order messed up.... Yelp was wrong, after reading similarity stories about flavor profile and wait, its just not going to happen again, good waiting for a meal thats not that good!

y57RlRDuaGES3UlV6ZL7Eg.text: It's the perfect place for breakfast. Order the adobo fried rice for sure.The kids love the pancakes. Solid service and the food comes quickly. Only problem is there is always a 45 minute wait for a table - any time of day. Every day. But it's worth the wait.

BhbPu3uWbDJd4P7cdwlyCA.text: Where do I start. Everything at this place was great. The hash browns  were awesome,  pancakes- perfect with taste and fluffy. The eggs benedict came with a biscuit instead of an English muffin.  It was the best I ever had,  I love eggs benedict and have had many, this is the best. Coffee was great and that is important.  This is a definite must every trip, you can't go wrong. Great servers,  always in good moods, nice and sweet.

PSErB85lXk93xP3Yc-WVHA.text: Where do I begin.  Everything our group ordered was amazing. The red velvet pancakes are better than any I have ever had. We also ordered Kalua eggs Benedict,  sauce was fresh made and delicious. Will be coming back before we head home for another meal and to try some more of their amazing pancakes.

CMwqHd3hAtVgInnTrTVMsQ.text: This place was amazing!  The pancakes ordered for my family(red velvet, white chocolate/macademia and bacon)  were delicious.  Every bite gave me a smile!      The two things that I remember from that meal that could improve the customer's experience is: the long wait(we came in for a Thursday brunch and waited for longer than 30 minutes) and the portions(considering the prices charged).      If you're in the mood for pancakes, this is spot!

yhj0APIXWnoXdutRmLNesg.text: Being out of town, we wanted to try a local cafe. After researching, I stumbled upon this place online and automatically the red velvet pancake and Hawaiian dishes got me. They reminded me of Hawaii. The wait was less than ten minutes for us. I, personally, ordered the adobo fried rice and red velvet pancakes and boy, were they delish. Starting with the adobo fried rice, you can definitely share this with another person. It was very big but that's the way it should be and the meat was season perfect. It was to die for that I wanted to bring it back to the hotel with me except we didn't have a microwave. Now, the red velvet pancake. Oh man, I devour that thing. From the whipped cream to the cream cheese sauce, there was nothing left on the plate. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice and red velvet pancake

jlpwQeiTIoZ2FdPKcqsh0g.text: I like this place, the food came out quickly and it was tasty. I had the corned beef hash with sunny side up eggs and my friend had huevos rancheros and he thought they were "bomb" So yes, I do recommend this place!

Q59cqgCgNUwKVat9nt4U1w.text: Pretty good breakfast food especially for a hangover at vegas. Portuguese sausage with eggs and garlic fried rice is my fav. You have to get garlic fried rice. Took a star off cause they didnt give bigger portions. Banana cream pie pancakes were good but you kinda get sick of the banana flavor. Next time ill try the red velvet pancakes.

iNvA2BSRjPVUIOqnWtCO8A.text: love this place! the only problem is this location is pretty small and they are usually pretty busy unless you go early enough! delicious food!

Me5CtVLW-S4RMFGiqLPdRw.text: i have been coming here and talking about this place since I first moved to the valley. For any Hawaii locals, this is your spot to go for local kine breakfasts and more! It is always busy and by always, I mean always. I have never been here where I didn't have to wait for more than 30 mins. Service definitely incorporates that aloha spirit. Food never disappoints from their red velvet pancakes, to their kalua pig eggs benedict and corn beef hash and eggs. My mouth is drooling just talking about it. Prices are overly reasonable. If you get a typical breakfast like their steak and eggs, you get a choice of pancakes or toast. PANCAKES!?!? as a side?!?! That's AMAZING! They have two locations on separate sides of town so you can stop by no matter where you're at. Mahalo and enjoy the grindz.

YeyHQ75qSxcFNyiaeUzHHQ.text: Babystacks was extremely delicious for breakfast. The Portuguese sausage and cinnamon bun pancakes were a big hit with me. The service was good and the refills were frequent. I would definitely visit again after eating there two days in a row before departure.

n7sB2tU0Sx85Uu5YwLro7g.text: On our way back home to Cali, we stopped by BabyStacks Cafe for breakfast.  The food is ok but the pancakes are INSANELY DELICIOUS!  I would've given this place 5 stars but the staff wasn't all the friendly and welcoming. Our waiter looked irritated to be there and the rest of the staff looked very unhappy.  Our food was served pretty quickly so that was a plus. Would I come here again?  Definitely!!  For the pancakes alone!  Hoping the staff will be in a better mood next time.

VziOas9-sMftyhU-pLEb2g.text: I've been here a couple of times and have enjoyed both times! I thought it was interesting to combine Hawaiian style food with pancakes...lol. First time, I had the Loco Moco and Red Velvet pancakes. The second time, I had Adobo Fried Rice and Bananas Fosters pancakes. All were good, but the Adobo Fried Rice really stood out and tasted great. The Bananas Fosters pancakes are my favorite pancakes so far. I plan on trying more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco and Red Velvet Pancakes.

BnwFF3UhAZCpCk20pepTCA.text: Weekdays are the days to eat here.  They're too popular on weekends.  Hey now though... Eggs Benedict menu!  Yyyeeeaahh-uh.  Gimme gimme!  Super glad Ness and I finally got to grubbit.  Way better than the other place down the street, in my opinion.  I'll tell ya' only if you ask.  Jacob stay awesome!  You've got the smiley service.  Thanks for keeping my hot coffee topped off.  We got our beverages within a couple minutes of being seated.  After ordering, food didn't take longer than 10 minutes to be served.  Wow the menu!  Can we order everything please?  Except we'll be extremely food baby'd...  Had us giggling about why we can't order 2 nutella crepes which would've been perfect.  Nooo sawwy chawlie it's one or three.  Yummyyyy :D all that's missing is ice cream!  Get it!  Approving and recommending their Hawaiian (spam) and / or Spinach (has mushrooms) Benedict plates.  Comes with two, plus potatoes served different styles.  Dousing the Cholula!  NOM-awesome!  The English muffins under the ingredients were not soggy oil sponges at all.  Loved that they were still fluffy with a slight crisp :)  They got it right!   Babystacks has a great menu, appetizing food presentation, good prices, clean dining area, great customer service, music and TV.  Billing receipt presents tip suggestions between 15% to 20%.  We have nothing to complain about.  You've made part of our day!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Be Nice or Leave&#34;.  Hot chocolate kinda cute there.
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella crepes, spinach benedict, Hawaiian benedict

cdkkxdcr7aTZ5wf3W9Wccw.text: Food was good but they need to expand so your not on top of each other.  I felt like I was dining with the table next to me. If your looking for private, this isn't the place.

m03IpzBJkw3RYpbhS8dU1A.text: I ordered the Mexican omelette with extra avocado. Ohhh it was heavenly. My friend ordered ordered spam, eggs, and rice. Ohhh, it was so delicious. Oh, I love spam, eggs, and rice. Any place that makes this AND makes it well - 5*! The Mexican omelette was outstanding, because all of the ingredients tasted fresh, and the extra avocado? PERFECTION.   The spam was nice and crispy, the eggs were over-easy, and perfectly done. The rice was nice and sticky, and altogether, it was heavenly. I miss this place. I wish they had more places like this here. I am not a pancake person, so i didn't bother with them, but I saw people ordering them, and their faces told it all after they ate them.

bg7i6995Q0YOXWHMo1-zuA.text: Jacob was fantastic!  Maybe I should've ordered the pancakes or pancakes, I mean they are called baby cakes.  I'm not familiar w/ this area & was starving for eggs so got the sausage & eggs platter w/ seasoned potatoes & toast.    I totally give service 5 stars, but the meal was no good.  The turkey sausage tasted like a TV dinner & the scrambled eggs were not seasoned.  They were just ok.  The seasoned potatoes were fantastic w/ Cholula on them.  I would honestly be back to try a sweeter dish cause the ladies next to me had a sweet & beautiful dish.   I am not a sweet entree person that early in the morning, however will not order a regular breakfast next time.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs sausage
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast mmm

g9IcThFqa1qv2MI6c1KS1A.text: The restaurant is a little on the small side. Came to Las Vegas to visit my cousin. Service was quick & food was delicious. It was that good that during our 3 day stay in Vegas, we came back a 2nd time.

2mihUc4xVKebZzY5WMNfkw.text: Came in day after Thanksgiving & everyone had the same idea as my daughter. Had it not been for her great idea to be here I'd have left! I got my usual German chocolate half stack, Portuguese sausage, and tried their garlic rice and added mushrooms. Daughter had the Frankie kid meal. Hostess was weird. Wait time 30-45mins. Server was great. The food here was a little better than the Durango location I believe in reference to fresh/hotness.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

goFfYnAD_cDUV9wYLh3CfQ.text: Amazing food!  They are always busy. I usually order take out since I work next door to it. Whether I walk in to place my take out order or call it in they are always nice no matter how busy they are. They always get my order accurate with the modifications I make. It's always delicious. No complaints, I will happily return :)

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie short stacks sub strawberry slices sooo good!! Would order again!

mzdj0ZuEE9d9iRMky8kCwg.text: Husbands family came in town for first time and I was tasked with picking food options, this was the best place we went to! They all talked about it all day and were so thrilled with all the cool pancake options. Prices were AMAZING only 1.50 extra for fancy, well dressed pancakes. Was worried about the wait since it was 10 am on a Sunday but we walked in with absolutely no wait, couple of tables free as well. Me and my husband plan to come back every Sunday now! Can't say enough good things!

hX5XOVrs-fjNgaqGRe8Rrg.text: Whenever you're in the mood for DELICIOUS pancakes, this is the spot!!  I always order something new and it never disappoints.  This time I went with the Loco Moco: pretty much rice, hamburger patty topped with an egg + gravy. Upgraded my side of pancakes to Hazelnut and it was amazing. The portions are great, the service is always friendly for how busy it gets. And yes, depending on the time/day you'll have a wait time. Just make sure everyone from the party is there or else they won't seat you.  Since the restaurant itself is small, it can get pretty noisy. I always find myself coming back to try more amazing things.   Would recommend the Adobo rice, too :))

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut pancakes

v8YVrh6XzD3xSMrEr7nnng.text: I absolutely love this place. Great selections and very inexpensive. My fav is the s'mores one.

V-5PgubaXKgUb69g8DoUng.text: Had to have the red velvet pancakes, which were an amazing dessert pancake. Perfect end to my savory spam Benedict. The fried rice is really good here too!

6UX_Wa5v9aTI4nVcEnZZWA.text: This location is smaller but the food is great! I ordered the Portuguese sausage with garlic rice and eggs. A definite traditional meal for me. I also upgraded to the macadamia pancakes. If you are ordering a meal, do not hurt yourself and order a full stack of pancakes! A half or side order is plenty! My husband ordered the adobo fried rice omelet, which is a must, too! We had family with us and they ordered the same as my husband but included a full stack of red velvet pancakes! Those were delicious, not too sweet at all. I would recommend going with others and order different items. My last visit to Vegas, we found this gem, so I've been waiting to return.
