Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Whites &amp; Turkey Bacon
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BabyStacks&#39; Fork

H9_HjX5LGcGJz3epqi07UA.text: Cards on the table, coming to this restaurant today, we were confusing the name with another local place that we have been to many times and liked a lot. That said, this was our first time at Babystacks. Two people ordering a fairly standard breakfast... $30. Breakfast doesn't cost  $30. For $30 I expect a life experience. We ordered eggs, sausage links, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, and potatoes between the two of us. My scrambled eggs were over done. I don't expect my eggs to be crispy. The sausage was greasy... to be expected of links... but all but flavorless. The biscuits and gravy were interesting. Buttery or cheesey.. not sure.. but also kind of sweet. I didn't finish them... I walked in starving and I love breakfast food.. didn't finish.   Restaurant was still very full and seems to get reviewed well. I just don't understand the attraction. What's it cost.. maybe a nickel to make a pancake! $30! I'll pay too much for good food, but I'd put this place in par with a Denny's. Nothing special.

NvcujhblqC4TPAor8JVVWg.text: Busy on the morning I was there.  Prompt service.  Ordered pancakes.  Very good.  Bacon and eggs.   All as I wanted.  Delicious.   Went home and back to bed.  Solid breakfast spot.

76LqESCtepHLEYs5gYpBrg.text: OMG this is one of the best breakfast places of all time! Yes there is a wait but the food is worth it! The portions are generous and super delicious  I have not had a bad experience here since I have been going, I want to keep it a secret but it's just so good I can't help but share

bFLCDWGDpGafj0RHISsXgg.text: I love the atmosphere of this place. Despite how busy it always is, the customer service is always great, and the food is amazing! Try their red velvet pancakes! You won't be disappointed!

TFrhUYh0wZIHDaHgGlArYQ.text: The food lived up to the hype and was delicious. Our waitress was friendly and knew the menu. The food was fresh and theybhave several original items. I wish it was bigger, but that's a me problem.

hs83Yh08ETTDlQLHHD-qJw.text: Great little place for breakfast! Service was quick and the food came out hot. We would come back.

ksvj_bGj0C7husYCjw2Vlg.text: At my bff's high recommendation of this place, I have eaten here twice.  And I simply fell in love with their pancakes.  Their tiramisu pancakes, to be specific. The first time I visited this place, it was really packed so we did take-out.  The second time I came here, we were lucky enough to get a seat after waiting a few minutes.  My friend loves it because it reminds her of Hawaii and she gets to eat her favorite portuguese sausages.  I LOVE that they have a variety of choices for pancakes!  After eating the tiramisu pancakes, I had the worst cravings for it.  It got so bad that for several months after, I was looking up recipes on how to make tiramisu pancakes...which turned out NOTHING like the ones here. I enjoy the omelettes that they serve here, and can see why there's always a long wait for this restaurant.  If I'm back in Vegas, I'm heading back here for my pancakes!

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6zUrjUp6W--fNEZrOVkLFQ.text: Hands down, my favorite breakfast place. One bite of those Red Velvet Pancakes and you're addicted lol. Anytime my husband asks me where I want to go for breakfast, the answer is always Babystacks. Always lok

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even he loves the Red Velvet Pancakes!

bCt_M6WnRGYMIGhygPQlYw.text: This is forsure one of my favorite breakfast spots that I have been to in Las Vegas. They are always busy but my wait time is never too long. I love the variety of breakfast plates they have and the pancakes to me are always good, it's a great breakfast spot to go to.

THokwDDbwtIEFBwuWHQCqg.text: Breakfast served with a side of Aloha. A locals favorite, with other locations around town.   This is one of those restaurants where it really doesn't matter what you choose, everything on the menu is equally delicious. Even if you're not too big on pancakes, you're gonna love these. Unique flavor combinations and the fluffiest stacks you've ever tasted. Short stack or full stack if you're really hungry, topped with whatever your little heart desires. Bananas Foster are my favorite. Red Velvet are also a big hit. Also, I'd skip the skillets if you like your potatoes crispy (I know I do).  But when I'm not in the mood for pancakes I opt for the Portuguese Sausage & Egg Whites and Seasoned Potatoes or The Huntington (a bacon omelet topped with avocado served with a side of pico). Other notable mentions: Spam and Eggs with Garlic Fried Rice, Adobo Fried Rice & Portuguese Fried Rice. Rice, Rice Baby! Lol.   Tips:  Lots of parking, but this is a smaller location. Come early of you don't want to get stuck waiting on the sunny bench. They won't seat your party until everyone has arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Benedict and hash browns (side of garlic rice)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese Fried Rice 5/5

TO3ZS6dAmPYjmCoXfV3aww.text: I really wanted to try this cafe so I made my friends detour about 20 minutes, and it was worth it! Service was good considering how crazy busy it was. The only downside was that the inside was pretty cramped, but that's not their fault. The Spam Scramble (scrambled eggs, spam, rice, and furikake seasoning) was packed with fluffy eggs and a generous amount of spam. I was afraid it would be too salty, but it was perfectly seasoned. My favorite dish was my bf's Adobo Fried Rice. The portion is humongous. It's delicious fried rice wrapped in an egg. Definitely try this one if anything! I also got the short red velvet pancakes. The pancakes were fluffy, and the strawberries were fresh and sweet. I wish they had a pancake sampler or something like that..I would have loved to try the other flavors. I would come here again for the Adobo Fried Rice and the other pancakes!

bJqTlaf4rYDSKIXrDrvczw.text: Food was excellent. Considering it was busy during my visit, it service was pretty. I would go again!

zXMU4yjP80nXXFtDdWScsA.text: Service started slow but food was good. Waiting time 50 minutes a lot of people waiting to eat. We were ready to order but waitress doing something else. If we go again hope service gets better.

XD6SQQPX1sFN3R7OWEK4fw.text: Rude, unfriendly, loud and very cold. Food was dry and unpalatable. I would, however, highly recommend the place to people I don't like.

fcI9sqcbxKsV7EGv8oBrMg.text: I walked in with great expectations liking the menu and seeing how busy they were but a alas was painfully disappointed.  The staff was very nice and helpful but that's where things end. I ordered the Hawaiian staple Loco Moco. They had it with garlic rice for an additional charge as well as spam. Since the last place I had Loco Moco in the area (see review of Kapuna Cafe) did not have spam in the rice I ordered the garlic rice with spam. I didn't realize until it arrived that what they did was substitute the spam for the hamburger. So I got this plate which did not look appealing as you can tell from the photo with a little gravy and spam covered rice. The rice itself was salty the gravy was salty so you can imagine how it was when you added spam into the mix. At least the eggs will cooked right. Also the side of coffee and enfused chocolate pancakes were tasty.  I was really hoping they would knock it out of the park with their food unfortunately that was not the case. In fact half of my wife's dish went to our dog.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes with blueberries

k6OfLRkNmf1f7ScHyXcFzQ.text: It's rare that I get to enjoy breakfast out! We had a fantastic experience here this afternoon. I asked our server to surprise me with breakfast and she chose the Kalbi ribs with garlic rice and a banana foster pancake. SO delicious. Sweet staff, fast service, great recommendations! Our new go to spot. Thank you!

xMcI2AKD3oCA7KpQfPIwWA.text: We had the worst service here ever. The server Mike took the order of the people next to us first even though we sat down first. He is friends with the people next to us. We know this because he gave the girl a hug and said it was nice seeing them again. Then they got served their food first. When our food came, he asked if my wife wanted more coffee. He never came back to our table after that. He went to his friends table a few times. Even asked them if they wanted cups to take their drinks with them. He still never came over to our table. No one at our table got refills on our drinks. I had to go up front and ask for boxes. Then I had to go up front and ask for a bill to pay. When we said our service was horrible, and all they said was sorry. No they're not. They don't care. Never going back there again.

9TTK1ymM5R1IzOtRohuiQA.text: really good food, average service since they're normally very busy every time I have chosen to go. Don't accept reservations which is a large bummer because I have twins and need two highchairs and more room than just the two adults that normally go. otherwise perfect place if you dont mind a usual wait time of 15-25 minutes on weekends

5ZOXBos8Dok2nvVtV9e8Vg.text: depending when you go it could be a bit of a wait but honestly its worth it. I have been multiple times and i have never had bad food the pancakes to die for so many flavors its hard to choose which to eat.

kuE5ARgNQTHWpPCzKrMa2w.text: Loved this place! I had a sweet blended coffee drink along with a salad. So fresh and tasty! The area was very nice too, good views.

IsyzRyaGKGKQXXbL8v_Zrg.text: Loved by my entire family!!!!! From their egg dishes to their pancakes and French toast... everything is amazing!  Must add that service is always quick and friendly, especially during my visits to pick up an order!!!!  Highly recommend this jewel of a place!

cncBhVYHuFLfzY4on5GxAw.text: This place popped up on my search for a new breakfast spot. Saw the pic for the red velvet pancakes. And omg they were worth the drive there. And they had many different flavor options. I will try all! I Definately recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benedict , red velvet pancakes and PoLl&#39;s Adobo fried rice omelette.

x_nCBUg54_qAlInQ0fvDlA.text: I've been here a few times. I'm a creature of habit I order the same thing chicken adobo fried rice omelette and wheat toast . It's what I order anywhere if it's on the breakfast menu . Ive tasted many variations of it, so I have others to compare it to. Well this trip around service and seating was on on spot and very quick. The food while portions are large for most is inconsistent in cook time . I've had it perfect to super dried out this time around. Also had pancakes which I can say is their bread and butter go to . That I must say am never disappointed.

uYiuDDGW7uU5_4MqrSPfWQ.text: First off, I love our waitress Danielle. She was so accommodating with a high energy personality.  Danielle was very friendly, fast paced and always looked out for our needs without us having to wait. She even threw in a free mac salad on the side which was also accommodating. My friend and I were very pleased with her service!   My friend and I ordered the Chili Moco, Lolo's Adobo Fried Rice,  Buttermilk Pancakes and the Red Velvet Pancakes. The prices were moderately inexpensive and they were big portioned plates. I had to take my food to go, along with my pancakes because this was very filling and delicious.   I also ordered another Red Velvet shirt stacks to go and she definitely hooked us up! I got three stacks of pancakes with extra extra cream and syrup on the side! Way to go! It was very satisfying.   I only had one dislike about an item and it was the macaroni salad. I know we just got it on the house, but i just wanted to bring up the critique of the food. It was very watery so the flavor was pulled out of the macaroni salad which made it taste flat. If it was a little more dryer, I would definitely hold up its texture and flavor next time.

oL2tupXToMz8ul2ZhXvK9Q.text: Stopped by here again for the first time in years. We came around 12:45 and it was PACKED, although we didn't have to wait for a seat. For a very small place it was still nice because you didn't feel too crowded.   My friend and I ordered two of the Huntington skillets with eggs over easy with regular pancakes and the cinnabun pancakes. Everything was SO tasty and the prices were great!

7i-NHS_rsw4BD58BhVDXAw.text: Best place to have breakfast They have the most unique and delicious pancakes Staff is always amazing here, and even when there busy you still get great service

4Tpbts9QfzKuPCt3m6RUsA.text: I am not really a breakfast food fan but I've heard tons of things about the RVPs, so I had to try them. I got read the reviews about how busy it is on the weekends, so I decided to call in my order. When I got there, there weren't many people so 8am on a Sunday seems good if you don't want to wait.  The red velvet pancakes are just okay. Almost like a dense piece of red velvet cake. The RVPs I had from IHOP are just as good. I also had bacon, eggs and hash browns, which were pretty standards. I did sneak a bite of the macadamia nut pancakes. They were amazing. Way better than the red velvet!   If I am ever in the neighborhood I'll go again if the wait isn't too bad and I will just stick with a stack of the macadamia nut pancakes. It's definitely not worth going out of your way.

eqARKt1WGrwTLEltBSYn5w.text: Had a great brunch with my Fiance and her family. We showed up at 10:45 on a Sunday and  the wait was over 30 minutes.  Because  friends recommended the place and warned us about the wait, we were expecting it, so I can't complain.   Staff was super friendly and the food came quick. We were checked on numerous times throughout the meal for refills on coffee and water.   I had the carrot cake pancakes on the side which were the bomb. I will definitely be back. I really want to explore the Filipino side of the breakfast menu on my next visit, and will probably try a different kind of pancake every time.   I am docking one star because my omelet didn't have very much filling in it. It was supposed to have sausage and bacon, but it was kind of sparse; almost mixed into the eggs in very small pieces.

HwXtmeIbieAjPlK3W-vLUw.text: I think for a small joint this place is really lovely!  Of course with a popular business, there is going to be a wait but its worth it! The food was homey&enjoyable. My ONLYYYY complaint is that is really should be an all day restaurant, not just open for breakfast hours. I cant tell you how many times Ive wanted some Baby Stacks after work!!  Keep it up...and extend your hours!

ptmfUFbpjPjloiN8IuaP3g.text: Great pancakes, if you go for that you will not be disappointed.  The bacon and ham were good too but the hash browns were absolutely terrible, I could finish them which is ridiculous for me.  I give the pancakes 5 stars the rest 3.5 and the hashbrown 0.  Go here and eat those pancakes.  Pumpkin and Red Velvet pancakes were amazing

9IX7MyhBNP6WOHU7v08yIQ.text: Hello. My name is Melanie, and I am a pancake addict.  Awe, why so serious? Being addicted to pancakes isn't so bad. I mean, so long as I don't let it get out of control. It's not like I eat pancakes for dinner...regularly. And I totally don't own pancake batter in a spray-can form. And I DEFINITELY have never argued with a McDonald's clerk because they wouldn't serve me a Hotcakes 'n Sausage platter a measly five minutes after breakfast ended. Never.  Okay, you got me. I may be fibbing a little. The truth is that I have a hard time saying no to pancakes. I could be wish-I-wore-my-stretchy-pants full, and if a warm stack of fluffy flapjacks somehow landed on my table - well, let's just say I wouldn't let it go to waste.  And so you can imagine what a pancake cafe would be like for me. Tummy temptation at its finest! Babystacks boasts the most ridiculously extensive selection of pancakes I have ever had the pleasure of choosing from. Red Velvet...Cinnabun...White Chocolate Macadamia Nut...Rocky Road - their pancake list reads more like a dessert menu! For those who seek savory over sweet? BACON pancakes! And even a Honey Whole Wheat option for the carb-conscious.   The best part? Each is available as a short stack of three pancakes. Translation? You can order like THREE different kinds without busting your pancake bank!  I played it cool and ordered just two flavors - the PB & Banana and the Red Velvet.  The PB & Banana was definitely the frontrunner of the two, with banana as the perfect complement to the unmistakably peanut-buttery batter. Simple, yet such a mouth-pleaser! The Red Velvet did quite well in its pancake debut, served with a delightful 'cream cheese syrup.' Though I would have done without the chocolate crumble topping -- it was an unnecessary distraction from the decadent-on-its-own batter.   Bottom Line:  The perfect place for feeding your flapjack fetish! Short-stacks are your best bet for maximum pancake sampling. Beware the long wait for a table -- especially on weekends.

1cd78Lj6kBbrOTjaxcYcIA.text: Overall, great food! Should've ordered sausage patties instead of links, but my meal was delicious! I tried the red velvet pancakes and they were scrumptious! A bit on the sweet side, which I love, but next time I'll try the T bone steak and just regular pancakes ... Or maybe the banana cream short stack? I don't know, everything looks pretty tasty on the menu! Staff were friendly, my family and I came on a Friday around 11 am and it was packed, no wait though, and staff were hustling and bustling so we left a generous tip for our waitress :)

liP29FckbJ41O7qeDYgp8w.text: Try the velvet pancakes is so delicious! Small place but clean. Good service!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6eKrAeY3UMkX10e0Nvd8Pg.text: Arrived 10:40am. Seated right away, drink order taken. OJ for me coffee for gf.   Few minutes to look over menu, I decided on  Portuguese sausage and eggs w/red velvet pancakes. My gf had the Piglet omelette. Less than a 10 minute wait for our food, talk about quick service. Everything was good as always.

RGjuKbNNyj2K-Fl8BJlCmw.text: Red Velvet pancakes!!!! If anyone knows me, they know that I love breakfast, and I love anything red velvet. So I had to come in to try the famous Red Velvet Pancakes that babystacks offers. OMG! They were so decadent! Anyone who wants to indulge on breakfast needs to come here. The portions that they give you are huge! Its definately enough for two people to share an order of anything here if they are not too hungry. The service is also top notch! My coffee was always full, and our server was always around when we needed him, but not enough where is was annoying.   Make sure you visit this place if you're visiting and especially if you're a local!

Xv8Zt0ty1_lPa-2uJGgVzA.text: Red Velvet Pancakes- DIVINE! Friendly staff, a little "cozy", and huge portions.  Tried the biscuits and gravy (not something I'm able to get much of in HI) and we also tried the omelet and red velvet pancakes. The winner was definitely the pancakes!  Try the red velvet pancakes if nothing else. And I'm a red velvet skeptic...

GnBbPkexR290iJS_14JiZQ.text: The pancakes are to die for. Delicious. But don't come here for coffee....the coffee is awful! Very watery and low quality. But, I keep coming back because of the food (the Nutella crepe is very good too). Only 3 stars because, for me, a good cup of Joe in the morning , is essential.

G3odbJBCaUAuv6D06cSqAA.text: Food is always good we've been here many times, never had a problem, it's just the wait to eat, there's always a long wait so be prepared to wait about 30 minutes to eat. We've eaten at all of their locations and by far this is the best one, here on North Buffalo which I believe is the original babystacks.

6lSotl6Wx91kpg14qD8k9A.text: This is the best breakfast I've ever had! Every flavor is to die for. We tried the lemon ricotta that has more of a crepe texture, cinnamon roll, a special Oreo cookie and they were all delicious and different. You won't be disappointed. Make sure all your party is there and plan to wait at least 25 min.

We ordered the adobo fried rice omelet and short stack red velvet pancakes and both were sooooo gooood!!!!!  Prices are so good, too!    We arrived around 10 with a wait of about 10-15 minutes which isn't bad at all.  Parking and location was easy.

YFxI6sitaaHxh_q-jzU8Vw.text: I came here on a tuesday morning and ordered the adobo fried rice for 12.   - it's an omelette with fried rice inside. the taste was good. it comes with adobo flavor shredded beef. not too salty but enough to taste the vinegar and soy sauce. i'm filipino. - TOO EXPENSIVE. considering thelmas lunch with 2 pieces of adobo, rice, mac salad, fruit salad for 7. babystacks is not worth it. you can even go to wicked spoon and get unlimited omelettes for lunch for 23! lol. well...you probably wouldn't want to do that, but just sayin... - no water refills? hot waitress but a required 18% for gratuity for a half-ass job, lame. - i've eaten at their flamingo location and it was great :)

x9FrxvZRrttgIJZiHtGrDA.text: Good food and good service.  Omelets are big and so are the burger and fries.bottomless coffee and soda.

1enBn_lGTTMQ8jkqKtDNEQ.text: Baby stacks was great the first time I ever went chilled in the parking lot making out with my bf for half an hour never even went inside but still was great

3t_hfSrU4WSq7c8uk0qTtw.text: Met two friends at this location this morning. The food was excellent. About 2 to 3 hours later, all 3 of us reported to each other we had food poisoning and the same symptoms. I've been tasting the adobo fried rice and eggs all day. :(

cxz-Yt909S7uCf1iM9ceiQ.text: The only place that is a must visit when I come to town!! Forget the strip, EVERYTHING on the menu is to die for!! The service is always good, everybody is friendly and helpful! There is always a wait which is a good sign that they are worth waiting for!! You won't regret the calories here!!

VmcKxcO3Qnp90PztDuK-zA.text: I want my baby back baby back baby back, Babyyyyy BabyStacks!!  I finally decided that I must must must try this place after all the wonderful things that I have heard about it.  I have yet to, and yes this makes me incredibly sad, taste the pancakes, because I'm on my special high protein diet at the moment. However, I have had the bacon, sausage, Peruvian sausages, eggs, and an omelet so far.  They have all been ever so tasty.  The eggs were exactly how I ordered them, they have yet to mess up an order and its always ready faster than they say, which is nice when you're in a time crunch.    I have yet sat down in the restaurant because I have seen how crazy busy it gets so I can't rate the service there but the hostess is wonderful and always smiling- HUGE for customer satisfaction.   I can't wait to try the pancakes and update this review!

1FIFDARMj8ZYenLDKmDUag.text: Saturday visit, created a stressful experience for me.  Not orgianized, service was less than average, my server I think needed a good night sleep, maybe out too late the night before... the wait time was unexceptable.  Now on to the food.... overpriced breakfast with below average food.  Maybe it was an off day but it was my first visit and I think it will take me ...never to come back.  Cold eggs, soggy toast and all without a smile.

7V2fWDi-TQmvLzeJtCpk6g.text: Family atmosphere, A+ service, Hawaiian comfort food and slippa' friendly.  BabyStacks is a good place to sit back, enjoy a cup of coffee for luch and slam as many Red Velvet Pancakes in your mouth until you reach your limit!  All the rave about these heavenly cakes live up to its reviewers 4-5 star rating.  The Red Velvet Cakes were accompanied with cream chese syrup, choco chips and whip.  The other dishes we ordered on the menu were no comparison to IHOP and Denny's.  Eggs Benedict w Kaluhua Pig and Chicken Adobo Omelet just to name a couple.  The place is quite small and the wait can be quite long which is the only downside.  Otherwise.. Onolicious Brah!

5OUixKCkb45use-YNWWFKw.text: The Ricks Adobo fried rice was amazing. I can't stop thinking about it. I can't wait to come back to Vegas and try it again.

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rick&#39;s Adobo Fried Rice

dy-WL7qZWPpmukiS9BKwiw.text: Babycakes will make you feel like a kid again! The deliciously moist, fluffy pancakes come in a wide range of flavors you'll recognize from childhood, such as smores, red velvet, and pb&j. I can't wait to try them all! Also worth a mention is the other items on the menu. They don't get the starring role that the pancakes do, of course, but they certainly round things out if you're not feeling like sweets. The eggs Benedict were very tasty, with the Canadian bacon having that nice smoky flavor that lets you know it's actually bacon, and not ham like so many other restaurants.  Prices are reasonable and the service is fairly flawless, though perhaps a bit more serious than I'm used to at a local breakfast joint.  I highly recommend this place for breakfast and brunch!!

PkVQWBPqOUxUNB9xm3caAA.text: Food is good, wait time is long due to small dinning room. Only issue I had was two ladies plucking there eye brows in the waiting area, the manger should have acknowledge, made me want to leave before trying out the food...

-Ilfy7NYgiW_9gfmeLUfBw.text: Very good food. I had the loco moco it has  rice, beef patty, egg and gravey. All of it very, very good. And don't pass up the red velvet pancakes. Come hungry and leave full. :)

gBwhIt00aI_sOy93irSVZA.text: NOT YOUR TYPICAL BREAKFAST or LUNCH CAFE...  Because we had a huge party of 8 people we were able to order FAMILY STYLE and just pick from an amazing variety of dishes from Babycakes Cafe's delectables!  =P Below is my description of the following items...  -**Red Velvet Pancakes -**Cinnamon Bun Pancakes -Country Fried Steak & Eggs -**Kalua Pigs Benedict -**Honey Toast -**Wheat French Toast -Rick's Adobe Fried Rice   (I added an "**" by the items that I've never had before and were special.)  So let me just describe how our meal went down...  From the light texture of the Red Velvet p-cakes and the full and savory flavor of the airy homemade whipped cream (Never had anything like it! I don't like whipped cream, but I really like this one...A LOT!)  that accompanied it, to the special of the month (at the time that I went June 2011) - Cinnamon Bun Pancakes (Whoa!), HOMEY Country Fried Steak and Eggs, the Kalua Pig Benedict (which was my FAVORITE!!!! If you like the smokey flavor, then get this! I've had salmon eggs benedict before, but the flavor of this thing just BURSTS forth like no other.) We also got the Honey Toast AND the Wheat French Toast. Both HIGHLY recommended. If you LOVE HONEY then get the Honey Toast, and if you really love cinnamon and the whipped cream from here AND a crunchy texture, get the Wheat French Toast. See, the Wheat French toast had "cereal bits" built into the bread that added an extra level of crunchiness, yum yum! Rick's Adobe Fried Rice was also on our table and was devoured within a few minutes.  These are just some of the things we ordered which were definitely NOT your typical breakfast/lunch items (except country fried steak and eggs). If Babycakes Cafe were located in my neighborhood back home I'd definitely be a regular. =D

sF8O5vyBcVmlG69C8s8HYQ.text: As everyone before has stated the red velvet pancakes were soooo great! The breakfast itself was just average. Sooo if you come, I would definitely have a speciality pancake. Great service! Jacob was awesome! FYI the place is called babycakes...

u48Mwtk15o3QYHSSqJTspw.text: I have been to both locations twice, however I was not impressed.The red vevlet cakes are amazing.  The Huevos rancheros was so so, short stack buttermilk pancakes were rubbery and basic egg breakfast was ok.  Greeters and Server are great!

I2sDG_f4ODRGWj4OKQM5Vw.text: The food is amazing ! The food deserves five stars , but it's tiny & you're basically squished . Wait is from 15-30 minutes long   Because its always full .

YC2jzXQglEoDBr2-A5zLSw.text: Red velvet pancakes is so good!!! It has so much flavor and the syrup is just right.

G-azB-ogSp68NLshMZkh1A.text: You have to try this place at least once if you like breakfast food. Or if you like pancakes. Their skillets are always good, as well as the red velvet pancakes.

uK4pM9EPWyjohRcXw8yyUw.text: There were 3 of us and we did a sampling of items on the menu, everything was delicious!

N8XthXWoX3Py3XfcP0UMOw.text: the adobo omelette lacked flavor and pieces of the chicken werent mixed in well.  the kalua pork benedict was dry and eggs were overcooked. the banana creme pancake was delicious but was not fluffy and didnt have enough bananas

5gLxCwZ6kwl37TEXAKQIwQ.text: Their parking is plenty located within a large shopping center. Their prices are friendly from $3.00-$18.00. The vibe is always packed with many locals. The service was busy, but yet somehow the servers always came to check on our table at the right time. The food selections are wonderful. Many include breakfast plates. Their portions are huge! If your hungry get the Mexican food plate with tortillas which comes with chicken, rice and beans. I came hungry, but after leaving not only was I happy with the service, price and food, but I was full! My portion was more than tasty enough food. Enough to feed two! I recommend next time you want some good tasty breakfast, but not from a big food chain eatery come to this place it's excellent! You won't be disappointed!

mme8E04Q58E45O9grEyfEQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Las Vegas. Great food! Wish they had more space, it is ALWAYS packed. Will be an ongoing customer.

AS0I-uASj8BjcBSFoqHqSw.text: I think this place is awesome! There is always a line and you have to wait, but I think if that's the case then theres a reason and the wait is worth it! If its your first time, please don't get turned off by the wait as you will not regret it. Breakfast was the kalua Benedict, adobo fried rice, and their special cookies n creme pancakes. As others have stated try all the other pancakes before thw red velvet because those are the best in my opinion!  As usual it was busy but service was great, staff is friendly, and the food arrived in a very decent amount time given how much people were there. The kalua Benedict is great! Smokey, savory kalua pig with hollandaise sauce and potatoes. The potatoes are awesome crisp and tender with great flavor. The kalua Benedict is definitely a must. Then the adobo fried rice.... just greatness wrapped up with an omelette! ! The adobo is nice and salty but not to much with the mac salad on the side this is winner and is highly recommended to try for your first time. The pancakes were a great surprise!! Chocolate pancakes were light but dense, I know weird but True! With cookie bits and an awesome syrup these pancakes was mean!! If they are still on the menu try these and then order a side of red velvet pancakes lol! I think there is nothing that will disappoint at Baby Stacks!! Definitely a must try place when coming to vegas! But I live here so I can anytime, chee!

P5_SajOat_JGsyaq4OxXyg.text: This restaurant is overated, told them service was bad, lousy food was cold, manager came over and was just as rude as server, if you don't want complaints do it rite, the first time. If you want a great meal go to the egg and I or cracked egg where they care about there customers and feed back. To big for there bridges horrible food, horrible service, horrible managment!!!!

cnVhSvPtzHP46R-7gGFpyQ.text: Pure sanity and lovely service, sweet and savory all in one. My waitress, Blanca, was a doll. I had coffee while I waited. Come here to get your mode back after a night of losing. Emerge a satisfied winner

B6D66OfICBqu3QQKQsAq7g.text: 1st visit: egg's benedict - the poached egg was overcooked & rubbery. that's my fave breakfast so i was sad. wah wah.  2nd visit: eggs over-easy w/ toast - it was good  cool pancake selection & specials, nice service, long wait during peak hours.

ZxnM0vRfTW5kJ_oh7PDeBQ.text: A very average breakfast place. If you're going to eat here, stick with what they are know for: speciality pancakes.  Tried a variety of items including an omelette, red velvet pancakes, eggs Benedict, and classic bacon and eggs. Everything was just okay except the velvet cakes which were fantastic. The whipped cream they dollop on top is a dream. I think about it sometimes.   Overall an okay place. Service can be a bit slow. If you are craving pancakes then definitely go here. Anything else? Maybe find some place else and save a little cash.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Eggs
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet shirt stack
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benedict

-Q3a5-5vw8aQJq7L6VLn-A.text: I waited 6 years..  heard about this cafe for a while now. And it did not disappoint.  Jacob was awesomr server. Good customer service.. good food..  Red velvet macadamia nut pan cake .. big stack small stack.. soooo good.chicken fried steak. Loco moco and corned beef hash...will definitely  come back. Awesome..good job Babystacks!

pR89QirRnx6Msy_2X5vqWw.text: We came to visit my mom in Las Vegas.  She never ventures much; creature of habit.  I looked up breakfast places and decided on BabyStacks Cafe.  BabyStacks did not disappoint!!  Fabulous little cafe with an amazing menu.  I ended up with the hazel cakes and biscuits and gravy. Everyone in our party loved their meal.  I will definitely be back!

3yaThh5erNgk5VH0P0uKgw.text: We ordered the double fried rice omelette thing, eggs Benedict, and the Nutella crepes with banana. App very good. Worth the trip from the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict, Nutella crepes with banana and the double fried rice omelette thing.

V4w4nZu5K4PNm_XzbF10AQ.text: Hands down 5 stars, everything flowed. Melanie (our server), was very friendly, polite, and highly attentive.  Great 1st time. Oh, did I mention they were playing Reggae music as well! Where else can you get great cooking, as well as great music playing that won't bore you?  I'll be back next visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the best, most affordable breakfast I was able to find in the Vegas area.

yFdam4M5qTBu8eQ6F6yWcQ.text: Service was really great but the quality of food was disappointing:( for most part seemed like food was sitting under heat lamp or made hours ahead. I'd be willing to give it another try sometime in the future.

22MAKmBQ_EisGFy-V5fx4w.text: Best pancakes in town & they have a large selection  of flavors. The Loco Moco is amazing! The service is always friendly & fast.

38DDykGFGvOu1oQeu2tOWw.text: We came to babystacks in the early afternoon. We were seated immediately. We both got coffee that was fresh and hot. The cups were kept full throughout the meal. Our food was fantastic. We had pb and banana pancakes as well as the mocha chip pancakes. All of it was delicious. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocha chip pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pb and banana pancakes

tdAZmKkpAVcWYT-MCHrA8w.text: Red velvet pancakes and white chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes are amazing.  There are so many options!!!  Try the adobo fried rice omelette and add pancakes of your choice.   Great customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette, red velvet pancakes, white chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes, corned beef hash...delicious!!!

r3UjwVmbwRahm_ylus6lMg.text: When we first got here the line was going outside of the door. There were about 6 people ahead of us and the seating area was full! It must be that good.  The setting looked alright very simple and clean. It gives you a warm Hawaiian feel because I am from the island of Oahu myself.   The menu listed my favorite: CHILI MOCO and also some local favorites in there as well. I believe that I would rate the chili MOCO a 7 out of 10 because the plate looked too big for the portion. I think that there should be more flavor in the meat and provided a bigger portion of food.  Overall it was great but I would have wanted the portion a little bigger.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili MOCO
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken

gk90qi0jjxLjQPdUy5qdDg.text: Delicious all the way around!! Got the famous red velvet pancakes.. OMGEEEEEEE!!! They tasted so awesome just with the whipped cream they placed on top!! Hubby got the loco moco with the garlic rice and it was sooooooooo delicious!! A must if your visiting Vegas!! Totally worth the drive!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco without the egg and Garlic Rice
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Short Stack!!

Uw7YLJUZNnAxQBqRKKg7oA.text: Fast and great service.  My husband and I came here by the suggestion of our family in Vegas, I read the reviews and Yelp, and I was not disappointed.   First of, it's a small, cozy venue.  Greeted really nicely.  Reasonably priced.  We could not decide on the flavors of pancakes so we had 3 short stacks: banana cream pie, red velvet, and bacon pancakes. Plus we had a side order of the Portuguese sausage.  Everything was delicious.  My husband loves the red velvet.  It was not super sweet, just perfect favors. Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our last meal!!

SIhWRW8pUybXjRS4LeDpaQ.text: A great excuse to get off the Strip! We've been wanting to try Loco Moco ($9) for a long time and finally got the chance. It was good, but the burger patties were a bit lacking. Looking forward to trying to make my own version at home.The pancakes are of course the real reason to come! Hubby upgraded the side to Red Velvet Pancakes for an extra $2 and loved them.  I got the Lemon Ricotta pancakes ($8) and they were delicious. I added a side of strawberries and whipped cream ($2.50) to go with them and they really made the lemon flavor pop. Turned my 4-star pancakes into a 5-star dish! It's a small spot but the food came quickly and the service was good!

3Sr3zAXnv-P_omYesA3mxg.text: Awesome place and friendly service, my kids love their specialty pancakes!  I like how friendly and attentive the servers are.  Even when it's busy it is worth the wait:)

1XIQ2wvPNcUbOZ9mriiB8A.text: Definitely one of the restaurants we were looking forward to when we moved back to North Las Vegas. Great breakfast and lunch options, and Hawaiian plates. It's nice to have steamed white rice available to switch up with their potato options. The array of pancake options from smores to red velvet to banana fosters makes it impossible to choose your favorite because they're all delicious! Also the servers are excellent, they are patient with our kids and always check back on you so your drinks are top off and you're not left chasing for service. I do know this is a physical constraint with the size of the overall place, but think wisely when you're going there during a breakfast rush. The front of house always quotes an extremely long wait time, but due to the in and out, high traffic, you never know if it's actually going to be 10 minutes or longer. Also the seating is not comfortable during the rush as the tabletops are small and limited seating.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana foster pancakes

-sRRUht4yGVJT5T-1sTlXw.text: We loved Baby Stacks and Danielle was a wonderful waitress .. so friendly and accommodating!! The food was excellent and we will be back for more !!

WaSUUQCDhOBjIl8BAH2IIQ.text: Seriously this place is the best. I've been here 3 times in the past week and have gotten the Adobo twice. It's amazing if you like island flavors. Very Savory. Recommend upgrading your side to a special baby stack. So far every one I have tried has be delicious.   Your moms gunna love this place- at least that's what she told me when I saw her last night

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo, s&#39;mores baby stack and the breakfast burrito.

4fEHfbh5IgH1dxL8SEQOBg.text: I've gone there 2 times now a decent price not cheap but not too expensive I love the foot there thought it's delicious and worth the money

HsO2wgaMV1D-wipQahkakQ.text: Red velvet pancakes every time  a little dry so make sure you drench it in sauce haha

h-k4i6b9m0vrCQLPFWPQkg.text: First time here- did not disappoint! I was surprised how fast I got in here, and I'm glad since fasting and hungry !!Lots of options,  glad I looked to yelp for reviews! I tried the Huntington omelette as a skillet - bacon cheesy potatoes topped with eggs and avocado- with sides of pico and sour cream . Delicious! You also get pancakes! I tried the bacon pancakes- amazing !! You should try it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington Skillet

N4XKWKTFzaZh_BdjULxl9A.text: I really like this place and this is the first less than meal I have head there. I usually get the adobo fried rice and it is always good. Today my wife had the Loco Moco and it was great. I tried the biscuits and gravy and it was poor. The biscuits tasted like they were the nasty cheap frozen kind and the the gravy was bland and luke warm upon arrival. I believe this is an isolated incident as the other dozen or so times I have been there the food was good. So I rate them A-OK.

adn32pv1vU2-2QXGecotng.text: Excellent food and service. Red velvet pancakes worth the visit. Love the Hawaiian selections in the menu.

sbbSN_8jH5oCO8_neLp2xQ.text: I don't think it's possible to hate BabyStacks. The breakfast is done well, they have tons of unique pancake concoctions, the price is reasonable and they do a military discount. The only downside is the size of the facility; it creates a bit of a wait if you're there on the weekend. In any event, it's WORTH the wait!

scz4-1ONTtnUpf1NWTSJUQ.text: Nice Hawaiian vibe. Staff are friendly and efficient. The red velvet pancakes are a must and everything else is average in taste and a staple in breakfast. They offer spam,eggs, and rice. With a few flat screen tv around the small but cute restaurant

DcYtIQlF5SDMCYscN2XKIw.text: Affectionate 4 stars. Playful unique pancakes. I had the red velvet and it was worth every calorie. Also serves island style breakfasts. I had the adobo omelet and it was the best I've had in a long time. Went on a Tuesday morning and there was NO WAIT. Feels homey and everyone is real nice. The coffee wasn't good though. I didn't notice you pay at the register at the front and they had to tell me. I want to take my dad here.

XYDNLKzfo0wc6sFk7fD-PA.text: Saturday morning breakfast Decadence!  I'm usually a pretty healthy eater, but when it's time for a treat this place is fantastic!  It was Saturday morning and we were prepared for a wait, but the weather was nice and it was worth it.  The service is great.  Friendly knowledgable staff who make you feel at home.  The red velvet pancakes are wonderful!  Not too sweet.  I had the garlic rice and eggs and it was savory and perfect.  My husband indulged in a Full Stack of the Rocky Road pancakes.  Really good, but rich and he took half home.  A short stack is plenty.  This place is close for us and I look forward to going back and trying more of their menu!

6JYZ5Z4QUw-FRoqtpcxOTg.text: Love this place!  Stumbled across it on Yelp and thought that the reviews were so good we couldn't pass it up.  Everyone was raving about the red velvet pancakes, and they were right!  They are incredible.  I also got portugese sausage, eggs, and garlic rice, and all of it was wonderful (except the eggs were not quite as firm as a like.)  My boyfriend got the adobo omelet and it was really good too.  The wait is long but worth it - I'll definitely be back.  I'm already dying to try both the Smores pancakes and the Macadamia / white chocolate pancakes.

a8ba2s1mDk5St3MwgBfE9A.text: Probably the best breakfast place in Las Vegas.. Definitely a hidden gem

GnLsGkzOwuxvZ_MxpbG_IA.text: I thought this place was just ok. My iced tea was weird, when I lifted my straw out, it had a stringy kind of slime from it? I didn't have anymore. I ordered the huevos rancheros with red sauce. They delivered it with green. Everything was under seasoned, but they have salt and pepper on the table.  No big deal. The over medium eggs where cooked right. I didn't care for the hightop tables and chairs or the soap operas on the hd tv's. Over all, it's better than a Denny's or Ihop I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again.

HLXAGG3BkNKq3uTZQjvgRA.text: Just tried babystacks cafe and the food was delicious. My daughter kept give  me this look of satisfaction as she eats the cookies and cream pancakes while saying mmmmm soooooooo good. The presentation of the meal was beautiful and the taste was very satisfying for your palet. Also on top of that our server Melanie was very polite and very knowledgeable of the food and gave good recommendations for our meal. On top of that she always had a beautiful smile every time she came to our table which made my meal experience more pleasurable. Then the hostess was polite and very accommodating always letting me know my table status. Overall my visit to babystacks cafe was wonderful and can't wait to come back and with more new customer for them.

cNMTu80EbCtf9xrqTJ40SA.text: Didn't wait long to get seated which is a big plus considering a lot of the reviews about waiting. Loco moco was flavorful. Adobo omelet was so so, I found myself adding hot sauce to add more flavor to it. Breakfast burrito with Portuguese sausage didn't have much sausage in it so all I tasted was the potatoes. Out of the three specialty pancakes ordered--red velvet, white chocolate, hazelnut--the latter, hazelnut was ah-mazing! Would definitely come back for stacks of those deliciousness! Red velvet was moist but was too sweet for my buds, next time I don't think I'll slather the cream cheese. The whit chocolate is nothing to rave about..just plain pancake with white chocolate chips on top. Atmosphere was cozy, friendly staff, and fresh food!

NHgdQMx-dFoJ0xskFw_Peg.text: During my recent trip to Vegas, I decided to try Babycakes Cafe and it was definitely good.  I had the ham (delicious complete with grill marks), eggs, and potatoes and upgraded my pancakes to carrot cake.  The pancakes were alright, but the cream cheese syrup is delicious so that made them better.  My friend had the banana pancakes and said they were very good.  I may try it again to try the red velvet pancakes, but it was a little ways from the strip and I've had other breakfasts in Vegas that were better and closer, but overall it was alright.

lUMqI6PtPw_lMExl0vsP4Q.text: It is hit or miss with this place. Sometimes I get really good pancakes, other times not so much. I usually order the peanut butter and banana pancakes. Sometimes there is peanut butter in them, other times there is not. The red velvet everybody raves about is good. Pretty sweet. It is like you are eating dessert for breakfast. I think they definitely need to get a bigger space. The line can be really long. Quick service is a plus. I will be back.

2POu24Jv8I7gye3ttkq8tg.text: After reading reviews about the Red Velvet pancakes I knew I'd stop by, it was just a matter of time. I had the Mexican omelet; it's made up of carnitas, jalapenos and jack cheese topped with sour cream. I was able to sub the pancakes I wanted for the regular buttermilk that comes with the omelets for a small charge. Glad I did they were delicious, covered in whipped cream and chocolate shavings. Hubby had the HN1 omelet and he really liked it. My mom had pancakes with strips of bacon cooked in! Awesome :) The restaurant is pretty small, though, so be prepared to wait. Very good breakfast spot, though I think my favorite in Vegas is still The Cracked Egg.

jSWLNYoV2AU1tUXHdwvF-Q.text: Ruben sandwich a sloppy mess.Burnt meat. Fries cold and 2 salty. Club Sandwhich looked good.Great Fried Potato chips.. very good on them

YA7obyp2qWQAbwgfBhbOug.text: We found this place using Yelp the month they opened and have been back several times.  They have great food!  Love the Red Velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup and the Contry Fried steak.  Only problem with the place is that we live too far away from it! (we live in California)

6GFYUSK3Jr6Nu16NmZDTtQ.text: A lush place to have breakfast, lunch, or brunch. lets see. been coming here for sunday brunch on a regular. so far, i've had the red velvet pancakes, loco moco, and s'mores pancakes. pancakes come with a side of cream cheese syrup- extras available upon request, gorgeous. this place pushes the envelope for you traditional pancakes. instead of pancakes with a side of bacon, they actually have pancakes with bacon bits hidden inside. delicious as its name, but a little too sweet for my brunch taste. so on my last visit, i had the lolo moco: rice, meatloaf patty, side of eggs made to my choice, and all of that drenched in gravy. comes with a side of mac salad. the food portion actually meets my appetite needs, for what i pay for. however, the mac salad isn't that special. the sweet customer service reflects its cafe name, so need i say more. its a comfy zone and has two big screens to watch sunday football. servers are more than happy to switch the channels between other tv networks. i've had great experiences so far, so i definitely have no reason to give any less stars.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fake flowers ;)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores

r_WHY4IPG0pI3ZgyeYgs1A.text: Nice local breakfast place off the strip. Works out well if you're heading up to Mount Charleston. Both types of French toast are good. Get the whole wheat if you like a crunchy coating. It's a small place so come early.

E4HxHk3JDunYQRmh_jPMfw.text: i'm a fan!   the red velvet pancakes was DELICIOUS. not too sweet, just cooked to perfection. the short stack was just the right amount cause otherwise i'd be in pancake overload. the bf and i also tried the kahlua pork benedict. i wasn't a fan of this dish. the pork was bland and the hollandaise sauce was whatever. the seasoned potatoes was okay, could use more seasoning. hah. overall, if it wasn't for the red velvet pancakes, i probably wouldn't go back.

wq3TxHRHh8iq9wHTXzQGYQ.text: There is a breakfast cafe in Hawaii called Cinnamons, and this by far is the closest thing to it I have found here in Vegas, it transports me back to Hawaii whenever I eat here, and get the Red Velvet pancakes or Spam and eggs or Eggs Benedict which is my favorite by far. And just like Hawaii you have to get there early to get a table LOL

WKZJ0ocRXYTTyJFIx80sVA.text: Normally I am on Team Waffle, but on this visit (my first one) I decided to try some pancakes. I got the strawberries and cream pancakes with the cream cheese syrup instead of the strawberry syrup it usually comes with. The pancakes were slightly chewy and on the thinner side, which is actually how I prefer them.   My boyfriend got the corned beef hash and eggs, which did not come out at all the way he was expecting. Normally corned beef looks like shredded beef, but this looked more like ground beef. He also said that his rice was hard. For the price, we were expecting the portions to be a little more generous; it didn't seem like that was the case for all dishes, though.   Not anything amazing, but good for breakfast/ brunch if you're in the area.

AFp6gORW_iOIl-zHDhMKWQ.text: I have stopped by here for two Sunday breakfast's.  Quick seating, Quick service and good food.  It is really tough to screw up eggs, toast and potatoes.

T-AyPdeKytqqU4QPax0jYw.text: Great food but the restaurant is small and you feel packed in there.  The wait is long and I won't being go back.

LJg6W5-KzDbyEFxH-1bvMw.text: Omg the red velvet pancakes are everything  I've been here so many times and there always delicious also had the steak but my favorite was the pancakes

PU8cdgC5ReaqWO0K8fbA_w.text: My thoughts when I took my first bite, "oh no, what have we done?!" The food is amazing and there are so many great options to try. Great service, just wish the location was bigger. Seems to always be a long wait because it's crammed into a cafe the size of a Starbucks. Very enjoyable staff. I prefer the Durango location. Less wait & more open.

KUKya8lvykce0sa2ro-FVQ.text: I'm kicking myself for never being to this place after all the times I've been to Vegas!   This is definitely a must when you're in town.   Tons of dishes to choose from and all will make you full.. Easy to get to this place is honestly a great gem hidden in the desert.   The servers are friendly and accommodating.   There are only a few seats so get here early to avoid a long wait.   Parking does get packed so carpool if you can.   If you're on the strip it'll take you about 15 minutes without traffic.   Trust me... This place is a must!   Try their fresh squeezed juice with any of their specialties.   Be sure to tip well.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm

FNaMJ7SSTvAkbiEqwkVvjQ.text: I normally go to the location in Centennial Hills and the food and service are great.  I was disappointed in this location.  The restaurant wasn't as clean as the CH location.  It wasn't busy and our server seemed to forget to bring almost everything we asked for.  The food was served lukewarm. Because I really like their food, I will give them another chance to impress me.  I'm hoping these comments will help them fix the issues.

NzgJ9TqKHZRtHk8E-SEdvw.text: Yay for BabyStacks! What a great place... Figured out from the menu and music and after asking the server, that owners are from or have ties back to Hawaii. You could see it written all over the menu - rice, portuguese sausage, spam, kalua pig -- I even saw adobo fried rice!  But what they specialize in here are their pancakes. Not a huge pancake fan (I don't mind them as sides but not as a full meal), I wasn't sure what to do. I ended up with one of their skillets. It is potatoes on the bottom with you eggs and whatever else you chose on top. It's not technically in a skillet though. Each skillet (and most other main entrees) come with a short stack of pancakes. You can upgrade to any of their "fancy" pancakes too (they must have over 20 types!). Being near the holidays they had chocolate peppermint pancakes so I went with that (one of my fav flavor combos).   The skillet was good but the pancakes even better. Ok, they almost tasted like cupcakes so maybe that's why they were so yum!  I hear the lines can get long so go during an off hour or expect to wait. Ample parking in the parking lot in front (free).  I wish they would bring Baby Stacks to Hawaii!!!

Ew9fV4tDQu-puFiPZjNAJA.text: Babystacks is golden! I try to change it up everytime, but the adobo fried rice omelet is the best! My favorite stack is this cinnamon bun ones, although I've tried several others and was not disappointed. The pancakes can be a little overly sweet, but definitely a treat. Every location I've tried had been consistent with flavors and service. I love their attitudes. Everyone treats you like you're family and that's my favorite kind of service. As if they need another 5 stars. Definitely stop at babystacks!

uCIlywpl7WRY4DvAhX0zMA.text: The inside is pretty small, but the food was decent. I got the build your own skillet with strawberry pancakes and my fiance got a skillet as well. I liked mine, but he said his wasn't good at all- and he normally never complains about restaurant food. Also I was pretty disappointed that I couldn't substitute French toast instead of the pancakes that came with the skillet- I wouldn't have minded an upcharge but the server said they couldn't do it at all. The whole reason I came was bc I wanted French toast so that was a little disappointing. Anyway, decent service but I probably won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own skillet and strawberry pancakes

_W9sgWkRqfMAfjyGsae-oQ.text: The RICOTTA PANCAKES are the best I've ever had.   I like mine with extra lemon and warm butter and its oh soooo good. It tastes similar to a dutch baby but thinner.   My usual entree is the Mexican Skillet. The salsa they have mixed in there makes the whole dish. It's spicy and citrus-y. The portion is good, not huge like other breakfast places but a good serving for the average person.

GuP9JhOxpCTcXtd2HJ7JFw.text: Super place for breakfast or lunch!  The pancakes are fantastic! I like the Honey-Wheat ones which taste like Buckwheat but the flavored ones might be to your liking.

JDjkX6REVqIbZa-RKvMr8Q.text: This place is always so good. LOVE the Red Velvet Pancakes abs the fact that I can get Garlic Rice

eEnIZRY5PnnHvVP3hcT3Sw.text: Decided to check this place out given the amazing reviews, we were staying near by and most importantly because they had local food from hawaii.  Being from hawaii, it's hard to find good food from back at home that hasn't lost its taste along the way. Our server was Jacob, who was the sweetest & very helpful!   Pancakes: White Chocolate Chip Macadamia Nut- overall it was alight,but it did get tough after a couple of minutes. Wished there was a special sauce to go with it but that's just my preference.  Rocky Road - probably the best pancake we had on the table, it was soft, chocolatey & the marshmallow cream scoop on top made it even better!  Orange Dreamsicle- tastes exactly what it sounds like, cream and orange.   Food:   Kalua Pig Benedict w/no cabbage. It was overall good, but I'm a Benedict fanatic and found that the hollandaise seemed like it was missing something (maybe some citrus?) I couldn't put my finger on what it was. The Kalua pig itself was ono! Not tough, moist and flavorful. Kalbi & Rice- the kalbi was marinated well and the flavors were there. The rice was a little hard like it didn't have enough water when cooking so it wasn't as moist as I'm used to but non the less, it was good! Huntington Omelette- good, liked that the pico was on the side!  Side of Portuguese Sausage- it wasn't what I was expecting, it tasted more like a link Sausage than a regular Portuguese sausage. I'm used to Redondo, Hawaiian style brand or Gouveas but something about this one didn't taste like what I'm used to.   Overall the experience was good, the food was good for somewhere that offers local hawaii food in the mainland & id come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of the food we got

g6_-4FGqOXEb7ytwtss0Ww.text: Delicious food. My taste buds were clowning. Great service. Thank you, I enjoyed every bit of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes and the adobo entree was amazing

PMGdASnpx_z6FA7PP4MHtA.text: Wait was long, so they offered the patio. With hungry kids, we decided to take the table rather than continue waiting. It. Was. Hot. No fans, misters, the tables were clunky and the patio was an overall mess. Kids menu has no healthy options and when I asked for a side of fruit instead of the potato options, I had to pay extra. The food was REALLY BLAND, had to douse with a lot of salt and pepper to taste anything. Overall, don't get the hype and won't be going back.

cnYF8asrA1l-ljMkrd_0hA.text: It's the best place to go to for brunch in Vegas! Every time I visit I come to the place. I want to try every single thing on the menu. I like to create my own omelet or a go for some pancakes. Usually a long wait because this place is so popular, so understandable. The food is worth the wait. The staff is always very kind. Sometimes forgetful, not like forgetting your food but more like forgetting to refill your glass of water repeatedly. Always a great experience here ! I will be back when I return to the west coast!

yM66NyL9p_YGp4-j8TLW9A.text: I had the Huntington Omelet, so good~ Egg was fluffy with the avocado, hmmm~ The Staff was really nice and helpful.  It was my first time to visit BabyStacks

A9desAIJlCLgII7KXIkLRQ.text: Best red velvet pancakes in town. A must go to when off the beaten path of Vegas. Can be a little busy in the weekends for breakfast and brunch, but worth the wait.

lL54wqV-UL8Ysw-hfahPyg.text: Love this place everything is fresh as well as the smiles wait can be a while but it def is worth it

Skr-hvuY1Iyn9tWDawbPgQ.text: So I've been to Vegas plenty of times and was sick of eating blah food for breakfast and waiting till dinner time to enjoy the buffet or a fancy restaurant, so I did my research and also asked my local familia for some great recommendations and this was one of them!  I was hooked from the moment my girl told me about a cafe that served red velvet pancakes! (shout out to my naning Mary Rose F.!) So I knew it was a must... I am the queen of breakfast... I love breakfast for lunch and/or dinner :)  So we got there closer to closing time (2pm on weekdays) because nobody vacationing in Vegas gets up earlier than noon (well, definitely not me!) so we beat the morning congestion and were seated promptly. I guess we got lucky because I've read that the wait can get pretty bad.  I ordered the red velvet pancakes and my sweetheart ordered the s'mores pancakes. DAMN! Both were sooo good. The red velvet pancakes were like eating perfectly flattened cupcakes smeared with cream cheese syrup and whipped cream! Each bite melted in my mouth... perfection!    The service was great too! My coffee cup was always filled and we didn't wait too long for our food to come out. Also, they were very accommodating and  even though we showed up closer to closing time, they didn't rush us at all which I appreciated very much.   Definitely a must-try especially if you're visiting from out of town. Yeah, so it's located on the other side of town from the strip but it's definitely worth the drive!

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes

e9LP3ZxwFEI8oD2zbIAG0g.text: Baby Cakes is a far drive from the strip and the place is small, but it is worth it for the food. I had to try the red velvet pancakes that everyone is talking about.  Wow they are great!  I also got to try some of the other items that were on the menu:   Hash browns crispy and thin 9/10 HM1 Tasty 8/10 Kalua Pig Benedict pork was tender and moist 8/10 Ricks adobo fried rice came rapped up in an egg omelet 7/10 Macaroni salad 5/10 Red Velvet pancakes 9/10 (made a great snack before dinner)  If this place were in my hood, I would go all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancake

_B3REhO2-B-r0dSChfAgpg.text: I wish there was a place like this in So Cal!  My husband and I were in Vegas and on the way to Death Valley.  We wanted to find a GOOD breakfast spot that wasn't a buffet or touristy place on the strip.  We found this place on Yelp and were lured in by the red velvet pancakes and eggs benedicts.  We got there at about 10:30 am on a Friday morning and waited about 20 minutes for a table. I noticed that the menu and the music (island reggae) in the restaurant has a Hawaiian theme.  I saw Kahlua pig and Loco Moco on the menu - and they're particularly Hawaiian food.   I ordered the Kahlua pig eggs benedict, and my husband ordered the country benedict.  We ordered a half stack of red velvet pancakes, which ended up arriving a bit before our two plates.    I'm actually not a big fan of pancakes, but I ate those pancakes like a starved person!  I loved that they were soft and moist and tasted like what I hoped red velvet pancakes would taste like - and not like I was eating a overly sweet cake like I was afraid I might be.  But like red velvet cake or cupcakes, it's more about the soft and moist texture along with what makes the cake - the cream cheese frosting.  The cream cheese frosting/syrup wasn't too sweet and pour out on the pancakes about the consistency of ranch salad dressing.  The little chocolate chips sprinkled on top were definitely made the pancakes irresistible.   As for the Kahlua benedict, they were good but not great.  When in Hawaii, Kahlua pig is one of my favorite things to eat.  Even living in So Cal, I've never found any Hawaiian place that has ever done Kahlua pig the way it's done in Hawaii.  Carnitas at some authentic Mexican restaurants are probably the closest, but still not the same. I was a bit disappointed with my benedicts since they also had a lot of cabbage in them, giving the Kahlua pig a slight bitter taste rather than the juicy pig taste I was hoping for.  The Kahlua pig tasted pretty bland otherwise, and was a bit soggy rather than meaty like I hoped.  As for my husband's country benedict, it tasted I guess as it should - like country fried steak with eggs.  As for the hash browns (I didn't wanna risk ordering the potatoes, since I've rarely found a restaurant that did breakfast potatoes well), they were perfect. It was fried to a perfect crispiness on one side and moist and potatoey on the inside.  These were probably some of the best hash browns I've ever had!  Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would definitely make the 20 min trip off the strip to go there again next time I'm in Vegas. I'm certain a breakfast place like this would do really well in So Cal. :)

8A5XQH4EgUgaKbXtouOasQ.text: Went here for Sunday brunch and was not dissapointed. The n buffalo location had an hour wait so we drove to the flamingo location. Upon arrival wait time was 15-20 mins. Well worth the wait. Pancakes were fluffy and packed with just the right amount of flavor. I also had the adobo fried rice omelet. It was ok. Seemed to be lacking something. A little salt and pepper did the trick temporarily. No complaints otherwise. Would definitely come back. Remember hours of operation are from 7-3.

zqvm4rS5ThrYJLr4LU_QFg.text: Came to meet a friend from across town. A sign on the window stated that they only would seat complete parties. I was fine with that until a party of two arrived, telling the host that a third person would be joining them. He sat them anyway. I asked to also be seated so that I could have some coffee while I waited. A hostess refused. I pointed out the inconsistency but she still refused. My friend and I will meet elsewhere.

8Vm_BYmzLVw1JHYvr0FfiA.text: mehhhhhh. This place is just... ok to me. I agree with Arnold D...I don't understand the hype. I've been here a couple times . I've tried biscuits and gravy, Kahlua pig Benedict, a turkey sandwich, corned beef and hash, fried rice & of course the infamous red velvet pancakes. It's not that it didn't taste good it was just that nothing stood out. Nothing was amazing or 5 star worthy, just your standard diner tasting food. I love the concept of the place and the little fusion thing going on. But to be honest I prefer breakfast at The Egg and I or Blueberry Hill..

V4UCTrzMY-PrK3jwAle5qw.text: Arrived on a Wednesday morning at 9am. Was seated right away and had the same server as last time. Love this place. Pancakes are irresistible

2FVI_VmobkdfQCAVQdr5Fw.text: OK, not thrilled average at best. Somewhat small portions and small premises. Good but faked service.  Would have preferred Dennys

jaGAvQwW20RpMdwIMP-vsA.text: Love the cinnamon roll pancakes. Always make my food just the way I love it. It's very clean.

6Fzc1xz5aaWCnm4qOxtoqA.text: Hostess: "It's 'restaurant policy' not to seat you until you're 'a complete party.'" Me: "My daughter is on her way and I only have 50 minutes to eat before my dentist appointment." Hostess: "I'm sorry, Ma'am. I can't seat an 'incomplete party.' Restaurant policy." Ever heard about that little policy called, "customer service?" It prioritizes the customer's needs above the restaurant's financial gain! Am I being unreasonable?

YFyODKHeSj8tQq0TksUDJw.text: On weekend peak breakfasting hours this wait time here is normally between 45 mins - 1.5 hours.  The dining area is very small.    When we were finally called for our seating on a Sunday morning at 10am, we promptly placed our orders.  Everyone ordered various stacks of baby that arrived about 45 minutes later...except my order.  The server immediately realized that he had made a mistake in the order entry and quickly expedited my overlooked order.  My dish was delivered about 10-15 minutes later, just before everyone in our party of 5 finished eating.  I opted for the bacon pancakes.  I don't know if I'm just crazy because everyone else loves their pancakes, but they were dense & heavy, like pizza dough.  I prefer my pancakes on the light & fluffy side.

0eG7VLNLLDjuSB6_3kqUcw.text: Yay my search for the best breakfast place has ended, but doesn't mean I'm going to stop trying other places. Babycakes has all the above...great service, clean, great selection of food, and location is not bad.   My sister and I went here on a Friday morning (10ish), wait time was 15 minutes (not too bad). I heard on the weekends it get really packed which I could imagine since the place is pretty small. So we ordered the Rick's adobo fried rice and a short stack of red velvet pancakes. The fried rice was mMmMm yummy and as for the red velvet pancakes OMG worth it.   I am definitely going to come here again and try the many different kinds of pancakes they have and other things on the menu.

JdZwr1hKj-dpg5UmI4LpHw.text: Fast service friendly waitress.  Pancakes are to die for.  Small and quaint.  A real neighborhood place.  Will definitely be back.

kMd_6jEIleSS-8m-On6pSQ.text: When Babycakes Cafe first opened in October, we were invited to join the Husband's cousins in experiencing this new breakfast joint.  Unfortunately, we couldn't make it out that morning but heard raving reviews from them and soon after, it was blowing up on Yelp!  It's been on our radar since, and when a groupon for Babycakes showed up, we scooped up on this coupon!  Yesterday was the big day - most importantly, we wanted to avoid the weekend rush.  Reviews about an hour long wait weren't something we were interested in, and luckily, it was only a ten minute wait for our party of three on a Wednesday around noon.  We decided to share three items that were unique to Babycakes Cafe than other breakfast joints in town.  * Red Velvet Pancakes "Topped with whipped cream and chocolate crumbles.  Served with cream cheese syrup." (Full stack $7.95, Short stack $5.25) - First off, I'm not the biggest fan of pancakes and it's not my first choice in breakfast.  But hands down, these pancakes are REALLY good.  They aren't too fluffy or thick.  The sweetness is just perfection and sweetness from the cocoa, whipped cream, and syrup all add to this yummy cake.  I was sold and would definitely reorder this over and over again.  We went for the full stack to share, which was a very smart choice!   * Kalua Pig Benedict "A toasted English muffin topped with Hawaiian-style slow cooked shredded pork, English muffin.  Topped with our delicious hollandaise sauce." ($9.75) - The Husband and Truc N. were loving this dish.  As Truc was saying, he doesn't really like pork all that much but he really enjoyed their version.  They both complimented on how moist the meat was and enjoyed the savoriness.  The accompanying potatoes could use a something something though.   * Rick's Adobo Fried Rice "A traditional Filipino dish made with marinated shredded chicken wrapped in an egg, garnished with green onions." ($8.50) - This was the downfall of our breakfast.  It was a huge scrambled egg concoction with the fried rice mixture inside.  I was the first to split it open and there was a weird smell that came from it.  And then the taste, I wasn't quite getting it and wasn't sure if this was how it was supposed to taste.  When the Husband got into it, he ultimately said their burned it - the rice, the meat, just everything inside.  I'm still not sure if it was intentional to have the 'burnt' taste or not, but all of us were not impressed with it.  Not something we recommend.  Overall, they have some unique items that make them stand out - specifically the first two items we ordered and additional things like Honey French Toast, S'more Pancakes, Bacon Pancakes, seasonal items like Pumpkin Pancakes and Macadamia Nut Pancakes.  Service - it did take awhile for our food to come out.  And I can only imagine how much longer the wait may be on weekends after you get seated.  And yes, there is more than just the food here, the view is quite nice too for the men.  I don't recommend coming with a large group as it's a small restaurant and there isn't that much room for large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rick&#39;s Adobo Fried Rice ($8.50)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Pig Benedict ($9.75)

OwZtCTjDKkKZIC08Ao7bLA.text: Stopped by to grab some lunch with my Mom the other day.  I've read many of the Yelp reviews raving about the Red Velvet Pancakes and had to experience this for myself.  Based on the familiar items of SPAM, Portuguese Sausage, and other island style dishes....I'm guessing that the owners are from the Pacific Islands.  I ordered the Short Stack Red Velvet Pancakes (Topped with whipped cream and chocolate crumbles. Served with cream cheese syrup. $5.25), which are 3 Pancakes about 8 inches in diameter each.....and a side order of Portuguese Sausage.  Mom ordered the Jalapeno Burger ($8.75).  The food came out in short order and I eagerly started on my Red Velvet Pancakes......they were freakin' AWESOME!  Wow, I was blown away with the Sweet, Soft, Velvety flavor and texture.  I should have ordered a full order dammit.  I then took a few bites of the Portuguese Sausage.....it was disappointing.  I didn't enjoy the flavor of it at all and it didn't taste like the Portuguese Sausage I was accustomed to eating when I'm in Hawaii.  Bummer.  Mom couldn't finish her Jalapeno Burger, so she gave me a few bites.  I thought it was OK, nothing special.  Certainly not worth $8.75.  Our server was friendly and on top of things.  Overall, a nice breakfast experience.  Will I return?  Those Red Velvet Pancakes are calling me.....

E9uwFYfdcxkG5NdF7eBPdw.text: I stopped in while on business and found this quintessential breakfast cafe with a little Pacific flair.  They offer a full menu of breakfast options with the addition of Spam or a Filipino style omelette.  I naturally opted for the Spam and eggs!  I left very pleased and will return the next time I am in town.

tCT8timJUME0RPExSk93Hw.text: Monday 1039am waited over a half hour for a seat! 9 empty tables! Place is a joke! Service is ok! Food just alright! Hostess is also cashier which adds to the wait time! For the price of food they can afford a hostess and a cashier!
