GqoBlWU1xsEeCuHiUXDLeQ.text: I really wanted to like this place more, but the food was just meh for me.  The side orders of sausages, eggs, etc. were not worth it for the price.  Simply, just go for the main dishes... which I did as well.  The omelets were flavorful, but their take on whole wheat french toast was unexpected.  I really wanted some soft and succulent french toast, but when I was presented with 3 pieces of hard fried looking bread, I was surprised.  I'd skip that dish.   If I were here again, I'd probably go for the pancakes like everyone else does.  I was just hoping that all the other dishes were good as well.  Also, be prepared for a short wait when you check in.

pLml4l6YotDohq4doG9Zpw.text: YUMMY! On our mission to try as many "Yelp" favorite restaurants we can, we of course had to stop by Babycakes Cafe. Babycakes had been blowing up on Yelp recently for their Red Velvet pancakes and Kahlua Pig Eggs Benedict. So, off we went...  At first site of the red velvet pancakes, my sweet bud sensors went off. ALARM- this may be way to sweet to eat! I was afraid, I was petrified. The beautiful red pancakes covered in chocolate pieces and whip cream with a side of cream cheese icing look....sweet. I WAS SURPRISED! The pancakes were not overly sweet at all. They were sooooo tasty. The cakes were rich tasting, almost like a cake. The icing was smooth and creamy and perfectly accented the cakes. YUM!  We also had the Kahlua pig benedict as well. It was pretty good too. I found the Kahlua pig to be a big to oniony but my boyfriend loved it .  Overall a great place to have breakfast / brunch. TIPS - we went on a Thursday and completely missed the over 1 hour wait on the weekends. This place is small and there is not a lot of seats so make sure to go early!  This Baby has her new favorite cakes - at Babycakes :)

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Khalua pig eggs benedict

bPK-RkKhz0r8G9-9LZvxQA.text: Amazing. Tried this off the strip place for breakfast from the reviews on Yelp. Yup is was delicious with very creative seasonal pancakes  yummy!!

o1t9iokhHXJdJLkCO8c90g.text: It seems like they changed their name from BabyCakes to BabyStacks, I guess to emphasize their pancakes... We were a party of 3 that waited about 30 mins when we arrived at noon.   I ordered ham and eggs with hash browns and s'mores pancakes. My mom ordered eggs with seasoned potatoes and regular pancakes and my sister ordered the red velvet pancakes. My over-easy eggs were made to perfection, 3 nice strips of ham steak was grilled and not overly salty, hash browns were ok - ketchup had to give it a boost and my s'mores pancakes were disappointing.  I was expecting something that was going to make my tastes buds happy and go "mmmmmmm" like how a s'more usually does... but that moment did not come.  My mom's seasoned potatoes had no flavor.  My sister's red velvet pancakes were a big flop; it was super bright in color (too much food coloring) and very lacking in flavor, if I was blindfolded, I would not have thought it was red velvet.  I guess I'm a little spoiled with red velvet pancakes from Cinnamon's out in Kailua, Hawaii - which is melt in your mouth chocolate heaven!  I really wanted to like this place but it's just all hype - I'll wait until I go back to O'ahu to get some real red velvet pancakes, I'm going to bring my sister next time she's there so she will know what I'm talkin' about.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes

P6ZC6h7zKmuqrp-67ZipJQ.text: This is the best breakfast place in town ! Awesome pancakes so many to pick from, but again my favorite is the s'mores short stack and turkey bacon also great coffee. I'm such a regular there they see me coming they have my order memorized and there always friendly and big smiles. But don't plane on just walking in the door and sitting down there is always so busy . omg long waiting they are  always packed with people but definitely well worth the waiting.  Whenever I have company I always take them here.

5LmjeqqHvHPitAtGVLRyxA.text: This place is PACKED for breakfast on weekends so get there early if you dont want to wait. Awesome food at fair prices and plenty of interesting things to try. We arent big sweet eaters so we've stayed on the non-pancake side of the menu, but everything we've had has been great. Fun, kid friendly atmosphere

sOCTBmMc_Jse6HEXmS9XXw.text: Yummmmm! I absolutely love babystacks! Their food never disappoints my family nor I! The last two times I have gone for breakfast I get the Mexican Skillet! It has so much flavor and the carnitas are properly cooked. The skillets come with pancakes so my kids always have something to eat without having to order their own meal (they are 1 and 3 and can't eat a huge portion).   The prices are reasonable especially for how fresh and consistent the food is.  The only reason I took away a star is because the wait time is always so long!!! They definitely need a bigger location to accommodate their business!

kAtNbT6CfEyfOorkJC7fIw.text: Mahal kita!  My Filipino heart is so happy with this place. My family and I celebrated Memorial Day by having brunch here. From what I saw, most of the items on the menu are your typical breakfast/brunch items: eggs, bacon, crepes, etc. I'm sure they're all cooked great BUT I really encourage you to get the menu items that make this restaurant unique! It seems that a very popular choice is Chicken Adobo Fried Rice Omelette. Yup, thats: fried rice lathered in chicken adobo sauce and chicken, wrapped in an egg omelette - making it look like a burrito. It is indeed very good, and that's an endorsement coming from a Pinoy. For those not too familiar with Filipino food, the rice/chicken part WILL be salty, so if you're not in to salty foods, this may not be for you.  Despite being a big fan of that dish, my family members around me got it so I just picked off their plates. I myself got the Kalua Benedict with country potatoes. What makes the benedict special is its shredded pork. The pork is so tender and moist, its a unique substitution from what you typically have on benedicts.  My dad and uncle both got the Loco Moco, and although I didn't get to taste it, they both gave their endorsements. We all ordered nutella crepes, and that plate is very large! We were able to split it among 6 peoples as a perfect dessert.  What a gem! Mahal na mahal kita!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella crepe... Good enough for all 6 of us
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco that our dads ordered
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Benedict. The shredded pork is so tender and moist!

vHy1ftJ5DEME0BNwniBxAw.text: Delicious, filling, and reasonably priced.  This small cafe only seats 50, so if you have a large party expect a wait. Service is efficient and friendly. They have an expansive list of pancake options. Including everything from red velvet, s'mores, and bananas foster. We loved it and will definitely be back on our next Vegas trip.

oJycEe-lsIi-FD0Fe69kHA.text: Food is delicious.  But the building faces the east so the sun beats into the restaurant. I'm really surprised owner hasn't put some blinds up for there loyal customers. As we have been coming here for many years. Our server's Monica & Jacob are awesome. Merry Christmas & a HAPPY NEW YEAR

6aQP5SbaOWe5oZgiXoagog.text: LoVe this place!  This was our first time at this location and we kind of thought, oh no is it going to lose the family feeling with a second Las Vegas location...  BabyStacks did not disappoint us in the least!    The pancakes are delicious, inventive, genius!  I only wish they would introduce a variety platter of dollar sized yumminess.    The rest of their breakfast fare is amazingly tasty as well.  Generous portions and totally yum!  The servos was just as friendly as we remembered!  Whenever we are Vegas bound thesis my favorite breakfast!  Ever!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YuM!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Totally yum!

RxR0XSAOiea3z82KmNuEBQ.text: Whoever gave this place a low rating must not ENJOY GOOD FOOD!!!  It (my experience) started at the door with the friendliest hostess. Warm smile, energy, and even loaned me a pen!  Sat down and looked at a crazy cool selection of items. Different skillets, eggs Benedict options and staple egg dishes. Flipped the menu and the fun jumped to the "sweet" section. Pancakes, crepes, and French toast dishes.  Told my waitress that I was STRONGLY recommended by the hotel concierge to eat there. As I will do often I asked her what her favorite thing to eat was and she led me to the KALUA PIG BENEDICT (Yes...I was yelling it just then) and it was amazing. Shredded pork was awesome. Hollandaise sauce was velvety smooth with a perfect balance of acid and cream.  I also ordered a short stack of Red Velvet pancakes...don't judge me I walked 7 miles earlier.  Here's the deal...she could have given me the full short stack and charged me the 5.95 for the short stack but instead informed me of the option to go with pancakes over potatoes for only 1.50 instead!  That's service. These pancakes were amazing. Sweet, buttery, and the sweet cream icing...only used a bit but it was delicious!  Las Vegas...you gotta check out BABYSTACKS Breakfast and Lunch Cafe!!!

KMHk6__lE9z5ivD2Kw9R0g.text: If you have not tried this place YOU NEED TO. Lol it is hands down the best breakfast place in the city! They have awesome breakfast burritos, but my favorite is the red velvet pancakes!!!! Mmmmm so tasty, I'm craving them just writing this review!  I might just have to go again in the morning haha. But seriously I've been here so many times and never have had bad service or bad food. Everything is always on point!

jZK7dVvjq-AnAxY0Kkyd8g.text: Best breakfast in Las Vegas!  I found this place when my Dad moved to Summerlin a little over 4 years ago and we at least once every time I visit.   If you love pancakes, this is the place for you.  They have two dozen different types of pancakes.  The hazelnut, cookies and cream are my favorite.  My dad loves the strawberry and gets a short stack of those every time.   The service here is friendly with a smile on their faces and they are great about keeping coffee refilled.   Definitely a must if you are in the area!  I will miss it since we are moving my dad to California this weekend. Thanks for 4 1/2 years of great food and awesome service!

ZzeHclVCsA0hge5-uqaXSA.text: The food was a 3, service a 2.  Service first: understandable that as a busy restaurant, you require everyone in the party to be present before you can sit them. HOWEVER if it's 30 minutes before closing, the restaurant is practically empty, and the people who are present are willing to order for those coming in 5min or so, you'd think they'd sit the party instead of having them wait outside in the heat.  Food: got two of their signature items (red velvet pancakes and Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice). Both were just ok. The fried rice was a little too salty while, as a huge red velvet cake fan, I was a little disappointed by the pancakes (though the cream cheese "frosting" was good). Also tried my sister's baby chick skillet and again, just ok. Not sure why this is on best breakfast lists ...

oMQDI-U0PzSuHwidj2HD2g.text: Amazing food! Been several times & never have had to wait Guess I'm just lucky? Anywho, really good pancakes. Taste like moist pieces of cake to me than anything. Food always hits the spot

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig Benedict is wow! So yummy. Gf liked it more than her chicken fried steak

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut are my fav! So Effn good

HrYnEOj8zqJYfFdMz08Blg.text: RED VELVET PANCAKES with whip cream and mini chocolate chips!!   I'm a sucker for red velvet pancakes!  Finally went to Babycakes this past Friday :D My friend/high school classmate was visiting from Florida so I wanted to take him to a yummy breakfast spot! I've been wanting to try Babycakes for the last 2 months and have been waiting for someone to visit me in town so I could experience Babycakes with someone else. I didn't realize that Babycakes is 8 miles north of me... but it was worth the drive!  Came in around 10am... no wait. We both ordered the portuguese sausage, eggs and rice... I got the red velvet pancakes and my friend got the white chocolate chip mac nut pancakes. Both pancakes were delicious and you can't go wrong with the local favorite portuguese sausage eggs and rice.  I would love to come back again... when more friends visit me in town again.   Pay your bill at the counter. casual dining. stress free parking. good customer service.  If you're visiting Vegas or a local... make Babycakes on your to eat list!  I'll be back for more!!!  Aloha... -Miss Yelp 2011

XR5R3m_EQTOur-1_HiTy1g.text: I've been a few times with the BF since my initial review and it's slowly crept up into a favorite breakfast spot for us.   Firstly, I'm a Filipino so any place that has steamed or garlic rice is cool by my standards. This is a cool inbetween middle of Hawaiian breakfast and American style breakfast that is similar to what we would have at home. It's the varied options that bumps this place for us. I cannot eat pancakes alone for breakfast as it just is too much, too sweet, so it never seems worth it for us to get a full order at many places and they don't do short stacks of flavored ones. Here, many of the breakfast come with a option of a "babystack" (2 pancakes) and you can upgrade it to the many gourmet flavors for just $1.50 more. That amount with a savory breakfast seems perfect and costwise is great to get breakfast AND the flavored pancakes for under $10. Most places we would have to basically order pancakes as our third entree plate and that's usually too much to eat without others sharing.  I tend to favor their omelettes, as they are pretty fluffy and a good size or I let my Filipino all hang out and get a simple breakfast eggs and sausage type plate with rice.  Our go-to pancake flavor is the lemon ricotta. This one is a bit more crepe or german pancake like and is just very light in flavor. Lemon flavored sweets is a new thing for me, and this place definitely has helped convert me We normally get another rich flavor to contrast. However, the chocolately type pancakes here are not overly saccharine and dense. We had a almond joy flavor recently off their specials and it was fluffy, and just deliciously balanced. Nothing richly sweet like the chocolate bars. Chocolate pancakes is one of my least favorite kinds, but theirs is highly enjoyable for me. I've had their famous red velvet before, and honestly, every other flavor I've had surpassed that one so don't be afraid to delve out of the box.   Service has been pretty decent of a range of acceptable to great. It's always at least friendly consistently. We go during the afternoon mostly, so it's never been a wait but is busy. I'm not sure if this place is packed with a waiting during usual breakfast hours on weekends, but I imagine so. If you don't like waits, well breakfast at breakfast time is maybe not a good thing to do.  I have yet to try some of the specialties like the kahlua benedict, but mostly because I have trouble thinking about coming here and not getting a pancake. They sound great though that it just might be worth it! In fact, I think I may go this weekend again. I've been on a big breakfast kick lately since we've been waking up early.

My son ordered the Nutella crepes with strawberries which were amazing and my husband ordered an omelette, hash browns and buttermilk pancakes, again delicious.  We had a short wait to be seated and service was fast and our waitress was lovely.  The only reason I took a star off the review was due to the coffee which was barely warm and rather weak tasting.  I would love to keep returning and eventually try all the pancakes!

Q57VgWptYhQbIGMfja-DYw.text: Great food, always packed and they no longer split checks or let you sit without your entire party (even if its only two) present. But fantastic garlic rice and pancakes.

L7IOkAV2mes4eZCL6Wq5dA.text: Super breakfast, extensive menu with great options. We ordered the hash/eggs with side of red velvet pancakes and the country omelette. Both were huge amounts and delicious. The service was the best!  Each employee went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied. Definitely one of the best places to go for a breakfast (and there were no lines!)

O3BSbJHteHwRyAMolfb3Cw.text: Horrible customer service! Called twice this morning from two different phones and Erica states she is unable to hear anything... Ummmm from two different phones. Then when I called back the lines go straight to voicemail. Being that today is Father's Day is no excuse. This location is always busy, so please answer the phones in an area where the workers can hear clearly.

-9EGq3bnSjXTrd6tAwezDQ.text: We live super close to babystacks so this is our go-to place for breakfast. Service is always super nice and the food is always amazing. There is often a wait, even during the week, but it's never too long. The place isn't huge but it's so worth the wait. I always get the Kalua pig Benedict and last time I went I swapped out the English muffins for Hawaiian sweet rolls and that was one of the best decisions of my life. Seriously tasty. All them pancakes are good, so it's their Portuguese sausage. We go often and love being regulars. A must go to place for off the strip breakfast. Love all the Hawaiian options here. My kids kids love the s'mores pancakes and the special pineapple pancakes are my fave when they have them available.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig Benedict with Hawaiian sweet rolls.

I8GQOtsTbKeu0teELWOquw.text: I finally came here with my boyfriend after trying to drag him here for about five months (it's just too out of the way for us). We went on a Tuesday morning and there was still a 40min wait, which sucked because we both get hangry (a hybrid of hungry and angry) fairly quickly. We just sat silently perusing through the menu and smelling the delicious scent of fresh cooked food until they finally called us up.  Since we already went through the menus, we threw in our food orders when the waitress asked for our drinks. We both ordered Spam and eggs with pancake sides. I got the Red Velvet and he got the banana. I believe both of our orders were over $11 because we got specialty pancakes and he upgraded to garlic fried rice. I felt that $8.95 for the Spam and eggs was a little pricey considering we got 3 pieces of Spam each and you could easily get about 10 slices of Spam from a can that's only $2.50. We really wanted a taste of home though, so we both got it.   I specifically told the waitress I wanted my Spam crispy, but they gave it to me soft and floppy anyway, so I only ended up eating one piece. My boyfriend ate all his Spam, but hardly touched his rice because it wasn't what he expected (it had a lot of thick long strips of onions all over). I guess we're both used to the Filipino style garlic rice we always get at places like Nanay Gloria which just has small pieces of chopped up garlic and that's it. Having both chopped up garlic AND large strips of onions is just a recipe for halitosis.   On to the pancakes...  My Red Velvet pancakes were nice and moist. Even after piling on all the whipped cream and cream cheese syrup, they weren't too sweet either. They were definitely good, but it was the first time I've ever tried Red Velvet pancakes and I wasn't very blown away. There are a few other places in Vegas that also serve Red Velvet pancakes, so it's not exclusive to BabyStacks.   My boyfriend thought his Banana pancakes were alright. Rather than adding mashed bananas to the batter, they just put 8 small slices on top of the pancakes and serve it with syrup, so it's actually pretty plain.  I guess I had very high expectations for this place due to all the outstanding reviews, so when I went I was a little disappointed. I mean, it's a good breakfast joint, but not something I'd be willing to wait almost an hour for after making the long commute.

5LJyonJLeG0-InyWBBeuhw.text: Definitely a MUST TRY breakfast spot when visiting Vegas!   I have been hearing about the red velvet pancakes and finally went to try them out myself.  Friday morning we had a table of about 10 and waited almost an hour for a table, but it was so worth it!!  If you come with a big group, best go as early as possible!  Out of the dishes we ordered, I tasted: red velvet pancakes, adobo fried rice omelet, and the loco moco.  The pancakes were so much better than I expected them to be!  I'm really not a fan of pancakes but the red velvet ones were super delicious!  And they're not topped with butter; they're topped with a cream cheese syrup and chocolate chips.  Loco moco was really good and I absolutely loved the adobo fried rice.  Prolly gained 5lbs while eating there but I will def want to come back the next time I'm in Vegas

oL6qJ5bAzSAJt82Q8MFZNQ.text: This place needs to seriously invest into training their hosts. The host is your frontline to your guests' experience! They were seriously unorganized, there were people who walked in and were seated within 5 minutes and there were guests who had been forgot or skipped and had been waiting close to an hour. That is simply unacceptable. I heard the wait was going to be 50 mins so I decided to order to go. There were several people who came and went while I waited for my food. After a guest that ordered food a good 10 minutes after me received her (LARGE) order after my mere two meals the host finally remembered to check the gang of to go orders that had been waiting behind her for quite some time. The food she grabbed as stated was mine had been sitting on the counter for atleast 5-10 minutes. Extremely disappointed in this location. As this is my second attempt at trying to eat at this restaurant as I was a victim the first time I tried to eat here as a guest that had been "forgotten" or skipped. They need to take tips from their south Buffalo location. Won't be returning to this spot. Two stars for semi decent tasting lukewarm food.

-DYoMvIimbfkR3bM1hEOEw.text: Actually 4.75 stars in my book (The knock down for the clustered front entrance ) .... went here on my random day off from work and was very happy I did.... Have drove by here twice on the weekend but it was way too busy for me to take my time to get out of my mustang ..... set up the wheelchair .... and wait an hour to get in .... Thought to myself "This place MUST be good!!" Even still on a Wednesday 12/07/11 it was still crowded!! But I decided to brave it.... And my oh my am I a happy camper!!   The restaurant entrance could be a little less crowded if they removed those high chairs.... Being in a wheelchair it was difficult to get in the front door. Remove the high chairs and me and my wheelchair brethren will be golden. Waited just a couple minutes to be taken to my table. Such a small place for the amount of business they get ! Free wifi internet was available. So I was able to hook up with my iPhone!! Yay!! Was helped immediately by a friendly waitress who got me Coffee.....STAT!! Being filipino I opted for the "Ricks Adobo Rice Omelet" .... The waitress said "Is that it"? and I asked if it was a small portion... She said NOPE!! Trying to watch my girlish figure I opted for the Omelet alone.... And pardon my french but it was FRICKEN HUGE!! hehehehe!! The rice and Adobo pork was cooked to perfection and the eggs nicely cooked. Yummy !! So scrumptious.   Will definitely come here again!! I'll even brave the weekend  crowd for this place. Thats saying a lot ! Think I'll be trying the Velvet Pancakes  on my return.

qKNey5BU_FK_5f2jWAD0fg.text: I've been here twice. Be prepared for a lengthy wait on weekends. Lengthy. This place has great pancakes. I've had the bananas foster pancakes and the carrot cake ones and they are both fantastic. The bananas foster was really sweet. Surprised? Their bacon and eggs are also good. I can't recommend the coffee. It isn't terrible, but it tastes a lot like Folgers and it is my only real complaint about the place. I've had good service both times. Definitely recommend this place for a leisurely breakfast on a cheat day.

Myvy2FhdklmBs9jxrp_egA.text: We were in the area for a couples massage and stopped in for breakfast thanks to Yelp. What a great find!  You could tell upon walking in that this was a local favorite.  We managed to get seated in the last table for two.  After us there was a wait.  The menu was fantastic!  Not only did they have the standard breakfast favorites of pancakes and eggs but they had garlic fried rice.  Ohhhhh...they had me at garlic.   I end up ordering the loco moco and was not disappointed.  Rice, hambuger and gravy...you can't go wrong with that!  The hubby ordered himself some garlic fried rice with corned beef.  You could smell the garlic before the plate even reached the table.  I love that!  We left there full and happy.

XoRLeAMJEpmo_Bb6bHDbBQ.text: Great food and service however, it needs a major facelift. Seating is cramped and there's a collection of dust from the vents. It looks like there's a web of sorts on the emergency sign but it's just dust. Nasty, needs a few hours of tlc.

mmj5g8YPTs5RdOvo6UbqPg.text: Avid yelpers (I don't write a lot of reviews but read Yelp constantly for advice on restaurants and services).   We visited Egg & I, as well as Omelette House before visiting Babystacks. Both places were good, but Babystacks was outstanding, with original offerings. The Adobo Fried Rice Omelette was huge, and perfectly seasoned -- really delicious and different. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  The Almond Joy and Butterfinger pancakes were heavenly. Surprisingly, not too sweet. Red Velvet were also predictably good based on reviews.   Service was fantastic. Worth the wait, no question. Excellent value. Loved the fact that all breakfast combos allowed an upgrade to any specialty pancake for a modest charge. Loved it so much -- we will be back before we return to Orange County tomorrow!

vlrf98KdRQhmcdv4ziWX0Q.text: What do you do when you have a day off from work and decide to go hiking at Mt. Charleston but then find yourself driving in pouring rain?  Go get some yummy breakfast at Baby Stacks in Summerlin!  So many good things about this place.  Here is what I got to try so far: - Red Velvet pancakes with buttercream frosting topping.  Small little pancakes just the perfect size for a sweet taste. - Portugese sausage with eggs and rice.  This place gives you more than 4 slices of sausage!  I hate when I have to ration out my Portugese sausage to last the entire meal.  There were 9 slices I believe!  Enough to get your fix.  Upgrade your rice for garlic rice.  You won't be disappointed. - Kalua pork and eggs benedict.  Usually kalua pork is too salty but this one is not too salty at all.  My roommate thought it was bland but I would rather it be less salty than too salty.  An interesting take on the usual eggs benedict.  I really want to take my parents here when they come to visit.  It is a cute little brunch place that anyone will enjoy.

dMmkM63YX6o0I8e6x-tJUg.text: If you're in the area, you must try this place! Their red velvet pancakes are extremely good. When I ordered it, I had the two piece one where you can add to your dish. I got the khula pork benedict which had a really good holiday sauce on top. The service was really friendly.  I would definitely go back if I'm in the area again.

krtM0S0PBoejQ4XkNZ7X3g.text: Fast friendly service, more than ample portions, comfortable atmosphere, and great priced.  This is the kind of place I've been looking for to take family and friends for breakfast!  Will definitely return here next time I'm in town!!

Yes, the lines are long, yes the place is small but wait is worth it. The servers are amazing, knowledgeable about the menu, will give you options and offer recommendations when you seem lost and keep your cup of coffee full. My favorite pancakes are the lemon ricotta ones -yum- however, pancakes is not the only deliciousness available at this location, they have amazing omelettes and skillets as well.  You have to try them, they're so delicious!

bWHE4NPedaTcIFyPH-mTow.text: Absolutely horrible customer service.  The food isn't the issue here at all. We called and got put on hold for 25 MINUTES!!!!!!!!! No they didn't answer. We had to hang up and call them back. They then answer. And the ladies response was. " sorry we are just busy". For a location that has a STAGGERING amount of business all day everyday they have the shitty ass excuse for call in orders. If you can't handle phone orders then DONT TAKE THEM.  Ridiculous. Disappointed.  Get with the program and upgrade your phone system. It also has static. Get a phone that has Call waiting as well. You gotta constantly call them until it isn't busy any more.  And Get better employees. Ones that can handle phone orders. Stop being cheap asses. Employee better people.  This is just pathetic.

R1tK9BLHq37fIsfK7_Yk6g.text: Melanie was our server and she was fantastic. So friendly and attentive. My German chocolate pancakes were so yummy!

6gS5gEDaIxcQK4xZUpmFaA.text: Okay food if you don't know how to cook.  I am guessing folks come for their variety of toppings/flavors of their pancakes.  It was an ok experience, people were friendly, but food was not that great.

d3l1VjXShs9M13vBn83ASA.text: This is what you're looking for in a great breakfast place. Amazing selection of pancakes (their specialty) that range from traditional to extreme-dessert. They have truly made the pancake entree into an art.  Fast food, delicious omelettes, and cheap related to most other cafes.  The only downside is the size of the place; this is a popular breakfast spot, with a small dining area. Arrive a bit early in case you have to wait for a table.  Lively atmosphere with fun, but not too loud, music.   Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Very relaxed and no rushing to get you out. They were also really fast with refills and requests.  Definitely recommend this place!

QhXIFJ-iPSdqv7TCLezcHA.text: The food is good....really good.    But what's the point of calling in an order at 7am when they open and no one is in the lobby.  But you still have to wait 30 minutes for it.     35 as I'm in the lobby waiting as I type this.

uDejGEOqoMGFgsxx_bHEBw.text: Omg!! Two words for you: ADOBO OMELET!!! The bomb dot com!! Such a cute cafe with amazing food!! We love coming here whenever we're in Vegas!! Friendly staff, too! They are always super busy hence we always order food to go! Can't wait to come back!!

Qb0TZ3om6wvG2IBkE2anfA.text: This place is great! It's smaller so there will be a wait but it's worth it! We had their special Adobo breakfast dish and the Moco Loco and both were delicious! Definitely coming back!

JJNI2TlUBLBwc95PaztqbQ.text: My oh my.. I'm not much of a sweets person, but I could eat their famous Red Velvet pancakes for days! I was hesitant to order it because I have a tendency to gravitate towards savory foods, but after reading so many reviews about it, I knew I had to give it a go. As mentioned in other reviews, the pancakes are so soft, fluffy, and just filled with flavor. It comes with some cream and condensed milk in place of regular syrup, but you can ask for addition syrup on the side.   I also got Rick's adobo fried rice, which came wrapped in an egg! It was pretty good, however the rice was slightly hard and/or old. Other than that, the dish wasn't too salty and was yummy!   The service was a tad bit slow... when I went to pay, I was second in line and within 5 minutes, there were three parties behind me! Workers were nice, but slightly slow.   P.S.  The cashier told me there are five different locations around the Vegas area.

RK12JfdsK7Hex89UwuFvnA.text: This is now my favorite To-Go breakfast place in Las Vegas. Its a small restaurant but the atmosphere is friendly, busy but well worth it. Food is super delish!

o39EB8xtoSetIkviUQq3lQ.text: Kinda hard to get to as they had the parking lot blocked off BUT the cafe itself is soooo good!! f_rpfOmpOG3HbZsPja2RMg.text: Omg! So good! We have lived in North Las Vegas for one year and had not been able to find a good breakfast place (off the strip). We found it today! BabyStacks was so good, delicious and fantastic! Service was amazing and so nice! The adobo fried rice omelette was so incredibly tasty! Don't miss the red velvet pancakes - they were light and airy and so darn good!!! We will definitely be back very soon (if not next weekend)!

Very busy so be prepared for a wait (average 30 minutes on weekdays and up to an hour on weekends per our server). If you have the time, we strongly recommend.

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnabon SHORT Stack...they don&#39;t impact your height, but your width is another issue.
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After tasting the food, I am sure the picture on the back wall is of the cook.

mzV8_ZQJ05dFNg6J9b0MNA.text: Staff was friendly. While the pancakes had great flavor, they were cold and tasted like they were pre-made. Was very disappointed coming from a place that claims to specialize in pancakes. Also the restaurant is tight quarters, if our neighbor was any closer they would be sitting on my lap. We were there on a Sunday so there was a screaming kid the entire time we ate. No fault of the restaurants but it sucked.

E2Jyy10SWMKuKVWNRSuZtQ.text: This babystacks was my first go around with them and I have to say since my experience with I can't stop coming back. Anytime I see one in the valley my little family has to stop. The food service is great. Staff is friendly. My 6 year old is so picky but will tear up her own plate of red velvet pancakes. LOL but not just the pancakes ar amazing all the other food is amazing as well. Country skillet cooking at its finest.

seSDRGYMlcAeNy8jMIvonA.text: This was my second time coming here, very popular then and very popular still. Which was the reason I wanted to come here in the first place. My routine when first trying a restaurant for the first time is, reading the reviews and then looking at the pictures, keeping in mind the most popular dishes. Yes, I do judge a book by its cover...    First time, I tried the adobo fried rice omelette. I couldn't even finish it, it was too salty for my liking. With 6 people in our household, someone's gotta finish it somehow right? Wrong.... Could it be that we're Filipinos and we were spoiled by our grandmother's adobo? Maybe...  Second visit, it's the closest brunch place from my son's high school. I still had it bookmarked since I believe in second chances. So I'm on yelp and decided on what I was going to order before I start picking up my boys from school.   Red Velvet Full Stack- It's good! It's fluffy and it's True that it's breakfast and dessert at the same time. I, don't have a sweet tooth and if I like something that is anything desserty then you know it's not too sweet. The hubby tried it and so did the boys but by then end of the day, I was the one that finished these pancakes. I hate myself and so do my pants!   Country Fried Steak & Eggs- Back to me, I'm not a morning person but I do LOVE breakfast. And I LOVE country fried steak. If you take me anywhere for breakfast, you can bet I'm gonna order country fried steak. Ask my husband, my boys, friends, ask anyone. I will not be coming here for my country fried steak. The gravy wasn't as tasty and they didn't pound the meat enough,IMO.   Cora's Corned Beef Hash- My family and I love corned beef, they finished this. I didn't get to taste it due to how fast it vanished but by the looks of it, I don't feel like I missed anything.   Portuguese Sausage- I remember when I was younger, after a night out with my girlfriends, we'd go to El Dorado in Reno and order Portuguese sausage... I'd bring my family there for the Portuguese sausage. We didn't finish this either. I also opted for the garlic fried rice and wow the onions were humongous! NO!!!!! Just no.   Lastly, the regular buttermilk pancakes the boys did enjoy. I was too busy eating the red velvet pancakes I didn't get the chance to try this.   I spoke to my co-worker about my second visit at Babystacks and I'm not the only one that didn't enjoy the food there. She was also not impressed. So, I'm not the only one.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uf4JU3fcC3KfVTN75AzJNA.text: Planned to have just normal lazy Friday all American breakfast but wow! Menu selections are fantastic. I have to really make a hard decision. End up with Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice Omelette and the unwrapped version. (See photos). This is shredded adobo chicken meat. It's super delicious. Option sides are seasoned potatoes, hash browns or pancakes.  Great customer service, friendly & attentive.

6UyrSd3wcOskyatEB23Adg.text: This is a good place to enjoy good breakfast.  I had the Huntington Skillet with Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and it was delicious.  Although the wait time is typically longer during weekends it's worth the wait.

nk3Oy5halWjxwbqrMWE2IQ.text: This place is very good. Food is bomb. I love that they have non-pork breakfast meat options. Only 4 stars because all the locations are way to small. The wait on prime days is 30-40 mins. Too long when I'm hungry for brunch and need coffee. There is not really a waiting area so it's very uncomfortable while you wait. You can wait in your car but pay attention they will move on quick.

IuojNCUsNYSmpUDC5L7UEQ.text: Great breakfast!!! This place is busy had a 45min wait to get seated but was seated we'll before the 45 min. The food was delicious, and the service was great. Will defiantly be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

CAQfd-u54t9K1zOZE_HGYA.text: Outstanding! They didn't lie about the red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup! So good. A little pricey for breakfast, but they give lots of food. They even gave us to-go cups for our drink refills!

GT2r5adiZuaSN3dm__rk0A.text: I loved every bite. Large portions, good service, CLEAN. I would definitely go back. You better bring your appetite with you

w6rahPwnMDIH_wv362VmTA.text: Three words...Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!  Resembling a stack of thinly layered crepe-like lemony yumminess these giant pancakes will leave you more than satisfied. if you're a lemon lover like me, these will not disappoint.  Served with a lemon wedge, powdered sugar and some lemony syrup.  Ohhhhhhh!  I will be back for more.  I had to take half of them home. So good!  We came early and beat the crowds. Thankfully they're opening another one in Centennial and another just opened down the street so that may alleviate the long wait for a table. Mr. G had the eggs and garlic rice and let me just say if you want to ward off the vampires...  Service was fabulous, friendly and attentive.  I'm glad I came back and gave them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Ricotta Pancakes

NOWZJCagnrCOF6miZreDMA.text: The only not 5 Star thing about our visit was when I asked the waitress if they had anything Gluten Free, she said, and I quite "The closest we would have is the All Wheat French Toast".  @__@. Crickets.  I had the Banana Fosters Crepes, they were perfect, with sweet syrup and the non-sweet crepes, complimenting each other perfectly. I asked if the bacon is crisp, she asked If I wanted it crisp and I explained crisp but not hard. It was perfection.  My GF The Locals Favorite, a burrito with Mojo. It was To Die For. Capitals firmly needed for this. When we go back next week I think we're all getting it, even my sweet food loving daughter.  Said daughter got the Macadamia Nut Pancakes. We both added cream Cheese Syrup, and barely used it cause everything was perfect.  My Mom got the Red Velvet Pancakes and ate so much that our chickens were depressed at the lack of leftovers.   We arrived at nine and had a five minute wait, we heard the hostess telling people 20 minutes at one point, so we'll be there at 8:27, our usual meeting time next week.  Parking was ample, and the coffee was good, never empty.  Paul H had given this place decent reviews, and Yelping about it discovered we both were Biscuits lovers, this place doesn't have the love you feel of Biscuits, however it may win out in the end!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be Nice Or Leave,words to live by!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Fosters Crepes, oh, so delicious. I added Cream Cheese syrup, but barely used it cause they were perfect as is.
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macadamia Nut Pancakes, add the Cream Cheese syrup to make it sublime.

-078ZnGlPXXK4Y1bkbMinQ.text: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes !!!  That is all - 5/5  Came here with a group of friends before trekking up to Mt. Charleston. Pancakes were amazing... Light, tart and sweet .. Reminds me of a lemon cake A+ in my book! Service was attentive .

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes with a veggie omelet :)

cXIqOZYYqAe_y9ev2KYPTA.text: If I can give this place zero stars I would . So I came in 3/10/18 @ 9:50 am and we got sat at 11:15 am with a party of 7 Everyone who came after us was sat before us . We asked the hostess twice for an update of when we would be sat, and both of them were VERY RUDE.  And then when we finally get sat they seat us at a table for 6 so we asked if we can get another chair and they said no because it's a fire hazard which is understandable, but they should have just waited till they had enough seats/tables available before seating us, so here we are squeezing 7 people in a tiny ass table. And the server clearly did not know her menu but she was nice.. food was okay , iv had better at another location.

Td8QEmJh0ZdCWumuETXRqA.text: Nice place to eat breakfast! Las Vegas has so many choices to choose from and BabyStacks delivered. This place is busy and our wait was not long at all. Although, this restaurant is tiny, their meals are BIG! Service was fast and great! Not one complaint coming out of my mouth. Wanted to give this place 5 stars, but the lemon ricotta pancakes were lacking in flavor.   BabyStacks is located right outside of Summerlin, so I expected good food and service. I would return here for breakfast ask for Mariazuzena! Great job!

6alHQtcJM9nvX7_jSJI2EQ.text: I love this restaurant my only issue is the whole party has to be present in order to put ur name on the list other than that the food is amazing.

3lg-LCVdtkoFXyU6OvdPbg.text: I know there's a ton of rave reviews of this place, which is why we had to try it. I was a bit disappointed in the highly-revered Red Velvet Pancakes. They were good, yes. Without the cream cheese "syrup" and whipped cream, it would have been nothing special at all.  We also tried the Adobo Fried Rice, which comes in am omelete. It was a nice, large portion, but I thought there could have been less eggs, and more flavor.   The other specialty pancakes we tried were the Cinnamon Tres Leches (the best, in my opinion-- DELICIOUS), the Smores (soso- basically just pancakes with chocolate chips and cinnamon cereal and marshmallows on it), and the White Chocolate Macadamia Nut (our second favorite, our second favorite after the Tres Leches).  As for the service, the place was really really crowded. We arrived around 11:45 and it was about a 30 minute wait. I kind of felt like we were rushed, as the server kept asking to take away our plates. Despite how often she came by to try to clear the table, we got zero refills on coffee or drinks. Not even water. It wasn't until she bright the check that she asked if we wanted more coffee. I get that it's busy, but I feel like they should pay more attention to their service, rather than try to rush out all their diners.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes, Cinnamon Tres Leches  Pancakes, Portugese Sausage and Eggs

bFMDHJuRJMdbBPfF1QUbPQ.text: I really don't understand all the great reviews for this place. On Thursday I waited 45 minutes for a ToGo order.  After I got home they forgot one of the sides, even after all the time it took them to make it. I was pretty upset that they couldn't get my order correct.  The food was just mediocre and looked even less appealing.  These were supposed to be Carrot Cake pancakes and the Mexican omelette.  Here's a picture...

s88u5i101cHDaPNmx5fjIg.text: Delicious pancakes and omelet. Absolutely nothing to complain about! Makes me want to take another trip to Vegas just to return.

n8LzVVRTBMPTnmT-eCedjA.text: Great breakfast choices, especially if you're Asian and like having rice options for breakfast.  Awesome service too.

--MSoRbuvBVUrrcRfQ_5NA.text: Wow! Simply amazing, I wish I knew about this place a long time ago. I was introduced to this establishment by my boyfriend and I absolutely love it. All employees are courteous and friendly, they do have long waiting times but that is only because of how wonderful they are. Despite how busy they can get, staff remains professional and restaurant remains clean. They do their best to sit arriving guest but this location is very small and waiting time can get a bit crazy.  This restaurant needs to expand their business hours and open more locations.  I will highly recommend everyone to give it a try as Babystacks is very inexpensive and amazing.

CZFZ8iW0ZIiVrMLGyDe3xw.text: Loveeeee this place!!! Go every week! Food is amazing only down side is you can't call and make reservations and it's usually busy ! But a really great place for breakfast no matter what location

Bzwd_6P1z4Z5EGv2uMIHUQ.text: The one star is for exceptionally poor service. Went for breakfast decided to have pancakes that came with omelet to go to enjoy later. When I received the pancakes they were noticeably smaller than normal and compared to the pancakes I ordered to go for my grandmother. I brought it to the waitress attention who was also a manager, and instead of apologizing she argued that's how they came. I pointed to other customers plates that there was a major difference yet still no apology and refused to give me a new order as I requested. I called when I got home, spoke to another manager who instead of an apology argued. Finally was offered a replacement. I asked if my brother could pick them up on his way home but was told I would have to drive all the way back and bring the small pancakes for a replacement. Considering it's 108 degrees not worth the time or energy to bring my 98 year old grandmother out for something that should have been addressed at the restaurant.

W_pq6K7JAIClbEE-6a5rpQ.text: Great place for breakfast. You might have to wait but it is worth it. I had the Honey French Toast combo. I highly recommend it. Service was excellent even though they were very busy.  Hubby had his usual eggs and they were cooked just right.

We are still coming back, shit happens but it's a first time for us.

2dMrj0TfE3lKMTgf-kaeZg.text: Everything I ate had great flavor! The Portuguese sausage had a nice snap to it while having a sweet but savory flavor. The country potatoes are classic and flavorful with seasoned salt and has the right amount of crisp on it.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for! It has a slight lemony flavor and the sauce (instead of syrup), is a light icing flavor syrup. They have a nice consistency and don't feel heavy. They are almost as light as a crepe but a little thicker. My husband, who is picky about pancakes, loved the lemon ricotta and the honey whole wheat.  We are making this our usual spot!!

nTBxmF0b1Z9oG-0NRmQ2WQ.text: Great pancakes, rice, eggs Benny, Mexican omelet is delicious! The place is pretty small, and they get pretty crowded, so expect a wait, especially on the weekend. I have never been disappointed with anything on the menu.

0o2xjYwsncG9rp8fWgVPbg.text: Honestly, I just thought this place was okay.  I'm not really a fan of tight sitting quarters when I'm enjoying breakfast. Id much rather feel as though I can lounge, enjoy my coffee, and have a conversation that 20 other diners are privy to hearing. So, as for ambiance, I'd give the place a 1  The food was alright. Maybe I'm just partial to the places I've grown up with (The Egg and I, Blueberry Hill), but even still, I cant say the food is that great. The scrambled eggs had a very strange coconut flavor to them that caught me a bit off guard in a kind of unpleasant way. My pancakes tasted like, well, pancakes. Nothing I could not have gotten at IHOP (and I hate IHOP) Maybe I should have tried their famous Red Velvet pancakes, but not being a fan of anything Red Velvet, I didn't see how a pancake would possibly be so good as to change my mind.  The service was what one would expect in a busy breakfast joint with limited seating; nonexistent. I cant say they were rude, but nobody seemed to engage with us or give me any reason to feel welcomed. I felt as though I was being rushed out of my seat the moment the food was sat down on the table.   The only reason I cant give this place a much lower rating is because I'm sure there are people who love their famous Stack of RV, and because I didn't try it, I cant say the food is all that bad. Its just not my favorite. Coffee was great, and bacon was prepared perfectly. Had it have not been for the seating arrangement and the service I could have given this place a 4 star rating. It's just okay for me.

Klr4RMFDBhxcgPYPyeajhA.text: Best breakfast ever had pancakes are the best out here in vegas sooo worth 30 min wait. can't wait to go  back.

0ILRDQAeFmZ6lg-H1CIYNw.text: Why is it that all the great spots to eat have limited seating ? Quality over quantity. Baby Cakes is delicious, my kids loved it and the service was great. Portions are just enough and the price is right . Cant wait to visit again.

vvcu3r_Y09QrWRy8iw8Jng.text: This BabyStacks is my favorite one in town. The wait always seems shorter, the food is always on point, and the service is always quick. I've never run into any issues with them.

29WUj4zbhGJ5nG2IdzvtPA.text: Be prepared for the wait (it was over 20 minutes at 11:30 on a Sunday) but IT IS WORTH THE WAIT! I have been determined to go here after receiving several recommendations and reading reviews. Baby Stacks lives up to all the promises previous patrons have described.   Realize the name has changed from Baby Cakes to Baby Stacks. We made that mistake and ended up at in Henderson at a bakery inside the M resort.  The red velvet pancakes were worth the wait and worth going back for.

XFZIaIyp4ZWMTpJIbNba2w.text: YUM! Just yum.   Their bananas foster pancakes are so BOMB. The fries are great, the omlettes are awesome. Everything was fresh and really good.   The seating a slightly uncomfortable but that's really my only complaint. I like a breakfast place with a little more comfort to soothe my hangover (which is really the only reason I'll ever go out for a big breakfast! Haha)  Can't wait for my next hangover so I can make a trip back!

LdqvVZm_CzoQFhe5qftj-g.text: So drove by this place serval times and final came in. Small cozy place, with very friendly staff. First thing I notice on the menu Adobo chicken fried rice! So yes definitely ordered that, it came out wrapped in an omelet. It basically reminded me of going to my friends house (Filipino) after they had a party and in the morning making some scrambled eggs and eating some left over fried rice and adobo. Then serve have options for a side and recommended their special banana foster pancakes. Man that was just a taste of heaven! Also what was great about this place is the accommodation, since my gf is vegan they we're able to make a vegan breakfast burrito, did fresh vegetables and breakfast potatoes with avocado on the side. So needless to say great service great food definitely will be coming back soon!

wSM93jzdH8IQQYbwS-F6mg.text: There's a pancake for everyone at Babycakes! Yes, the red velvet are the darlings of the bunch, but there are 12 varieties on the menu including bacon and PBand [you choose]! When done well, variety is such a nice thing, and there pancakes are pretty darn tasty. Of course, I went with the boring old honey whole wheat. I love my whole grains! They were executed just right, not too big, not too thick.    I enjoyed the hashbrowns. Would have enjoyed them more if my husband hadn't insisted I share! My eggs on the other hand weren't scrambled soft per my request, but that's not a deal breaker for me I suppose. The service was friendly, and the spot is cute. They definitely need to expand, as I don't know I could regularly justify waiting 30-45 minutes on a weekday afternoon to get a plate of pancakes. Still, it always makes me happy to see a local business killing it. When you have a hunch you need to brunch (or breakfast), add this to your list. But, you might want to call to check on the wait!

xxk26cnYINNZTHYucG4qMw.text: Everything about this place is awesome. Friendly service and great food what more could you ask for. Pancakes are great. I have tried most of them and haven't had anything bad yet. Just tried a special one toffee lemon Carmel pancakes. Wow is all I can say. The Loco moco is fantastic. Well worth the wait and yes you do wait. Enjoy it!!!!!

RoMrHR9FpF-n8gcei24XaQ.text: it's so mouthwatering good no matter how sweet your tooth is or not. the food and service keeps you coming back for more .missing there pancakes

sPcGtHEX5lAOV-lDBDYtIw.text: Place is the BOMB!!!  Has great food at very reasonable prices.  A must have when you're in the Las Vegas area !

8fxj-JT2I5hd1ONLO4_Q3w.text: I ordered to go and the food was hot and ready when I arrived. I got the adobo fried rice omelet and the oh-so popular red velvet  pancakes. Now I see why it is so popular!  It comes with this this bomb cream cheese syrup and is sprinkled with chocolate shavings and a nice heaping of whipped cream! Jesus lives in those red velvet pancakes!!! They have so many specialty pancakes I'm dying to go back and try some new ones. Next time I will def dine in.

-5FTglw5_dU0pf9OL5hQ0g.text: By sheer luck I stumbled upon this place when looking for good eats in Vegas! I'm not a pancake fan by any stretch of the imagination, but the reviews made them sound so good that I was a believer. I'm really happy I got over my hatred for pancakes and gave Babycakes a try.  My brothers, a friend, and I made this our last stop in Vegas before heading home. While it was a little out of the way for us, it was well worth it. We waited maybe 20 minutes, just long enough for me to change my mind on my order a few hundred times. I was going to go with the s'mores pancakes or the white chocolate macadamia pancakes, but I ended up giving in to the Yelp reviews and going with the red velvet.  And you thought my hatred for pancakes was bad, I despise red velvet. Not because it tastes bad (it doesn't), but EVERYONE is doing it. Every bakery and cupcake shop from here to Kalamazoo is doing it. Every baker on Cupcake Wars thinks they have the original, prize winning, most amazing, down-home, just like moms red velvet cupcake. It's run of the mill. It's tired. It's boring. It's so freaking cliche I can't handle it.  Then there was Babycakes. It's criminal what they've done here. A short stack (three pancakes, full stacks are six) of fluffy, brilliantly colored red pancakes command your attention from across the restaurant (and they did at least three times). On top sits a generous mound of whipped cream studded with chocolate chips. Heaven on earth! They come with a side of a lightly sweetened cream cheese syrup. The pancakes are prefect without the syrup, but add a little and you'll be sure to find yourself in a foodie nirvana. The red velvet pancakes were simply amazing. Sweet, tender, not at all like any other pancake I've had.  My brother had the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were delicious as well. I'm not entirely sure if the pancakes themselves were  regular pancakes or something else, but they were good. Topped with a cross-hatch of the cream cheese frosting, a dusting of cinnamon sugar, and a generous handful of walnuts and these things are phenomenal!!! They come with a side of regular syrup, though I doubt you'll be needing that.  My friend loved her omelette, but her pancakes were the epitome of my distaste for pancakes. This surely wasn't Babycakes' fault, I blame the pancakes. My brother loved his bacon pancakes.  Service was great, really friendly. We ordered and our food was out within minutes. Everyone was so friendly and the food was delicious. We will certainly be back!

gW-w3kICH4i90h_TlgMd5Q.text: LOVED IT! We had a group of 8 and were seated pretty much immediately, great service, fast, efficient and very friendly!  Our waitress took our order and asked if no one was going to try the red velvet pancakes, so we had her bring an order (short stack was plenty!) to share. They were AH MAY ZING! My S.O. loved the omelet, and I had the Cinabon pancakes, everything was fresh and very good. Coffee was strong and good, too.  I was so disappointed with all my meals in Vegas except this one! Will definitely go back, it was very much worth the trip.

Gcni0oOCDQO_lUMo6AwrFg.text: I love baby stacks just because of their red velvet pancakes. Hahaha I only go their just for that but overall experience was great! It's always pack of people! I would definitely wait and stay in line just cause of the red velvet pancakes hahaha

ZzPnCPV9FUqoGR4OYrJ6HA.text: I came here on a Sunday afternoon, and not to my surprise, it was packed. The hostess said that the wait would be up to 1 hour, but I was willing to tough it out. Being the lover of red velvet cupcakes that I am, I wanted to try out the red velvet pancakes that everyone was raving about to see if it really was that great.  Ladies and gents, the red velvet pancakes were better than just good. They were INCREDIBLY delicious! Every bite was like a fluffy piece of heaven. The last time I had red velvet pancakes was in LA and it was too overly sweet, but Babycakes did a great job of bringing out the flavor of red velvet without making it too sweet. The melted mini chocolate chips added a nice touch to the pancakes. The best part about it was the cream cheese syrup. It added a sweet touch to the pancakes and made it the perfect combo.   I tried the eggs benedict here as well, and it was definitely one of the better ones I've had as well. The eggs were cooked just right, and I barely tasted the yoke that oozed out from the middle. Note: I dislike the taste of yoke, and prefer egg whites, so I rarely order eggs benedict. But the eggs benedict I tried here was delicious. It came with a side of hashbrowns, and those were crispy and yummy as well.   Out waitress was attentive and great, parking space is ample, and I will definitely be returning again the next time I'm in town =)

kscZzIn04fsmZlVWhm1Z7Q.text: Red velvet pancakes were great, but the wait was over an hour long. Will return..hopefully the wait is not too long next time.

wPSokItJntjFHIvYlPluAA.text: I'm in love with Babystacks. I am a regular here and now am a regular at the new Centennial location that just opened up closer to me. I've been coming to Babystacks for a few years now. The service is always good. The employees are all very friendly and good at what they do. They have all the regular breakfast foods that most brunch places have along with some that have a twist and a few Hawaiian dishes. The specialty is of course their pancakes with so many varieties to chose from. I've had most of the things are their menu and am hardly ever disappointed. The only down side is that the buffalo location tends to get crowded so be prepared to wait. But to me that just goes to show you that everyone that comes here is always willing to wait. This place is on my list of highly recommended places to try.

26ik965DuQCXSeuthVQj5A.text: Great place for a traditional American style and/or Filipino Style breakfast. The wait was reasonable. I recommend the red velvet pancakes.

Rkx13UTo_hRQi1xg3nQC-w.text: If your into pancakes then I'm sure this is your place.  I am not one of those people.  I have become a breakfast person recently, so I have been going out of my way to go to different breakfast spots.  And that quest brought me to Babycakes.    It's a pretty small place, but was quite busy.  The service was quick for what it seems to be a understaffed establishment.  The food is normal breakfast fair.  I did try the buttermilk pancakes and they were o.k.  But like I stated before I am not a pancake person, so maybe this isn't the place for me.  I will maybe come back to try some of the Hawaiian food I saw on the menu and that's about it.

1R62cGzCNPRJTBDvnyZL0Q.text: I live in the Southwest part of Las Vegas and I usually find anything I need here. It takes a lot, something like red velvet pancakes, to make me venture out into another part of town. The possibility of trying red velvet pancakes made my friends and I wake up at 8 am on Presidents Day, drive about 40 minutes to Summerlin, and wait 45 minutes to get a table.  Despite all of that, I would do it all over again just to get a taste of those wonderful pancakes.  My two girlfriends and I shared these three menu items:  Red Velvet Pancakes - yes, it lives up to the hype. The full stack came with 6 pancakes. The pancakes tasted like flat cupcakes and they are to die for. It was the right amount of sweetness. You may expect the whipped cream, chocolate crumbles and cream cheese syrup to be overwhelming but everything was just right.  Rick's Adobo Fried Rice - Adobo chicken is a traditional Filipino dish so my expectations were a little high on this dish. It came with fried rice with shredded chicken wrapped in egg like an omelet. It was very tasty and flavorful. We didn't really dig the macaroni salad. Someone was a little too liberal with the pepper.  Spam Scramble - this was the only dish we didn't care for. It tasted as simple as it sounds... Spam with scrambled egg. I guess we just expected something different. This was something anyone could make at home and make it better.  If I were only rating the red velvet pancakes, I would give Babycakes Cafe 5 stars, hands down. I love the pancakes so much that I would make the drive out there again on my day off just to get a taste of them again.

YFxs4ntqnAMblWkyc48kaQ.text: the red velvet pancake were so so yummy, hubs had the bacon pancakes and said they were good also. I left wanting to try at least 5 more flavors even though I was so full.  Go here but expect a wait we went on a Saturday and it was 45mins we left and came back on a Monday around 9:30 and waited 25 mins.

MUC5K0QTAaKVEEVlYrbvZQ.text: Absolutely delicious!  I had the red velvet pancakes with a side of turkey bacon, my husband had the smore pancakes and my in-laws had some omelets and the carrot cake pancakes.  The reason for coming here was the different types of pancakes...we were all satisfied!  The cream cheese syrup was amazing. We'd highly recommend coming here, but try to get there a little early.  We arrived about 8:30 and were seated right away, but on the way out there were some people waited to get a seat.

FZv2mz00svRSYD1YeO_PkA.text: Delicious food and great service! I get the Ricks Adobo almost every time, which is marinated chicken and rice in an omelet. The pancakes are good too, as I have dabbled in some. There Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are amazing. Good prices, good portions, and friendly staff. The only downside can be actually getting into Baby stacks.  The location is small, and due to the awesomeness of the food, its very busy. If your in a hurry though, you can call ahead and have the food ready for take out! 5 Stars!

QVr3qWibdGe2AsXqiRO0EQ.text: Mmmmm.....hhmmmmmm!!!! this place is sure is yummma delicious!!!!  first off, there red velvet pancakes are so good & tasty. top with your cream cheese whip cream. so...so...good!!! second, there kalua pig Benedict was the bestest!!!! so much flavor it was great. we would definitley go back for some more !!!

ht7SqYBXmxiZA9ixhPWi7A.text: I love this place! Chill people & great food. The red velvet pancakes are simply amazing! I usually grub on the Loco Moco  but everything here is good. The wife digs the Heavos Rancheros. There is always a wait but it's worth it!

GCHQa6xABjJAFcEilkni8g.text: It was OK.  Food was sort of average.  Mom and pop atmosphere.  I had an omelette and my hubby had the pork benedict.  The omelette was what you'd ecpect, but the benedict had no flavor to the sauce.   The restaurant looked clean and the decor was nice.  The hostess was very nice and friendly as was the waitress.  The place is kid friendly and family oriented.  The food was not bad but nothing too special.  I read rave reviews about the red velvet pancakes, but red dye in food scares the pee outta me!

kfvKQRCiLiu7GPxyFpcLPg.text: The food is excellent! Prices are reasonable. They nailed my omelet order and the specialty pancakes (got banana fosters) are best thing EVER! The place is small so service is always great. There always seems to be a line but it moved fast. You've got to try it.

krc8APJHVZwgo7veK6E57w.text: During a weekend of overeating and trying new places we opted for a brunch and the much talked about, highly Yelp rated Babycakes Cafe. We "trekked" across the valley with the anticipation of a 1 hour wait.   We were quoted 45 minutes, but because there were some larger parties in front of us we were seated within 15 minutes of arriving. Excellent.   The venue is pretty small but again, Yelp prepared me for that too. Here is what the family ordered:   Mom: eggs and sausage. She said the link sausage was excellent.   Dad: corn-beef hash. He also said this was excellent!   Hubs: biscuits and gravy, side of Adobo Fried Rice. Both were great and bonus the gravy is homemade.   Me: Mexican omelet. Yummers! The pico, sour cream and jalapenos made it.   Table: short stack of red velvet pancakes. WOW! Super light, not too sweet. I thought for sure they would be a sugar OD, but not at all. We were all impressed and surprised at how great they were. A must try for first timers for sure!   I really wish this was closer to home so we could go more often, but I do believe it was well worth the drive and I know we will be back again.

x3FZJK2kYhv2cnkqtHKyZQ.text: This place is a guilty pleasure.  Went for breakfast with the family and we ended up passing food around the table the whole time.  All that could be heard from our table was "You have got to taste this!"  The red velvet pancakes made me feel like I was eating dessert for breakfast and so did the carrot cake pankcakes.  Prices were excellent and I will defintely go back.  Our plan next time is to order different pancakes and just pass a cake around to everyone at the table.  Kinda pancake buffet style.

bB0omemwMW_NHgXTYAguQA.text: Red velvet pancakes are good, they are light and fluffy and not too sweet. The melted mini chocolate chips on top add a nice touch. I eat the pancakes plain and don't add any syrup or sauce because they get really sweet if you do.  I also ordered a side of garlic rice which was tasty until I took a big bite of garlic paste that wasn't spread through the rice well. Expect to have a long wait if you come for breakfast, they tend to get busy and if they could move to a bigger venue that would make things better.  Would I go back? Only if the wait to be seated wasn't 30 minutes plus.  Weekdays are probably better days to go than the weekend

xZEqhD-TwrxDmIG64UUxCA.text: What do I love about this place? The question should be, what don't I love about this place?   We had Rick's Adobo Fried Rice - a traditional Filipino dish made with marinated, shredded chicken and rice wrapped omelet style with green onions, accompanied with their homemade macaroni salad. The omelet is exactly what one would expect, if you ever had adobo...VERY, VERY GOOD! The mac salad was a little salty for my taste, but still very good!  Their Kalua Pig Benedict - toasted English muffin, topped with Hawaiian-style, slow-cooked, shredded pork, cabbage, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce...A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!  If benedicts are what you're looking for, this one tops them all. My absolute favorite!  Our son had their bacon cheeseburger, well done, and fries. My husband was quite pleased and surprised that, yet again, another great entree!   Our daughter had their carrot cake pancakes. I love carrot cake to begin with, and I have to admit that it was even better than I thought!  To top everything off, we ordered their Red Velvet Pancakes with chocolate crumbles and cream cheese syrup. If pancakes are what you're looking for, anyone who's been here would, I'M SURE, highly recommend the Red Velvet. Words cannot even describe such a simple dish that is OH SO, well...you'll just have to try it!!!    Don't think that we could eat all this. I'm actually sick to my stomach from all the amazing food! We packed up two take-home containers and went home to crash, but I wanted to take a moment to rate this restaurant. Definitely worth it. This being our first time there, we wanted to order so much off their menu to try what we heard/read rave reviews about, so we already knew we were "taking leftovers"...the question was, just how much?  Being New Year's Eve, it was really packed! They served us juice and coffee as we waited, which was extremely nice! You're happy with how their items are priced! Service was still very good for how busy it was.  EVERYONE, including us, walked out of there with a smile on their face.   WHAT A GREAT FIND! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for breakfast/brunch!!! ENJOY! :)

z23PjZa0PgfX5jp_MreCzA.text: Wowee!  I finally got to eat here after hearing all about the red velvet pancakes.  I waited until a day that I had a good, long workout in before venturing over and imbibing what I assumed would be massive amounts of carbs.  Today was that day:  I ran 10 long miles (triathlon training) beforehand and then met a friend at 8:30am for the sugar-fest.  There was a short wait for our table since this is a cozy, little joint, but we were seated in 5 minutes instead of the 15 that was initially mentioned.  Service was very friendly and attentive throughout the meal.  Afraid that the red velvet pancakes would be just too sweet for a whole breakfast, I ordered the corned beef hash, eggs over medium, and hash browns with the pancakes on the side.  Yes, this girl can eat!  The nice surprise is that the pancakes were not as sweet as expected.  Yes, they come topped with whipped cream and chocolate chips, but the cream cheese syrup is on the side and one can control how much sweetness with that stuff.  I LOVED them!  My friend had the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were also delish.  I want to go back tomorrow and try some of the other tempting items on the menu--it may be a blessing or a curse that Babycakes is right down the street from my house!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes, red velvet pancakes, corned beef hash, eggs, and hash browns

fZZFvTqg2-sDDwaxFostoA.text: Amazing pancake selection! Especially love the red velvet pancakes!! Like that I can get breakfast with an island flare to it - the garlic fried rice is a great side item.  Beware though this is not a place that you will probably be able to be seated immediately, every time we have gone here or to the other location we will wait about 15 minutes minimum for a table.  If it is a holiday weekend be prepared to wait about 45 minutes.

rys-LQQTFMBADvDxxIkg3Q.text: I was their this morning and it was plenty of seats available. What a friendly environment! Food, price 3 stars & environment, service 5 stars! You get plenty food it was way over cooked. (taste 3 star look 5 star)

ZuXACgiM-9mRy8Vo11I5rg.text: My Loco Moco plate was phenomenal!  The red velvet pancakes were delicious. My husband was jealous of us because he ordered lunch.   My only complaint was the 'gravy boogers'.  You know, it sits too long and gets a skin on top.  Apparently, I got all that. That grossed me out. I pulled off those long bogeys and proceeded to tear it up. We got seated quicker than expected for 7.  Overall delightful. My friend didn't care too much for the hollandaise sauce.

PGcBUCsGAPWh_hZVszkT9g.text: Finally made it out here after reading all the reviews pumping this new "Yelp Whore" out.  I won't add too much because the other 100+ reviews covers it but I thought the Rick's Adobo Fried Rice was a little too salty.  I think when the rice is cooked with the adobo it really absorbs the flavor and it gets too salty.  Others may like.  Still it was ok.  As the majority stated, the red velvet pancakes are the star of the show.  Order a 2 egg breakfast and pay the extra 1-2 bucks to upgrade to Red Velvet.  We'll be back.  Will try the benedict next time.

4S6CbMpAWiHN0Kwl_ZwDfw.text: I've eaten here a few times and they have one of the best breakfast menus in town. Unlike such places as IHOP or Denny's, they don't have that manufactured food chain flavor.   I usually get the Piglet Omelette, hash browns, and pancakes. The pancakes are delicious. So far though, my favorite is the carrot cake pancakes. They are phenomenal.   The omelette I get is great. It's full of flavor, not too much of one thing. Like the omelette, the hash browns are amazing. Both have a light buttery flavor.   I've tried a few of the other things that others I've gone with have ordered, and I'm amazed at how good the food is.   I'd also like to say that the staff is wonderful.   If you're looking for some good food, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1COMW7dwnrdCmyDSI45W8Q.text: Came in on a Tuesday for lunch and encountered a 30 minute wait.  This place is small and definitely does not have enough seats for all the people waiting in line to sit inside in the air conditioning.    When we were seated at our table, I could not wait to try the heavily hyped red velvet pancakes.  I got a half order which came with 3 medium sized pancakes, cream cheese syrup and chocolate shavings.  Those pancakes were delish!    Definitely worth a trip off the strip!

9G-nq1ipB3dbsnUsDAT9tg.text: This morning I'm going solo, had early morning appt so I decided breakfast was a necessity.   I ordered the ranchero omelet with carrot cake pancakes, just $1.25 more. It was a very good choice! The om let had chicken inside that was cut into cubed pieces, one side had been crispy, but it was still moist. The ranchero sauce on top was spice with just a hint of sweetness.   I enjoyed breakfast so much, I ordered a BLT for lunch!

8b8Ux6U8Q9TVgYTzzNhl_w.text: Visited on 7/29 luckily no line. I had the biscuit and gravy with poached eggs. The gravy had a sweet taste to it, off putting. On a good note server asked me how I wanted my egg never been asked that for poached eggs. My hubby had the Mexican omelette. Eggs were over cooked and carnitas had no taste. He also had red velvet pancakes on the side. He loved it. It was fluffy. I didn't like it, it's red velvet should have cream cheese icing not powdered sugar.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit and gravy
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican omlette

tT2AUbkERm7c9axiW9OlJg.text: Simply amazing!! Great food and service.!! The red velvet pancakes are a must ! The only down side is the wait time but I honestly don't mind because the food is worth it !

szYGROdx1n4TdmHm-cxxxg.text: Went to breakfast with a friend and my one year old daughter. My friend told me it was a place I must try,  she was not kidding! We arrived around 10 am,  so it was not very busy and we were seated right away.  The hostess noticed my daughter and immediately set us up in a spacious corner table with a high chair.  I didn't have to sit awkwardly with a squirming baby in my lap waiting for a place to put her.  Our server greeted us very quickly. She was friendly and attentive throughout the meal. Our drink order was taken right away,  my coffee was excellent and clearly fresh. (Bonus points for keeping it fresh after breakfast rush has slowed and there is a lull of customers.) For breakfast I had the strawberry cream cheese pancakes with a side of toast and a side of bacon. The food looked appetizing and beautiful.  I had gotten the toast for my daughter,  but it was crusty and tasted like it had been sitting out. She shared my french toast and Bacon with me instead. The French Toast was outstanding and the bacon was thick and cooked to perfection. My friend had the lemon ricotta pancakes. She requested extra lemons and they were delivered immediately. I tasted a bite of her pancakes and they were fantastic. Our coffee was never allowed to become empty or cold.  Our check arrived on one bill which was promptly split when we asked, even though it was getting busier as early lunch dinners were arriving. The server didn't tell us to pay at the front,  so we waited a while before realizing.  In that time she did walk by us a couple times.  She was very busy,  but it might have been nice for her to stop and just let us know where to pay or ask if we needed something. There were customers waiting at this point so would have been nice for them if we had left that 5-10 minutes earlier. Didn't bother us too much though because we still had coffee and we were chatting.  Overall it was a great experience and i am excited to take my son and my husband to try it sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little pricy for a café,  but very delicious.

eZAqpto3iWeRzBwz9oivgg.text: -slow service -food was rather expensive for what you ended up getting -taste of food was just ok, nothing really stood out.

OrHTqn0QtCuLa3TvKoXYMw.text: I think I would rate Baby Stacks higher if I could ever get in there to eat again!  I have stopped in on weekdays and weekends at various times and have been told the wait is going to be from 35 minutes to 1 1/2 hours.  What!? So I leave.  The last meal I had left me wanting more Baby Cakes - but not for the pancakes.  They have a FRIED SPAM breakfast eggs and GARLIC FRIED RICE that hits your salty taste buds just right!  Fry my spam crispy like my momma used to!   Get the upgrade on the rice - you'll love it!

cwAsE2XWlD0xl1JBhbyx3Q.text: Didn't care for the pancakes. Had the plain and Red Velvet which separated when dipped in the sauce leaving the bottom skin in the sauce. It then turned  pasty in my mouth sticking to the roof of my mouth. Luckily service was good and my coffee was frequently refilled.    Ricks Adobo Fried Rice was delicious.   Chicken fried steak was "ok" according to my brother.   Found a number of breakfast places this trip. Unfortunately Babystacks was not one of them.  Don't think we'll be back.
