5_TI8Os74OClpzpC49wpaA.text: I love this spot... best breakfast around. Lolo Ricks Adobo Fried Rice dish is amazing...get the garlic rice with it tho.

v8ZI-CpIgiWeCAjs_jO4FQ.text: We drive by Baby Stacks regularly but this morning was the first time we stopped to eat here. OMG! It was the BEST breakfast I've had in quite a while! The menu has a wide variety and there is something for everyone in it. I had the country fried steak and eggs and I upgraded to the garlic fried rice. My other half ordered the corned beef hash and eggs and upgraded his order of buttermilk pancakes to the Banana Foster pancakes. The food was plentiful and soooooooo delicious! Our server Maria provided excellent service and our food came out quickly.  The restaurant is located on the corner of Smoke Ranch and Buffalo right next to Sierra Gold. If you're in the neighborhood, I definitely suggest that you stop here for breakfast!

LKdbCmForxxljyB5AnGq5w.text: I tried the red velvet pancakes, and I'm not a pancake lover.... but oh my goodness it was so delicious! The whip cream almost has an ice cream flavor too me so worth it though. Oh the cream cheese syrup, again personally don't like cream cheese, but this syrup was yummy lol. The service once seated is prompt. I have no idea which one I'll pick on my next trip.

hluKdJELho9N2yAnY0E3bA.text: The red velvet pancakes are a must have item on their menu! The skillets are on point too! Great mom and pop breakfast and brunch spot!

VmApDFchUN2wLTcSI64Cug.text: This was a cool spot. Visited my fam who absolutely loves this place. Love the Hawaii vibe to it. Makes us feel like we're back home.   Let me address the 4-star vs 5-star rating: It wasn't a bad place. I took one star away because some of the dishes were seasoned a little too lightly. Maybe that's their style, which is fine, but it's not my preference.   Now, on to the food - BEST PANCAKES I'VE HAD. For that, I applaud you guys. I ate their two days in a row - once with my brother and once with my dad. One day I had the Kalua Benedict. It was good, but a little bland. Also ate the Tiramisu baby stack which was BOMB DIGGITY.  The next day I had the breakfast burrito, which was a solid burrito. I also ordered the Hazlenut pancakes. They were a little dry; not the pancakes themselves but the overall dish. Overall it was a good plate (or plates) of food.  THe staff was kind and very attentive. We had them play musical chairs quite a bit with our stroller and high chairs, but they were awesome the whole time. I'd go again, and I'd invite people there.

Nmm2GdwXJhaHulhtWGg-Pw.text: Great food! Portions leave you a little hungry but that's my only critique. The staff has always been friendly and the corn beef with garlic rice is phenomenal I tell my out of towners to go here.

OuSIYShiDnM-qEmi1i_uyQ.text: My Absolute Favorite Sunday Spot :) Food is amazingly delicious! Don't come here, I don't like waiting in line!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash Strawberry Pancakes

lzvTJyPKazJAxbjsEgPmDg.text: Smaller cafe style breakfast spot a little wait but not  an excruciatingly long one. The staff here are well versed in how to make this place work with the high volume of people who want to eat here. We got the Hawaiian Benedict which was a tad salty but that's spam for you. Strawberry short stack and a Cinnabon BabyStacks. Very good food!! Even my daughter stated 5 stars and she's picky with seasoning and texture of food. Waitress had many tables was still able to check in on us and take time with our order. We'd pick this place over the later ihop down the street.

uja7emulwK5SBJizgoXftw.text: I found this place a couple years ago and can't believe I have never reviewed it.   What lured me here are the Filipino offerings and the pancakes looked so good from the yelp pictures posted.  Ever since I found the place, hubby knows that I will be making at least one visit to the place before we leave Vegas!  I come here mainly for the signature pancakes .. bananas fosters!   It's so good that I can bring myself to try any other flavors.  Mini me loves their red velvet pancakes there too. We don't even attempt to try each other's pancakes either we are so stuck on what we like LOL.   The coffee is not great very watered down but I mainly come here for the pancake and some eggs and bacon.  The Filipino adobo and spam and eggs are good too.  They don't really do substitutions so be prepared if you are trying to cut calories.  Other than that I recommend the pancakes here and they are very affordable and also the place is small and gets very busy but they are worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster pancakes

GeKeseR1ZBKGgMqwS3pMMw.text: Great little spot! Tons of quality food and great service! I'm not big on Yelping but thought I would go out of the way to give them a good review. 5 out of 5.

cFqc7K25Y3FJ5aGnYwiyvg.text: Service was wonderful! Our waitress was so friendly and fast. I got my usual skillet and it was great! The lemon ricotta pancakes are my favorite! They are so light and flavorful. This location was much less crowded than the one in Henderson on the day I was there. No wait!

jlnGxZEevIQOfmIJgMmXrA.text: This Babystacks location is quite smaller than the other ones but the menu is the same and the service is indeed better since it's not as rushing and stressful like at the other locations. Our waitress was very nice and attentive and we were very happy with the food. I got the Spam Scramble and my husband got the Country Benedict. They were both delicious. Parking lot outside the restaurant has plenty of space which is a plus. The inside of the restaurant is small and it is kinda hard to move around in such a tight space which is why I take one star off. Other than that, this place is great and we would definitely return.

tuY1_3bDmvgAsWTrVem7MA.text: Friendly atmosphere, great food and service. It was busy and we had to wait for a bit but totally worth it!

IGsZ7JB0O49JOPDFxY3KSw.text: The food here is great, nice location as well, a hidden gem.Their red velvet pancakes are to die for. Waiters/waitress are respectful.   Cons: water taste horrible, tasted like someone gave us toilet bowl water to drink. I told my waiter and he seemed a lil bit confused when I tried to explain the water tasted funny  but nevertheless he gave us some apple juice.   I will recommend the food, just skip the water!

Vsmigb2SbPmCsx_QbUP3kw.text: The food is delicious but some of the staff is rude. It's Monday morning and there's not that many people here, but we have to wait 25 minutes because they put all the two person parties at the 4 person tables and all that is available is 2 person tables.. and they won't hold our place on the list if we leave to go do something while we wait for 25 minutes because they don't know how to seat people in their restaurant. The biggest issue here is that i am an asshole, but they could do a better job. Lots of other good places doing it right around here.  Update: We let them know our frustration and they offered us a discount for our troubles the time before when we were removed from the waiting list for not waiting in their designated area. Still disagree with the way they do their waiting list but I appreciate them trying to make up for shortcomings. And again, the food is always 5 stars delicious.

tRRu_NhC_pYb3V8iUjdtMg.text: This place is SMALL and BUSY - which was a pretty good indication I'd probably like it.  Well, all I can say is that my son REALLY liked the oatmeal - other than that, it was passable, not something I'd rave about.  There's better breakfast spots in Vegas, TRUST me on that one...usually longer wait to be seated too elsewhere, but this place was okay.    I was really hoping for fantastic pancakes, but as a side, not so much.  Mine were dry, flat not fluffy, and barely warm enough to melt the butter, with very little flavor.  Perhaps if that was the base for something more decadent as on the menu, then I might have liked them more.  When you try a place that has "cakes" in the name for breakfast, you'd think the pan"cakes" would be the star of the show.  Not to me, and not to my son either.  The portion sizes were average, which is good to me since I didn't have any left overs, and I also wasn't left feeling like "that's it?" - for the prices, it was competitive with other similar type places.  I'd probably opt to say this wouldn't be where I'd choose for breakfast over other locations in the area.  Service was the best part of the meal, but I honestly felt very cramped being stuck right next to the server table thing.  I looked around, and there wasn't many other options for seating that weren't as cramped too.  I'd be more inclined to call in a to go order instead here!

h0hASzsqOMvR7pj-ALzz6g.text: Love this go too place with family and friends!!! Especially  when we are states apart and we come together!!! Yum

bOQXdHGVqmVaWy42SuuLuw.text: Their Hawaiian Benedict is so creative and yummy! Came here two days in a row just to get some.   Their pancakes are soooo sweet and decadent. If you have a big sweet tooth, this place is definitely for you.

YTsZQQevlfzAZtDskbTg5w.text: They have the best service, and best food. Wait times can be long because they're so desired! 100/100

ThxTDfcH_MbzPsuvBe_FQg.text: Love this place, always great service and the food is the bomb.  Loco Moco is my fav.  Sorry, had to eat before I took photo.

XkeUAbBwxjnDoVR9F9bHRA.text: I'm not a big breakfast person nor do I like pancakes, but this place is goooood!! I had kalbi with garlic rice and upgraded my sides to a banana fosters stack. Omg it was good!! Service was wonderful and fast

UFZxbC9mZTm7YJOtG6sVVg.text: Danielle and the rest of the crew here continue to rock it.   Awesome Sunday morning breakfast again.   Great job folks.

XtEBdPLxSXDmADLTbK9OIQ.text: The exterior of the building is unappealing and we didn't feel like going inside; however, this was recommended to us. So we went in and there was a sign "Please wait to be seated". So we waited. And waited. And waited.... There were several wait people.. and they all ignored us. So we walked out and won't go back again.  If wait staff are busy they could at least acknowledge the customer with a "Be right with you." It is quite simply, rude to totally ignore a guest for what seemed like an eternity.

EclapLeW-ts2-uhvvXKqOg.text: HANDS DOWN BEST RED VELVET PANCAKES  OMG.... Just thinking about it makes me feel sad I don't have one here in L.A  will forever drive out of the Strip to eat here!!!! So yummy  it's always packed too but you know it's because food is DELICIOUS

qLJZdXgNZPIlIXopp4KKGA.text: Baby got stacks!!! And stacks and stacks to choose from, of pancakes might I add! This was my first time coming here and I left fat, full, and beyond satisfied!! Baby stacks menu gave me an island feel with offerings like Kalbi and eggs, Portuguese sausage, and a fried rice omelet!   I had to try the Kalbi and eggs! It came with rice, 2 over easy eggs, and the star of the show..Kalbi ribs. The eggs were cooked perfectly, which is an art these days! The rice was took up a notch seasoned with furikake! The Kalbi was tender and the flavors would have had mothers everywhere dodging slaps! Yes I said it, my breakfast was slap ANYBODY'S mama good!   Last and more than mentionable, I took home the Nutella crepes for my kids to try being they were not invited. Long story short! These crepes were much too good for children! They were slamming! The Nutella was so creamy and rich, the crepe was cooked to perfection, and the bananas were the perfect match! Let's just say maybe next time Kids! *wipes Nutella from cheek*  This is a great place to meet with friends and also take your family for a good meal! Get there early they close at 2!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lsdjuEM_Ksxv39KrovFigA.text: I love BabyStacks. I normally go to the Durango location near the 215 but this location was slightly closer to where I lived. This was the first time I came to this location and I expected a long wait due to a smaller dining area. However I did not expect to wait longer than the estimated time wait due to mix up in the waiting list. This happened to another party as well and it's very frustrating. I only put three stars because the food was delicious as always. However for customer service I would give it one star.

CGfBwheyWokNPJSwzkEIhw.text: 1st time eating at this place, and I have 2 give it 5 stars!!! Our waitress, TRUC was the best!!!! She greeted us with smiles and explained the dishes to us. She was patient and descriptive. She was very nice and recommended different dishes! BC of her, we will be back!!!  I am a person that belives in good customer service and also give props when due!!!! If u r reading this, you should be on your way there now to eat some Yum  !!!

4BC07HxIRZoE0UpV6OYMKQ.text: Normally I really enjoy Babystacks but today I cannot say that. While I understand there is normally a wait for a table I do not understand while the hostess Adrianna would think it was ok to sit a party before us that came in later than we did. Here's how the excuse that the wait list is different than the lobby wait(??) Yeah, I dont understand that one either. When I asked for the manager you could tell she had that panicked moment.  The manager Jamie said she already knew what the complaint was but how could she? I hadn't said anything other than I wanted to speak to a manager. So obviously the hostess knew what she had done, she lied about it and tried to insult my intelligence by doing so. Very poor customer service and to top it all off the banana cream pancakes were bland. Btw I didn't want the 10 percent discount I dont have a problem paying full price for good customer service.  I can forgive everything but bad customer service.  I dont know if I will return to Babystacks.

322Iq7_oiwF4PYedzp9I0A.text: Oh what a breakfast! If you haven't eaten here, you owe it to yourself to give it a shot. There is always a wait as the restaurant is pretty small, but if you're a party of two, it seems easier to be seated quickly. Be prepared, though, you may be sitting REALLY close to people at the next table. I hate this, but for such an awesome breakfast, I'll sacrifice.  I am not a pancake eater- I'm an egg & meat lover, but I just *had* to try the red velvet stacks. BabyStacks allows you to add their specialty stacks to your egg order, so I ordered a skillet (always my breakfast favorite) and added the red velvet pancakes.   The red velvet pancakes are not too thick, not too thin, sprinkled with mini chocolate chips and a generous dollop of whipped cream. The cream cheese syrup is to die for - it just totally reminds me Nothing Bundt Cake frosting! It's like eating chocolate cake for breakfast, which may gross some people out, but for a chocolate lover it's sinfully delightful.  The skillet was one of the better skillets I've had in Vegas. They layer potatoes, cheese, and any omelet choices and top them off with eggs any style. I ordered my skillet with onion, tomaotes, spinach, cheddar cheese and sausage. It was gigantic, could barely finish half, but so full of flavor. The tomatoes were very sweet - just the way I like them.  Next trip: carrot cakes with cream cheese syrup!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet pancakes!

95YsstTBXDfqUNGq2iVbdA.text: My boyfriend and I have gone here twice so far and are dying to go back again. The first time we went, he got the lemon ricotta pancakes with his steak and eggs and I got the cinnabon pancakes with my egg breakfast. Absolutely delicious, especially the lemon ricotta. They have a cream cheese icing for some of the pancakes that I just want to drink by itself.  I know how gross that sounds, but once you try it, you'll understand.   The second time we went, which was just this morning, we had our same server and hostess! I loved that. They are both super smiley and welcoming. My boyfriend got the same as before and this time, I got the "make your own skillet" with carrot cake pancakes. I almost ate all of my pancakes before I even started on the skillet which had mushrooms, onions, and green bell peppers over potatoes with melted cheese. I chose cheddar and got scrambled eggs. With some cholula drizzled on top, I was in heaven. I enjoyed every bite and every bit of service :P they rock! We will definitely be going back soon. :)

m-HhlxA3KnnJ1_rFq4gwUw.text: Good pancakes, but overpriced for the quality & portion sizes. The idea of Red Velvet pancakes (which is what I ordered) is awesome & the fact that it is topped with whip cream & chocolate chips is also awesome, but it is not a super powerful red velvet flavor for the price you pay.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes

Ri9OFsRXbkAJAp_L7Vue6w.text: Love this place the French honey toast are to die for...the only sad thing is that they are only open from 9am till noon ...way better than I hop staff is friendly...but food is delicious...

TLb5O5IKzbuL6Nkq_EU5hg.text: Came here for the first time, first off was seated and never greeted by the waitstaff, then a table beside us got seated and they were greeted by the waitress and she took the drink order while we had yet to be waited on or our drink order taken, then the waitress had a attitude toward us when we asked her about it. If this is how you operate your establishment here baby's tacks, this will be the first and only time I will come here.  The food was mediocre ..I ordered the cowboy omelet with salsa, well the salsa didn't look like salsa so I didn't even touch it. The baby stacks pancakes had no flavor to it. Actually none of the food had no flavor at all. If I wasn't hungry I would of sent it all back. This will be the last time I come here..Maria was the worst server I had

q_wkqGVzcP4yYS0tMcHEzw.text: Best breakfast/brunch in North Summerlin, for sure. Best huevos rancheros I've ever had, great service, coffee and water refills before you even ask, and AMAZING pancakes. Amazing. Like 30 different kinds and flavors, and they're small so your group could get multiple flavors to try and share. Red Velvet, cookies and cream, classic chocolate chip, and S'more are some of my favorites. Additionally, some of the dishes are influenced by Filipino island flavors, like Rick's adobo fried rice "omelette" and the Kahlua pig Benedict--the bomb! Not a ton of seating, and it's a popular place so expect a little wait, but it's totally worth it. My favorite place to eat in Vegas.

rRKfT8GynNFtvQKHFD-tDA.text: I have been here a couple times with husband.  The pancakes are good and they have a really large variety of pancakes available.  It was really busy there but we were seated promptly and served quickly.

Zqlns6A936Hy7M5-e9HxkA.text: Baby stacks is a good delicious place. We came here for breakfast and they give you a really big breakfast.. The staff was friendly and great customer service our waiter made sure our cups were never empty. We will be coming back, thank you!

U-Y6CYgfVDqTw4le-ekFzg.text: Excellent food with a Hawaiian flair. The staff has always been very helpful and attentive. I recommend this place without reservation.

p_sr7dfAq46p_4vXOnibZA.text: Sometimes I wish I lived in Las Vegas just so I could come here for breakfast regularly. Keep in mind this place is off strip so you need to drive, but the menu and prices are awesome! Also, be prepared for a wait and keep in mind it's easier to get a table for 2 than for a larger group.  My two favorite dishes are the red velvet pancakes and the adobo fried rice. I've tried other pancakes here, but the red velvet are the best BY FAR. They even come with a side of cream cheese syrup. It's like having dessert for breakfast! The adobo fried rice comes wrapped in an omelet and is awesome!  I've also tried the spinach eggs benedict which is very tasty. It comes with a side of buttery hash browns. I will definitely be tryng the kalua pork benedict next time. The spam scramble sounded interesting, but was nothing special. The french toast is also not very good. Take my advice and try my two favorite dishes to make the trip worth it.

HRwArosvgFBdhid6ohAtVA.text: YUM! Super busy place but got in quickly. Extremely friendly people, great service and food. Be sure to try the red velvet pancakes, they're delish! Will definitely be returning as well as recommending to my friends!

_sJWinkkZ1ku91EPp7oGQA.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day! So might as well make it the best too.  I came here a few days ago with a friend and the place was packed, waited about 30 minutes to get seated, but it was worth the wait. Once we we got seated we got immidiate service, our coffee was brought to us faster than we could order it.   I looked at the menu for a good minute since everything looked delicious, i am a simple girl and dont like having to choose between so many awesone choices. Why cant i just choose them all?!  Anywho, i ordered the red velvet pancakes(short stack) and 3 beautifully sized, fluffy red pancakes arrived in less than 10 minutes(now i remind you that i waited an extra 40 minutes to eat, so i was starving)  and my friend ordered cookie butter french toast.  About my pancakes: WHAT THE H*** WERE THESE THINGS MADE OUT OF? CRACK? I didnt eat the pancakes, i inhaled them. They were so good! I wanted more when i was done(even though i was about to explode) and still to this day i am craving them.   French toast: i tried some of my friends and it was delicious as well. If i wasnt so stuffed from my pancakes i probably would of inhaled them too while my friend was in the bathroom.   I definetly recommend this place. The food wasnt the only thing that was outstanding, the service was as well.

PpWtfaJ-U9kuOo67mLDFZg.text: Love this place! I recommend the adobo fried rice or omelette! And of course everyone's favorite is the red velvet pancakes

W6pnjlwFHJlrUMXrtJt0Vw.text: I wasn't very hungry so I just got a short stack of there bacon pancakes. They were pretty good and although I give the restaurant 4 stars i would I've the pancakes a 3. All the bacon was condensed in the middle. They were very tasty though.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OVTYxjRk9YdGEKUpmz4a1Q.text: My son begs to come here.... So, it is rare... But when I have time to be alone with just my son, baby stacks is our breakfast date.... He ordered the delicious moist red velvet pancakes and I got an omelette with the most amazing ricotta lemon pancakes.... They used to put more ricotta in them, but still good.... The wait to get in is always long...., but worth it.... Suggestions.... Go back to the original ricotta recipe and have a better coffee selection menu.... See you in my next date with my son....

bK4EHzuKjC8iBaO1GRiqMQ.text: Amazing food and service. Small quaint cafe for small groups. So many different choices and each one Ono.

gu_gOm5dJN177yHdB5NarQ.text: Great food, bad service. The food here really is delicious and the prices are unquestionable, but as  someone that works in Food & Beverage we know that SERVICE IS #1. My mother came in an hour before they closed and they Absolutely had no wait and she needed a table for 2, yet they wouldn't seat her until I have arrive. She mentioned she was even ready to order, but they still made her wait with empty tables in the dining room.  How are you going to make an elder women wait and not let her sit and ORDER?! Party of 1 or 2 she will still be sat at a table for two anyways?!  RIDICULOUS. I even called the manage and said she's ready to order can you please seat and her they said they'll "TRY" to work something out.  I arrive and no one has even spoke to my mother. Not only did the manger lie to me on the phone, but they won't even seat a guest with empty tables in the dining room. Never going back to this location.

bRW4PdiMfQcIlh_5NHbTVw.text: Amazing food. I 100% recommend the Orange Creamsicle pancakes if you're looking for a fun exciting flavor. It's my favorite and I order it all the time. If you're worried about how their savory breakfasts taste, don't be. It's the perfect place to go. Workers are nice, food is delicious. What's not to love?

WVgr91jDxVU9u7u7TZoCxw.text: Long Wait? Why not looks like a cool spot packed w cool people. Fourty minutes crammed into a cashier section to taste some nasty ass artificial butter spray in the pancakes or artificial sweetener-  Lemon ricotta pancakes? Sounds AMAZING LIGHT & Fluffy.. Got greasy thin pancakes that tasted like Duncan Hines lemon cake batter thinned out to form a pancake- artificial tasting nastiness- RICOTTA? Wha? No visible traces of such an ingredient?? Sons chocolate chip pancakes looked great tasted like fake butter & sweet & low- Hmf omelette.. First ingredient seasoned sausage? More like the fool in the kitchen got a bit excited using a gang of cilantro & green onion w hard to find "sausage" -omelette dry as f*ck Bathroom out of order made it all even better No espresso - am I wrong to need it?

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny omelette missing the main ingredient (seasoned sausage) disappointing @ best
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks 10x better than tastes

fQnRtuyx78OPSaoOc3AtSg.text: Dude whenever a friend want to grab breakfast and I'm not being picky about my weight I take them here whenever I have somebody who comes in to see me from Ohio or Chicago I take them here seriously red velvet pancakes with cream cheese frosting...or the orange Julius pancakes they have a lemon ricotta pancakes they have Smore's pancakes they have peanut butter and jelly pancakes I mean anything your little heart desires they have!!!!!

d_7fEUgvT7Q5JhLrHJIvPg.text: decided to make Babycakes part of my NYE festivities since i was going to be in the north part of Vegas most of the day.  Besides, I have a couple Groupons to use.  So gf and i originally decide let's hit it before we go to Aliante to sign up for nye bingo and pick up tickets for the Journey cover band playing post-bingo at Aliante.  When we get to Babycakes, big surprise, the place is packed - 45 minute wait. We put our name in and take the chance to drive to Aliante and return in time for brekafast.  It did take 45 minutes but they already called our name - we did call them to ask that they move our name lower - they refused ...bummer.  so we get back t Babycakes - another 30 minutes .  We order the Rick's adobo rice , the pork bennie and we dshared a small stack of the red velevet pancakes.  Service was good - timely refills, food came out reasonably fast.  The food ?  mixed bag - the gf's adobo rice - i didn't notice on the menu - it's an omelet filled with fried rice.  I like the creativity but didn't quite get there on taste - i kinda laughed since it reminded me of an occasional sunday breakfast for me - take your leftovers from the night before and jam it into an omelet.  The pancakes were tasty - didn't need the whipped cream - again, a creative dish.  the pork bennie  - again, i like the creativity and i did like the saltiness of the pork mixed with the egg but it definitely needed more bernaise sauce  and the potatoes ??  for such a creative menu, the potatoes SUCKED !   I have another groupon so i'm sure i'll hit  Babycakes again but not sure if it's travel worthy.

mckuEi2LaQQmslQHeXtS2A.text: The food is amazing Banana Foster pancakes are the best ever as well are the skillets. BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN VEGAS!

lfw0mEiDgucd5dHjIrnknQ.text: I am not usually a fan of pancakes, but this changed my mind wholly! The best breakfast place I've ever tried, and the most creative! Everyone must try the Red Velvet Pancakes once in their lives! It's a must!!! Ps. Be sure to have patience on the day of because there might be a waiting list for a table!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popeye&#39;s crepe.
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Ruben Sandwich =)

65Jo86t9CrTPtfo_MXA23g.text: Came to pay another visit to this up and coming spot!  I kept blabbing about the red velvet pancakes to my girl and  convinced her that it was worth a try (she's not much of a foodie.. yet!)   Got here before noon and was seated right away. I couldn't help notice this lady that was seated right next to me. She looked so familiar.. Well, it was my first invited friend on Yelp! She provides some of the most interesting reviews: Blair B.! Hi Blair! And Megan S., nice meeting you as well! What a small world..  The Belly Pleasers:  Corned Beef Hash and Eggs: Came neatly plated, corned beef was the typical canned stuff but for being canned, it was satisfying. I must note that I do prefer the real stuff (shredded/chunky) but their stuff did have a slight advantage over almost identical looking corned beef I've eaten at other places before. There maybe something with the oil the cook it in or some special seasoning they throw on there?! I also decided to try their seasoned potatoes. They looked plain but once again, they were tastier than I expected. Results, Nothing over the top but I was happily filled up!  *Chicken Fried Steak with Hash, still Reigns Supreme!  Carrot Pancakes: I wanted to try something different, since my girl ordered the obvious red velvet pancakes that she wasn't gonna finish and scoot over my way anyways.. The carrot pancakes came with the same cream cheese syrup, nuts sprkinkled on top, had the same texture as the velvets and tasted good, borderline great.. BUT in no way compared to the Red Velvet Pancakes!!  Red Velvet Pancakes: my girl ordered the short stack (3 pieces). She took a few bites but didn't really express her emotions much but I could tell by her facial reactions that it was captivating! She finished more than half the order, more than I expected and said "they were delicious! I really liked the little sprinkled mini chocolate chips and the whipped cream".. Another happy customer :)..   Round 2: Everything was pretty much as Great as the 1st Time!

dtogJHkL4R5Fd0hbK8oCSg.text: Oh my it was brunch time and still crackalizing! If you didn't understand that, it was packed! I wouldn't really suggest coming here in groups bigger than 4. Although, I'm sure you can it'll jus be a longer wait.   I ordered the Kalua pig Benedict and my boyfriend ordered the adobo omelette. And together we ordered a short stack of red velvet pancakes as a dessert. That's how we get to try a little bit of every goodness. The kalua Benedict was perfect the way it was made. The yoke breaking over the meat and the crispy edges of the meat added a smokey hint to it. I tried some of the adobo omelet and it was good, but I've had bigger for the same price at aloha kitchen. On the other hand, the macaroni salad that came with it was unique with it's hint of crab meat. The red velvet pancakes was the perfect puzzle piece for my belly's satisfaction with it's sweet cream cheese syrup.   The service was on point and friendly. The parking is plenty. Be aware, it's disguised in an industrial area.  I am most certainly filled and ready to come back to try the s'more pancakes.

pzFy_8Eo0FogGDGlEm5Khw.text: All their pancakes are awesome and the kalua pig/grilled cheese sandwich is bomb too!

AhjGJG7Wde5zpIMwXSTRgQ.text: The wait is absolutely bananas.   BUT, I did manage to make a few people angry by realizing that take out is 100 times more convenient than sitting in a small dining area and waiting for an hour. I ordered and left.. in about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, all the angry folks stared as we walked out with our delicious meals in hand.   As for the food, the red velvet pancakes are definitely a must try. We built our own omelette, that was just okay. The seasoned potatoes are  little fried cubes of tastiness. Ohh, add some blueberry pancakes, and we filled our tanks up with only $22.   AHHHH- MAZING.

qM-CU5bTf5JAYvoY7-A2_A.text: The hostess was extremely rude.  Acted as if we were an inconvenience for showing up.   We had to greet her to even get an acknowledgment that we were standing in front of her.. No pleasantries, just a short annoyed huff and puff followed by "how many, 10 mins"  Food was good.

ytA5wbXLAa4xmaL84t4S-w.text: I love food, and I have had the pleasure of experiencing tons of particularly good food in my life.   Very rarely, however, have had moment where tasting food left me speechless for a full five minutes.   That is exactly what happened when I tasted the red velvet pancakes at Babycakes Cafe. There is absolutely no way 5 stars does them justice. They are heaven personified in a pancake.   The other food I tasted was exceptional as well. The eggs, hashbrowns and bacon I had were cooked right to order and very fresh. The person I went with tried one of the Benedict options, and it was quite tasty too with homemade hollandaise. I also sampled the honey whole wheat pancakes and they were marvelous. Their secret is entirely homemade pancake batters, and the work pays off.   Service was satisfactory; we were always greeted with a smile by every employee we came across and the food came out quickly despite being quite busy at the cafe.   This place is well worth the drive from where I live in the University area, and I will be back.

qXQelGft7aDy_9zrw4WqbA.text: Before heading back to reality and heading home, my friends and bf wanted a nice good breakfast to end our fun weekend in the Sin City and with the helped of yelp it brought us to this place. Upon driving up to this place you can already see groups of people waiting outside so you must know that this restaurant is good.   I had their Kalua Pig Benedict which I enjoyed a lot. I would recommend this dish to anyone who likes egg benedict.   My boyfriend had their Portuguese Sausage and Eggs and it was okay, don't think he'll get it again as the sausages were just sausages, nothing really stood out with this dish. The garlic rice that he order had too much garlic in it as well. Will not recommend this dish to anyone.   Tried a few pieces of their Red Velvet Pancakes and it was good, little too sweet for me, but no complaints here.   Also tried their Buttermilk Pancakes and again it tastes like pancakes to me. Honestly I can see why people would stand for over an hour to eat here, this please is pretty good, but next time I'm in town I would just pick up the phone and order, lesson learned. =]

ZjD72TNEcNDzXLX6YPmfcQ.text: Hearing praises from friends and reading about it elsewhere, I was initially overjoyed to end up here after a shopping trip with my brother at the Premium Outlets North. However, the service and the food were lackluster at best.  Being seated on a Wednesday afternoon, my brother and I were fully expecting to evade the normal rush. However, this didn't stop service from being inattentive and practically non-existent. Sitting for a few minutes without being acknowledged at our table, another waitress noticed our unsettled behavior, and quickly made amends with service. Normally, I'd understand a wait, but Babycakes has about 15 tables throughout the restaurant. Small is an understatement, and in this, I didn't understand the neglectful service we received. I felt more attended to by our neighboring table's child than by the wait staff.   My brother and I shared the Lemon Ricotta pancakes and the adobo fried rice. The adobo fried rice was nothing special - other than surprising me in being wrapped in an omelet. The Lemon Ricotta pancakes were the biggest disappointment. I fully expected lemony, fluffy crepes; however, what was placed on my table were dry, bland crepes. Nowhere could I identify an ounce of ricotta, and the only lemon throughout was squeezed on myself.   The price is decent for the portions we got, but the taste isn't justified for that price. Overall, for such an adorable concept, I was disappointed by the lack of service and lack of flavor.

2F-wzxCSRVh9onMcHHI4Ew.text: As everyone else, I'd heard and read so many things about this place, (especially the red velvet pancakes) I had to try it. First try was on a holiday and there was an hour wait, so my daughter and I decided to come back another time.  Second try was the very next day, a Tuesday at around 9am, and there was no waiting. We were excited to try the red velvet pancakes! We ordered a full stack to share and bring extras home. We had other things too, but the pancakes was what we craved! SOOOOO YUUUUUM! My daughter couldn't stop eating them! I couldn't either, I must confess! We'll be back....maybe even try something else on the menu!

1FEmi_m0dEDH-q-JgWG-zQ.text: I have not liked pancakes for over 10 years and could not even stomach the thought of them. But I will absolutely murder Baby Stack's pancakes!! And their chicken adobo omelette is everything!! Their service is just as fabulous as their food too. We absolutely love it here!!!!

JN6bNW3ZxH-jHv8Oloo2ww.text: Red velvet pancakes, with a cream cheese icing syrup- absolutely amazing. No, the syrup may not have been cream cheese- I don't remember, I asked the waitress but was so blown away that I was probably busy licking my plate while she told me about how the syrup was made.  The food here is astonishingly unique, fresh and tasty. We split an order of the red velvet pancakes and an order of Rick's Adobe Fried Rice (a Filipino dish) and the combo of sweet and savory was heavenly.  Worth a trip from the Strip- in fact, this is the best meal we ate the entire time we were in Vegas. Cab it over to Babycakes- this beats any hotel buffet or local color greasy spoon, hands down.

rFMDCd2ILI0TXO2LM3Q8cQ.text: Super cute little breakfast/brunch joint with a pretty unique menu - not your standard generic breakfast. I was excited to try the red velvet pancakes, which did live up to the hype. They're so pretty and fluffy with great flavor. Even just a half stack is more than enough, I think the full would've been too much of a good thing. Wheat French toast kind of looks more like pork chops in my pic, but its actually thick slabs of bread dipped in a corn flake crust for a really different texture. I was excited to try their French toast based on the description, but it was a little dry and overwhelmingly sweet to me. I ended up just having 1 piece.  I didn't try my friend's strawberry crepe, but presentation was pretty. Service was surprisingly bad despite it being pretty slow. I'm always a little shocked when little homey restaurants like this don't provide good service. There were maybe 10 tables max with 2 or 3 servers working. The waitress was sweet and nice, but I almost had to beg her for a 3rd place setting. We also ceased to exist once the food came, had to beg again for a refill of their watered down coffee. Tried unsuccessfully twice to flag her down to pay the bill, only to be told that she didn't do that - we had to pay up front.  I really wanted to love this place because it was so cute, but I don't think ill be back. Just have to be on the lookout for another place w red velvet pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes - half stack
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry crepe

g32i44BehxgkhMdkvqcT-A.text: Great pancakes and everything is pretty good. Servers are always nice and on point. The wait is a little crazy on weekends, so be ready to wait an hour or so.

Eq0Wi7B-Uat5Es1y9D6PdQ.text: My husband, daughter, and I came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning and we sat right down at a table.  I agree with everyone else that the pancakes are very good, but my daughter was the only smart one.  She ordered Banana Nut pancakes, yum!! I ordered the sausage and eggs and I wasn't impressed.  I asked for over medium eggs and I got less than over easy eggs.  I'm kind of wondering if they were cooked at all.  They didn't have much flavor either and they just ended up being a soupy mess on my plate.  My husband ordered the Kahuna Pig eggs benedict and was not impressed either.  I'm dissappointed as I had high hopes for this place. If you want just pancakes, this place is probably the best, but everything else we tried was no good! Back to Jamm's we go.

8BDDcS2nTQgoa_eQB9f_6g.text: Both times, we had to wait 15 to 20 minutes to be seated, but the wait was well worth it. Their entrees are generous and delicious. I'm not a pancake eater, but their red velvet pancakes are the best pancakes I've ever had. Their wait service is great, attentive, fast, friendly, and courteous. Sorry IHOP, BabyStacks got you beat in all categories.

_q1G6FgWlLJMZgqlp9g_Bg.text: This place is always crowded. The seating is jammed right next to each other it's uncomfortable to have a conversation. That is if you can hear yourself speak in the first place. I've tried three times to eat here and always leave because I can't stand to be packed in so tightly with a bunch of strangers. Not private at all. Horrible atmosphere.

Cso5okN7XNrGYViK6SdiXg.text: I had pretty high expectations going into this place and while I wasn't disappointed, I wasn't swept off my feet.    I got an omelette, I forget what it was called, but it had avocado and bacon and cheese.  It was good!  It was a perfect portion for me.  The Cracked Egg has a much bigger portion but I end up with leftovers all the time anyway.  However, I am also a very small person.  I loved that it only cost a couple dollars extra to upgrade my pancakes from plain buttermilk to the.. of course.. RED VELVET PANCAKES.  Lol!  They were definitely good and pleasing and different however... just like my overall opinion of this place... nothing to go out of my way for.  The service was attentive, and the place was very small.  I went on a weekday morning so there was no wait but I can't imagine on a weekend morning!  Was pleased and will go back, but nothing I can see myself craving.

OSvIsPSiAiU5zVAx7M_tow.text: We went early today ( Saturday) knowing that the wait is usually long. We waited about 20 minutes, not too bad but we won't be coming here any time soon on our own volition.   I ordered the Huntington Omelette-  the omelette kinda sucked- the avocado on top was not ripe and the cheese had no flavor. The hash browns which we ordered extra crispy were only half cooked (hate to see how they would have been otherwise).   I did not bother to take more than 4 or 5 bites. I did order the Red Velvet Pancakes-  they deserved 4 stars! They were very good.     My husband ordered  the corned beef hash which he said  was "nothing to write about.  He thought it tasted very bland & almost canned although the menu states it was home made.  He was also disappointed in the hash browns.  He ordered the Smores pancakes.  He liked them-I found them way too sweet. .   Service was quick and our server was pleasant.

BmggPxT3WreDpzgqjMaxyw.text: Food is great but service is horrible! This place has no organization. Front cashier girl is horrible and very unprofessional. We were told 45 minute wait and waited almost an hour and a half! No courtesy to walk out and let us know there will be a longer wait nor an apology for such a long wait. Cashier gets her manager and I see her laugh at the fact that we were complaining about the wait. And then she gives my family and I dirty looks. Definitely won't be coming back here again.

fK4fGPIKRxy96ZjCLgtuTQ.text: The Red Velvet pancakes was good Not Great like everyone Hype it up to be. Don't like that they close so early. Not everyone can get up so early in the day. People work all different hours in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yHP6TZOHm5SfU7m0KTLopQ.text: I must say this is amazing love the food . So you might wonder why is that I gave it 1 star and that is customer service . The hostess girl with glasses has no sense on how to treat customer.

fwZh56-KOzjjRG5FtU7r7w.text: OMG!!! First time we ever went & let me tell you it was AMAZING! My son had a kids meal, I had red velvet pancakes(BOMB.com) & my husband had corned beef & eggs! LOVED it will be back soon.

GkN8m8gv9-ca7-rfW7od8w.text: To be honest I had no idea about how AWESOME of a place this cafe is. If you're a fan of AMAZING breakfast options I highly recommend you check this place out. I had the pleasure of coming here for a Book Club meet up. We are a group of Sci Fi/ Fantasy readers who are female food lovers. Our fearless leader set up this Brunch and let me tell you I was really impressed. Upon entering the parking lot the place didn't look too special but I could see lots of people waiting for a table. I was running late as USUAL so once I entered we had already been seated. Our  server Jacob was prompt at greeting me politely with a smile and asking what he could get me to drink while he went to grab me a menu.  I literally opened it up expecting to go with my normal go to breakfast choice when I was #MINDBLOWN. They have so many different options from Red Velvet Pancakes to these awesome fancy eggs benedict dishes. I had a really hard time deciding what to go with but I couldn't help but wanting  try the Fried Rice Stuffed Omelet. I however didn't trust myself to just impulsively go with my gut choice without asking Jacob what his thoughts were on the dish.  He smiled that bright smile and stated it was DELICIOUS and one of the most popular dishes. Let me tell you he was RIGHT!  about 3 of the 8 ladies went with the fancy eggs benedict varietes another got a crepe and some fruit. Since I didn't try any of them all I can say is EVERYONE had empty plates . My dish was super yummy but HUGE so I ended up bringing half of it home. I am terrible at remembering the names of items but I will say this place is priced around 10-15$ per entree but you get TONS of food and good quality taste and EXCEPTIONAL service. I was helped by Happy and Friendly people even when checking out and paying at the front. What impressed me the most though was they had no problem giving us seperate checks and at NO TIME were we rushed at all even while we were done eating and sitting there talking the afternoon away. I can't wait to return with my family to try out some more awesome dishes...If you're a breakfast person or even just a fan of delicious asian fushion give this place a shot!

67YQldz5b3Thf5WKOy9B5g.text: It's customary to wait 45 minutes for a table here on the weekends. The unusual part is that I wait joyously and eager for a table the entire wait. I believe that everyone around me feels the same way as we wait for the BEST PANCAKES in town! So delicious,  I savor every bite! Rocky road, red velvet, and carrot cake... just to name a few. Rumor has it they're opening a second location.... I can only dream.

q1K_w0sa07itbBaTRrS2Gw.text: If you want an awesome breakfast experience that will delight you in the morning and make you feel happy for the rest of the day - then eat here!  BUT, you must either come really early to ensure you are not waiting in line too long, or come an hour and a half before it closes (considered lunch time - or Brinner if you will) so that the wait isn't as long as in the morning.    I ordered the Adobo fried rice.  It comes wrapped up in an egg omelete.  A little much egg for me, but the adobo fried rice itself was really good!  In fact, my mouth is watering as I'm typing this out.  That's how good it is!  Then I ordered a short stack of the Peanut Butter and Jelly pancakes with banana.  Best pancakes I have ever had.  I loved it!  You have to come here and order both an entree and another entree just for the pancakes.  You will not regret the calorie intake!  The people I came with had the corn beef hash, the portoguese sausage and eggs, and of course the infamous red velvet pancakes.  The full stack is huge!  They both very much enjoyed their meal as well.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.  It's so good!

3GL9iurapI_sszjZK_x7mg.text: The red velvet pancakes topped with fresh whipped cream and chocolate crumbles, served with cream cheese syrup are amazing. We also loved the carrot cake pancakes, yummy. My all-time favorite though is the Kailua pig benedict spectacular.   Delicious food but they need a larger space, they are always packed

o-p6ZAl7_HE4atoKgMSVvA.text: Food:  The pancakes are absolutely delicious. The rest of the food gives anyone a homely environment, but it is like any other breakfast joint with a little more variety and substitutions available.  Come here for the variety of pancakes, but the eggs, bacon, sausage, spam, etc. are just plain "regular."  Cost:  Without a Groupon, I can't imagine spending $30 plus tip here for two people for breakfast.

mIRXEXfUM8zMGY44YN_xgg.text: Outstanding! Staff were really nice... food was great. Prices were not over the top.   Do stop in and give them a try...well worth the short drive from the strip to enjoy a great breakfast.   Get there early! Place is small... but.,... I think they are moving to a larger location... so this should help.

A48kHzlyBueUo9gBs6P9qg.text: After reading all the fabulous reviews, I've been dying to try this place!  Babycakes is nestled in a tiny plaza (which I didn't see anything that was corporate, just Mom & Pop places) on Buffalo, near Smoke Ranch.   My friend and I showed up here at 11:25am on a Saturday and were told a 45 minute wait.  No prob!  Gave us time to catch up.  45 minutes later we go up to the hostess stand and were told we needed to wait another 20-30 minutes longer.  ugh!  really?  I was ready to gnaw off my arm!  Finally, an hour and five minutes later, we were sat.  We decided to order: -A Single Nutella Crepe w/ Strawberries: served w/ whipped cream and almonds. TO.DIE.FOR!  OMG!  Everything you expect in a delicious crepe with Nutella.  The fresh strawberries sent it over the edge.  So good!  We shared: - Short Stack of Red Velvet Pancakes: topped w/ whipped cream & chocolate crumbles, served with cream cheese syrup.  These were very good.  More like a dessert, but delicious!  The cream cheese syrup is what seals the deal!  It's like frosting, just a little thinner and not AS sugary as frosting.  Really.  You are eating cake for breakfast- and no one is judging!  My husband asked me to bring him home the Tuna Sandwich on Wheat.  The tuna was good, but not "like mom makes" if that makes sense.  We didn't touch the fries because they were cold by the time I got home.    I want to go back to get the Adobo Fried Rice and the Cinnamon Bun or the White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Pancakes. (those pancakes are seasonal).  I also want to try the hashbrowns,  bacon and omelettes.    Yes, everything looked delicious!

4piYmNl9Ru2wzxYG5xgVQQ.text: Had the red velvet pancakes.  The butter and frosting is really all you need.  It was so sweet that I didn't even touch the syrup.  The pancakes were nice and fluffy and were dusted with some chocolate powder.  It's like a cupcake and pancake combined!  Definitely a must try.

lLQi0IozX82ZW1TberAWAQ.text: It was a Monday at work.  I felt lonely at lunch.  I wanted to eat to give myself a False sense of happiness.  Good idea, right???  I fear change, so I got an omelet.  With egg whites and no cheese.  I wanted to be healthy.  It was still good.  Part of me wanted to get the adobo chicken or loco moco.  But I didn't, and got an omelet.  Egg whites, spinach, bacon, and mushrooms.  Solid breakfast here.  Instead of the normal side of pancakes, I got the red velvet pancakes to make up for my healthiness.  Wow, these were good.  I bet people who love sweet foods over savory would thoroughly enjoy this.  I would come here to check it out, but the long lines I'm not so sure about.

hKkPlYmHoS9Nb_UbGGqx8A.text: Nice original breakfast place in Summerlin. Pancakes were great. I had the lemon ricotta (light with delicious lemon cream sauce) and my son had the chocolate chip (lots of chips). The egg skillets we had were okay, not great. On the dry side. I'd come back for the pancakes next time were in Summerlin.

i0BvxYb-vEcB9HZyV_C6Mw.text: Pumpkin pancakes with graham sprinkles and cream cheese frosting & whip cream. Yes and yes. I had their  banana foster pancakes time before which was absolute heaven. The pancakes are just a touch sweet, but not overly so. Everything is very tasty and well prepared. I always come here when I go to Vegas.

2NFVcLNt0y3mQMuRn9y0rw.text: Shortly after my last review a manager contacted me and asked for me to come back and give them another try.  After awhile I finally did and am happy to say the service was much better and the food was super yummy.  We have been back a few times and I always get their egg breakfast and upgrade to whatever pancakes are on special.  I've really enjoyed the bananas foster and appreciate their serving sizes.  Great for sharing with a toddler who doesn't eat that much.  I can tell this is a businesses that really does care about their customers.  To bad they were not in a bigger location as the wait times can be bad especially when you have kids in tow. Which is always for my family.

n57yZ0UbXeDIvDHOOMSQug.text: Absolutely amazing food! This place has great customer service and is a great place to eat! Definitely try the Eggs Benedict or Loco Moco!

EVv9MpJ9rAv5Eq088cEwIA.text: The service was good, and seating was limited but the wait wasn't too long. I ordered the steak and eggs, with red velvet pancakes. The pancakes were really tasty, but the steak and eggs could have been better at a casino after midnight for 2.99

SJZUQR-Un2VRAN0QqnFHvQ.text: LOVE IT!   The red velvet pancakes are so delicious! Not too heavy either, even the cream cheese syrup is light & fluffy. Which ensures that you'll be able to enjoy some of their other awesome menu items!  I am a hawaiian girl, so I'll all about the portuguese sausage & eggs- thumbs up for authenticity! I just wish they would get coconut syrup for their macadamia nut pancakes!!!  Even my boyfriend loves Babycakes- he gets chicken fried steak everywhere we go & claims that they have the best. He's not very easy to please either- so this means alot.   The service is just as great as the food, everyone is so nice & helpful. The two times we've dined here- we have had outstanding service.   Can't wait for our next visit! =]

KsWrUNoN9QXGtJclATHfZA.text: The best food in Vegas!! My family absolutely love this place. Food and people are wonderful.

b0YV-HKJ7hb72u1JqGdiTQ.text: 2 stars for the food. Monica's service was below subpar. No refills, no checking on the table and gave us the wrong receipts. Her attitude today left a lot to be desired and we were overcharged. We paid but this is really unfortunate because I used to love this place.

l0rTkEQpKGlnzp86kjutCQ.text: LATE REVIEW: I had came here to meet up with my cousin before I hit the road back to Cali back on the last week of November 2015.   The restaurant itself is small. Parking wasn't bad. The wait is bad. It's not a great place to come to if all your friends are planing to meet up here. They don't sit you down unless your whole party is there.   The food was spectacular though and our server was very friendly and accommodating. And the wait for our food wasn't that long.   I ordered the Baby Chick Omlette and Cinnubun Pancakes  I highly recommend coming here especially if you're from out of town. It's a nice, relaxed ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

riawcUtwaxw0y04uxlYp-g.text: Good was great & server was fantastic! Jacob was super friendly & attentive. We tried the breakfast burrito with a side of bacon pancakes. Kids has chicken tenders w/ fries, BLT, egg/sausage/hash browns/pancake. We'd definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with seasoned fries

X4wM3EbBEidDdHWKdu18ew.text: I might be biased, but I love this place and recommend it as often as possible. The staff are very friendly despite being super busy almost all the time. The food is out of this world delicious and I promise you will leave full.  My favorite go tos include the Bananas Foster Pancakes and omlettes. But don't stop there, everything is great. They even do limited time pancakes!  The only thing to keep in mind is that if you are waiting for any members of your party they won't seat you until they get there. It's that busy. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette loving

MII7GuvHIs8rxqO12tYV6w.text: I looooove their red velvet pancakes. The down fall to this place is it's always packed. The down fall to us was that everyone was getting called before us and since our party was 6 adults and 2 toddlers the host kept sitting them before us. We recommend to her if she could put two table together we can get a table. But she insist on sitting us in the very back. Besides that I love this place. Pancakes are off the hook. We were all happy and our waitress was good.

FIm3hudjAXElJYZgYMHKrg.text: The menu is amazing! Peanut butter pancakes and garlic rice are my go to whenever I visit.. staff is always friendly..   My only grievance is that the tables are a bit small for the amount of condiments and portions served..

n3Be_1THCxjkBAGBDUY6bQ.text: If I could work here for food I would but then I'd have to spend all my free time at the gym! I'm so in love with the food! Everything was cooked perfectly right down to my over easy eggs and bacon. I love that they offer short stack pancakes. Took my sister and she got loco moco, I got the cookie butter French toast meal (what heaven tastes like), and we shared a short stack of red velvet pancakes. Ended up taking the pancakes home because we were too full lol. Great experience and will definitely come back again.

Nt6IsYkpXYQWyEV4i6aoZA.text: I've been to both this location and the one on Stephanie in Henderson. They both serve great food. I love their pancakes, especially the hazelnut ones. If calories didn't count, I could eat them every day. I also had the Mexican skillet at this location, which was very tasty and had a nice amount of spice. Our server was very pleasant, as was the one that took over when our original one took a break.  My only complaint was it was a little chilly in the restaurant.

cOaDjfVyhxwhSSjauO13lw.text: I absolutely love this place. The only thing is the waiting. It's a small restaurant so the wait is a little longer. Every time I go I'm never disappointed. One of my favorite babystacks are the red velvet pancakes, they are so scrumptious!!! The great thing is they have soooo many different style pancakes to choose from. They have a great menu as well. Lots of dishes to choose from, from omelets to skillets, typical breakfast dishes. I have to admit even on my lazy days I order them for pick up.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lj&#39;s scramble (kids menu)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs! Delish!!!

HE-gmOMCX8LWQI-uD6CjJQ.text: Decided to check this place out on our way back to Reno after seeing it on yelp. Oh man am I glad we did. First of all, the service. We got our much needed coffee within maybe 2 minutes of being seated. Also, our server (I want to say his name was Jake?) was so friendly and attentive. Coffee never dropped below half full. Now to the most important stuff: the food. O.M.G. It was delicious! I had a skillet with the hazelnut pancakes on the side, hubby had the adobo fried rice with red velvet pancakes, and our daughter had a short stack of the banana cream pancakes. We ate until we were beyond stuffed because it was too good to stop! The skillet had lots of flavor, I didn't even add hot sauce like I usually would. Pancakes were to die for. Husband was very impressed with the adobo, and he's usually hyper-critical of any adobo that isn't his mama's.    All in all, the 3 of us left very satisfied.

WcHngHE5ZOsNZ8FxLMLBXw.text: Love this place but because it's small, I usually order take out. Today when I called at 10:58 I was told it would be 20 minutes which is the norm. I just left at 11:44 with my food. I don't know if it's because there was a new hostess but another person complained about the same thing.   When I addressed it, the host simply said "oh...almost an hour?" I said "yes. I called at 10:58l. She just swiped my card and asked me to sign for my receipt. I understand new employees learn on the job, but an apology would have been nice considering I come here a lot and recommend to family and friends.

6kgM_EBlQB-f6aBP5etzEg.text: Wow! I had an excellent experience at this place. All of the ingredients used for our meals were fresh and high quality.  I had the macadamia nut pancakes with white chocolate- yum! The sour dough bread was delicious, seemed almost home made. The eggs were fresh and cooked properly. The bacon was thick cut and the club sandwich was huge! The service was great considering it was super busy. They also have some authentic Hawaiian and Filipino dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club sandwich
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs with bacon, macadamia nut pancakes

9K35y9jN9FPSuE0SGx_MkQ.text: Breakfast great ! Loved the carrot cake pancakes and banana cream pie pancakes ! Also the Portuguese sausage !!!!! Local Moco ! Wow !

x4RZN1Q6zaL6EmKi7gNf_A.text: Good food great service . Going to be be back for more. Senior breakfast special was just enough

HSQ1boWbQDqP8xIEWijumw.text: I used to love this place. It's now kind of on the "eh" side.  Giving it three stars because the pancakes were good (red velvet is my fav) and our server was awesome. Never ran out of water and my boyfriend never ran out of coffee.  I got the Portuguese sausage plate. It tasted like kielbasa. Not what I was looking for. I upgraded to the garlic fried rice and it clearly states that there are onions in the rice but DAAANG, These were fairly larger pieces of onion that were barely cooked. It didn't taste like garlic at all. Just sweated out onions mixed in some oily rice. My eggs came out okay though. After I picked out the onions and mixed everything together things kind of got better.  So let me talk about the dude with the ponytail when we walked in. I made eye contact and said hi to him. He did not say hi back. I said it loud enough for others to hear it. He did say hi to my boyfriend though. Boyfriend said hi back. Boyfriend noticed he didn't say hi back to me and kind of brushed it off. I hope he didn't hear me or something because that was kind of rude. It kind of put me in a bad mood for the rest of our experience here though so that kind of sucked.  If I go back I think I would get either the loco moco or the kaluha pork grilled cheese. They looked good. I don't care if it doesn't "match" with the super sweet pancakes. It's good for the soul and you can always treat those like dessert.   Make sure you come early and you are patient. This place gets really busy and it's really tight and cramped. Don't get impatient. It's not their fault.

UBXqKMT89ynNZ3SzJlp0WQ.text: First time here and I'm not disappointed. 5 stars for the Lolo Ricks adobo fried rice omelette with red velvet baby stack. I shared it with my boyfriend and it was the perfect amount for us to share and still leave feeling full and satisfied.  Luckily my boyfriend does not eat that much for a guy IMO (usually he's full with just a hamburger and fries combo). I only took away one star because they close at 2p. We arrived at 12:45 and we're seated immediately on a Monday. We heard about the hype and purposely did not come here during the weekend rush. Place is clean and small-medium establishment. Will be coming back for sure whenever I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Flixz7QJeLrAI1aebpm04A.text: Excellent service. The place is small so be prepared to wait for seating. Red velvet Pancakes....yummy.  Breakfast served fast and hot.  Enjoyed my Saturday morning here.

yzb0pfNKFbbXNkZ9OIRz7w.text: Breakfast Skillets! This place has changed my life and now I am constantly looking for breakfast skillets everywhere. Why aren't they more common? Maybe it's a West Coast thing. Pancakes were a bit too sweet, so I knocked off a star. Will 100% be back when I am in the area

xfz7YY_PB2LqGsyGIoBFTA.text: I'm not going to lie the food is beyond amazing, the two separate times I come on vacation I come here and order the kalbi with rice and every time without any exaggeration, we find hair inside.   I really don't want to give this rating for such a great food spot. But how can it be such a coincidence that I come order the same dish between different months that we can possibly find hairs in the food.   The first occasion when we found the hair we spoke to the manager and he switched the dish for us, the second time they just apologized and offered a free small stack. It's quite unfortunate that it happened twice but that's more than enough for me not to come back. Hygiene is very important in a restaurant and if the chef isn't covering up then it'll always be an issue.

fmpryv3o7iSdTROy6KCTuQ.text: Still #1 for breakfast in Las Vegas...funny you wouldn't think to come for the carnitas huevos rancheros here but man soooooooo gooooooood (well u got Latinos working the kitchen...lol) As always the service can not be matched...the Lemon ricotta pancake...one word as Smokey would say DAMNNNNNNN! Still again #1 first breakfast everything I've eaten here is great...thank u

4tX250HZjIQDj4cTB3rwXQ.text: Raw English muffin on the kalua Benedict and hash browns under cooked.   So fast forward and the wife and I go to the Durango location a few dats ago cause when the food is on it's great but this time the service was a fail!! Epic fail on training your people. I'll be back one day once I'm over it but please get your training better fir your servers to read and see if a customer isn't happy so they can go that extra step to make the experience the best!!!

mNCDEa1h96XZcc3lh8lzyQ.text: If you're looking for a local breakfast spot with good home cooking, BabyStacks is definitely the place to checkout. They have several pancake options to choose from. My favorite pancakes are the Banana Fosters or German Chocolate pancakes.   The Banana Fosters pancakes are sauteed bananas cooked in butter and sugar which is smothered on top of 2-4 stacks of buttermilk pancakes and a dollop of fresh whip cream.   If you like fried rice, I recommend that you order a side of garlic fried rice. The fried rice definitely has a great flavor of roasted garlic and onions. I absolutely love to balance it out with Portuguese Sausage that has a kick of spice and top it with an over easy egg.   I must admit the customer service is not always consistent but the food is so worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best breakfast spot in Vegas!

UEBlIasE39uhkJVe7z0yLg.text: Went there today for breakfast.  Food was excellent service was exceptional and food ......  amazing.  I will be back and next time I will wear my stretchy pants. Special shout out to hostess Monique!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash German Chocolate Pankcakes.

RsdYwPbHFfST2PdO7ZlEYw.text: Just left. I'm so bummed. I've been to BabyStacks once before at a different location, and it was great. I don't go often because it's so unhealthy, but I was having a bad day, so decided to cheer myself up with a skillet and some pancakes. I got the veggie skillet, swapped peppers for carnitas. I got a hazelnut baby stack on the side. My friend got a full stack of the mocha.   His pancakes came out fine. They had the speciality mocha pancakes with chocolate and whipped cream. I got my skillet at the same time. It tasted okay, but it had its own swimming pool in the bottom, so everything was kinda wet and gross. I had been planning on only eating half while also eating my pancakes, but there were no pancakes to be seen. The waiter told me it would be out shortly.   I finished the entire skillet, and then finally got my pancakes as my friend asked for a box. I decided to take a bite before boxing them up myself. They looked a bit light compared to how I've seen them before. lol and behold, it was just plain pancakes with a hazelnut drizzle on it. Which was like, the most disappointing thing possible when coming to the only place that had specialty pancakes. I just put them in a box. I don't want to waste my calories on pancakes I could make at home. I didn't say anything to my server because we needed to go home and I don't like making a scene, but I'm upset, so here ya go.   I came here with regular expectations. I just expected my food to come out as it's supposed to. But unfortunately, that was a bit too much today. Maybe the chefs are having a rough go of it, I don't know, but my trip to cheer myself up unfortunately just left me in a worse mood and $33 poorer.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sadly lackluster hazelnut pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocha pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet soup - blech

lTXi2d67i2L5T37CI6NKww.text: I went here today for the first time with a friend of mine around 1:30pm. Like a lot of other reviews said the place is very small so there isn't a lot of seating but we didn't have to wait at all which was great. It was also very cold in there, I was borderline shivering and my friend and I were trying to find somewhere without a vent but they were everywhere.   The service was good. They were very attentive and nice and kept checking on us during our meal which was a highlight. I kept asking the waiter for recommendations while ordering and he was helpful and didn't get annoyed by it.   They had a special for a fajita omelette or you could have it as a skillet. I decided to try that because it sounded good. I asked for no mushrooms, no sour cream and light onions and they made it exactly how I asked with no mistakes. The skillet was good and i enjoyed it. They used carne asada type steak, green peppers, onions and cheddar cheese on top which were over roasted potatoes. It was a bit runny on the bottom though which made the potatoes slightly soggy. Lastly, I got the strawberry lemonade for my drink along with water. They make it with strawberry puree and then they mix Tropicana lemonade out of the machine into it. Kind of a strange way to make it but it actually tasted pretty good, but very sweet. Overall I would give it another shot. It was a decent experience and the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita skillet (no mushrooms)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A better view of what was under the egg so you can see what the skillet looked like
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sourdough toast

eTLyvTob-Sknnw-_2wrzdw.text: I told you we come here a lot lol. This time we came here with our friend who wanted to eat here. He was wanting the Kalua pig Benedict. We shared that  along with lolo ricks adobo fried rice (omelette with fried rice inside) and cookies n creme babystack pancakes. My husband got the island omelette (again). There is usually a wait at babystacks because they're SO good (worth the wait). So just be prepared to wait when you come here.  Again, food was delicious, no complaints :)

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig Benedict

wJWpJKZl2Nt9Fe8YYEQm3Q.text: Food was great, service was excellent! Truc was our waitress. She is amazing and attentive. She's the kind of employee I'd want working for my company. We will be coming back again.

GfIj9XWGpGDbvs5PCpM5pQ.text: I know they have few locations, I came here for lunch and the other location for take out.  I have to say, they are both very constant and very tasty!    In this location, I have tried their adobo fried rice omelette with banana cream pancake short stack.  Both of my friends all got the spam scrambled with banana pancakes as well. Their portion size is very genuine and I had to share mine with my boyfriend.  It was very hearty with the fried rice and banana pancakes.  Their short stack is about 3 pancakes, regular size I heard has about 6 pancakes.  Oh my!   Service: was great.  Servers were nice and attentive and would come check on us constantly and refill our drinks too.   Food: i like their adobo fried rice and banana cream pancakes.  I got their banana pancakes again for take out at the other location too.   Their banana cream is just right amount of sweetness and not too overpowering.   the pancakes were pretty fluffy.  Talking about it makes me want some now. hahaha.  I heard in May, they serves Tres Lechan pancakes, Oohh I am looking forward.  stay tunes on the updated review.  They sell K cup coffee too.  I had the sample of it and really like it and decided to purchase more to bring it back home.
