h7fQCJ1MEsWYhI3BS20OSw.text: AMBIANCE: 3 - This location is clean, cute, and pretty busy. But I feel like it's just too small for the amount of people it serves on a daily basis. Even waiting in the front area, it just feels like there's not enough space for everyone to walk through--especially since where you pay is also where you wait.  SERVICE: 4 - Our server was really friendly and helpful. He was fast and didn't want us to rush with eating, even though there were quite a few waiting people. He made us feel comfortable. The food we ordered also came really fast, which was a really nice change from regular waiting times.   FOOD: 3 - Kahlua Pig Benedict: I usually really like Eggs Benedict, so I was really excited about trying one with pulled pork inside. I wasn't that impressed though with this one. I thought that the flavors were missing from my plate and I felt like they forgot to add an ingredient in.   Garlic Fried Rice: I wasn't a fan of the garlic fried rice. It just felt wet, too oily, and the garlic was almost too subtle so that it just tasted like regular rice. It was a pretty big disappointment since people rave about it so much! For me, it just tasted like rice.   **Red Velvet Pancakes (a must try!): The red velvet pancakes and cream cheese syrup that they make at this location are super good. The pancakes are warm and yummy. The way I eat them is I cut the pancake into pieces and dip them in the sauce..because pouring the sauce on does not cover enough of the pancake for me!   It's a pretty sugary breakfast, but damn. It is so good.   Their pancakes are the best, so I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors to get my morning sugar high on!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahlua Pig
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage

DRWqfPpB77OsV4kg-0fcxA.text: Sitting next door at Sierra Gold eating my breakfast as a write this. Came here this morning with my boyfriend (just the two of us). The receptionist said our wait would be about 20 min. which is pretty standard and usually well worth it, because the food is amazing. The 1 Star is not for the food, it's for the lack of service. There was a party of 11 that walked in roughly about 15 min after we got there and they were seated within 10 minutes. Our name apparently wasn't written on the board when we arrived, which made us appear after the party of 11. Not cool at all. Such an easy task obliterated. You've lost a customer.

yHNNtR0cFSzn0gjienWXZA.text: Great place. First time we went & waited for around 40min to be seated. Well worth the wait. Second time I called in to pick up our order. We prefer to eat in but nevertheless they have great food & are reasonably priced. We own a restaurant ourselves & know very well how it is to provide great food & a great experience.  We're also glad to see that they don't do grub hub or any of the other 3rd party services that take 30% of the sale. These people deserve every penny for their hard efforts. Thank you Baby Stacks we'll be back again & again.

tpUNkcCnGS-11EYjIyfFPg.text: I was delighted to discover this restaurant while in town for the week of Thanksgiving.  I typically don't like to eat at restaurants with traditional American breakfast fare as I dislike maple and pancake syrup.  To my surprise they have an awesome selection of pancakes that have enough flavor or toppings hence eliminating the need for syrup.   My family was happy, they got their traditional steak and eggs and chicken fried steak fix. Both husband and daughter said the hash browns were some of the best they've had in forever. Crispy and not loaded with oil.  Both subbed traditional pancakes for the premium pancakes.  He got the German chocolate, she got the Chocolate Chip/cookies and cream (I can't recall what they're called).  I sampled my husbands german chocolate pancakes (which means I totally stole and took over), they were delightful! I ordered the white chocolate macadamia pancakes, while they were good I'd try something different next time.  Our server was awesome and retrieved me some cream cheese topping to sub out the traditional pancake syrup.    Yes there is a wait because this is a small location but it is well worth the wait.  Food was delish and was served piping hot.  Server and busser were attentive during our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYxwteMakhIU9nFLyfQJ3w.text: Danielle was a great server! She was fast and had a fantastic smile. Super happy which is always so nice to see. Make sure you don't drink the water. I always forget how gross the tap water is in LV. The orange juice was artificial so also not something tasty to order. But my egg white skillet was delicious. I wanted to try something new so I ordered banana foster pancakes and was happy with my new discovery. The eggs were also good. We came towards closing so Danielle seemed very rushed but after observing her I just realized maybe it's just because she was super fast. This wasn't very first visit, I was a regular at Baby Stacks and it's always a satisfying visit.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drawings

xuVW15c-Lu-RemO7dbqh2Q.text: BabyStacks, BabyStacks, Babystacks. BabyStacks is not just a breakfast place, BabyStacks is a way for my boyfriend to convince to me get out of bed on our day off. "Well, if you come with me to ____, then I'll buy you BabyStacks... chocolate chip pancakesssss". I must have told at least a thousand people about my love for BabyStacks. I dream about the Spam Scramble with Garlic Rice and I have tried to personally recreate their potatoes and failed so many times. I am a customer for life. I love the servers, I love seeing their familiar faces and even the hostess. I know this is a very dramatic review, but when friends come in town, we go to BabyStacks. Honestly, if I could have them cater my wedding, I'd hire them. I've taken so many photos of their food, it's even been the background on my phone for an extended amount of time. As I'm writing this my coffee has been refilled and I'm just waiting on heaven to land on my table. Peace out, Yelp.

w6NzORwcVLvfCE4lwUEuQA.text: How in the world this place gets anything greater than one star is beyond me. Service was horrible. The server was way too busy to even acknowledge us. It was our first visit she didn't ask, it would have been nice to learn a bit more about what was good, etc but whatever. Barely acknowledged us rushed off checked on is once and it was in passing she was horrible. Now on to the food...... great pancakes??? Are you kidding me?? I guess if you like drywall and cement you would love these round globs of batter. No taste whatsoever!! If it was for the kalbi beef ribs this "meal" would have been a complete disaster! Won't be back don't get the hype.

Y7DvvcWFufX1vpivcelIHw.text: This place stays busy, but they get you in and out fast! I had to try their famous red velvet pancakes. They were all that and more! My friend ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, she enjoyed them.  According to her they taste like girl scout cookies.  The service is great and the food is delicious.  Since they're do busy be prepared to wait up to 30 mins bit that's not long and it's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p-4kNIxrYYvypHrmHek-bw.text: This breakfast cafe is something I'll definitely come back and visit every trip to Vegas! You have to try to orange sherbet pancakes.... absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FKZpcgXIyQLm9BREzuFoZg.text: We love this breakfast joint.  It's a place I love taking my kids.  Only downside is that it's so good it's crowded

HZTWLnZE1O36CcvzqpBBQg.text: I Love this place but the wait is always so long.  I am longing for the day that they get a bigger space so you can reliably go there(I don't always have time to wait).  Everything is delicious here, especially their Hawaiian dishes and pancakes.  Cannot be beat!

b0TId-7Av1NF54cTxUOJeA.text: This is a small breakfast place but with very good food! They are open from 7-2pm during the week and 7-3 on weekends. We ordered the pork skillet which was delicious. It had a lot of cheese however, it could have been better with some peppers or onion. We also ordered the traditional eggs Benedict which was average. Baby Stacks is well known for their red velvet pancakes which are phenomenal! This is a must try!  Overall the place has pretty good food. The bad part is that there is always a long wait and they do not take reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet

CNx1bka--WwrglTEG9MszQ.text: You want breakfast this is the place. Never had the same thing twice and they haven't disappoint. Very busy so it will take some time

QKByYtox3dPO18hDPYUmOg.text: This place was recommended to me by my spouse and other friends of ours. I anticipated the wait (20-30 min) and didn't mind because I will wait for good food and look the menu over. Once seated we ordered. I ordered the spinach Benedict with garlic rice and a strawberry crepe. Once everything arrived I went for the crepe and tasting the rice and thought, yum pretty good but I was craving the spinach Benedict. I go to cut into my poached eggs and they are way over hard. When the server finally came over to check on us (after waiving at them) I showed him my hard boiled eggs and now cold food. My spouse now at this point is about done with her food. I turn down the remake (microwave and maybe correct eggs).  You only get 1 , 1 first impression. I gave 1 star because that's about what I ate and my thoughts on my 1st time there. Vegas has many options for food.

CfIbnVW4uZkZmEBozwjOng.text: If you love authentic food whether it be stacks of amazing pancakes in flavors you've never thought of to a Hawaiian Eggs Benedict, then this restaurant is the place for you. I make sure that I do not leave Las Vegas without going there at least once. Sometimes, when I see some of their specials-I'm tempted to hop on a plane just to go eat there! I will say this though: it's ALWAYS BUSY. Be prepared to wait a bit if it's a last minute decision to eat there. Planning ahead is recommended BIG TIME. Great customer service, outstanding food and in one of my favorite places! It's PERFECT!

OkmzmzTPD-tdmvnkSQfc5g.text: Loved the German Chocolate Pancakes!  Light, fluffy and flavorful.  It was like eating German Chocolate Pancakes for breakfast.  Would love to try a sample of all of the different flavors.  My better half got lemon Ricotta Pancakes and loved them as well.  Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GE_Y6IuK_bGxXrcjABVMgQ.text: I have nothing but amazing things to say about the hostess at this location. Cassie was extremely welcoming upon entering the facility. She was so helpful in seating us and was so easy to talk to. She even explained the menu's to my husband and I as it was our first time there. Upon our second visit, she was exactly the same! Such a sweet person who enjoys what she does :)

1mAMVxKA9iKbWOGio5QP1g.text: Amazing! Babycakes Cafe is soo delish!  A girlfriend of mine told me about the hype so I decided to look it up on Yelp for confirmation. After seeing all the rave reviews we decided to save Babycakes Cafe for a Sunday brunch meal.  YES it was a long wait. We arrived at 10:20am and we were seated about an hour later.  That said...I feel that the wait was worth it. Everything was fresh and delicious.  Our order-  short stack of red velvet pancakes huevos rancheros pulled pork eggs benedict  The RED VELVET PANCAKES are really that fabulous! I'm a huge fan of red velvet anything regardless (so long as it's good cake of course) and I was a little concerned that red velvet pancakes would be too sweet for a brunch item but it was a perfect balance. It definitely had that distinct red velvet taste and smell but it wasn't overly sweet, it still tasted like a pancake. There was a sprinkling of chocolate chips and a small cup of cream cheese frosting syrup...WOW. It was so delicious :) Go to Babycakes Cafe for their delicious pancakes, it's something new, cheap, and I didn't mind the long drive from the Strip.

eIeEYrkuppJJxM8ZOjUfdA.text: We had the Portuguese sausage, eggs and rice, loco moco , short stack of banana cream pie pancakes, cup of coffee and a glass of orange juice. Our total came up to be about 23.00. The place is small and cramp but clean and so are the bathrooms. We came in at 0800 on a Friday and was seated immediately. Servers were friendly, checked on us often and our food came out quick and hot.  The food.... Rob says his Portuguese sausage eggs and rice was throwback to what we were used to eating in Guam and his orange juice tasted like the canned ones  we were served in school.  Mine was the loco moco, they used a darker gravy than what I'm used too but I did like it a lot. I'm glad they don't use cheap rice here which takes away from the dish like the other island restaurants here do. I don't know which they use but it was not heavy and thick. I got through two of the patties and was stuffed,only got to eat a quarter of my pancakes which is a shame since they were soooo good.

Cmyxuzl8wvngDKA83-k1mg.text: I am a breakfast snob... I've been perfecting my own omelette making skills since I was 11 (I'm now 30) and I enjoy cooking in general... so for me to get out of the house for breakfast, it better be darn good.  That said, I am a regular at BabyCakes Cafe.  The pancakes are far better than I can ever make at home, and they've spoiled me with awesome toppings such as fresh whipped cream (i.e. not that junk from a can)... also not something I would take the time to do at home.  These few negative reviews were clearly written by someone who came once when they were in a bad mood, or for whatever reason had an isolated bad experience.  I have eaten here dozens of times and from that more proper sampling I can say that this place knows how to "break the fast" better than anywhere else I have tried in Vegas.  I usually don't care much for taking the time to write reviews (I know, I'm a jerk), but I am taking the time to create a yelp login just so I can review BabyCakes because it's that good... and everyone I bring there loves it.

Y4HGDJouz0hFX-_PYEBZRA.text: I drove 20 minutes away from Los Angeles on a Sunday morning just to try out the pancakes and was not disappointed!! The only disappointment was I didn't have enough stomach room to down the red velvet AND s'mores pancakes so I had to settle with just the red velvet pancakes and adobe fried rice.  The cream cheese syrup is probably what makes the pancakes delicious-yo...I'm not even a huge fan of red velvet or cream cheese but these were so amazingly decadent that I had to bring a batch back to LA with me.  The fried rice was also yummy and balanced out the sweet pancakes well.  The dining area is small but the staff was so friendly and quick to service to us non-locals. I was impressed at the amount of people that filled up the place at 7:30 am on a Sunday and the place was 100% filled when we left.  One day I may be back if I could find some crazy person who will stay up until it opens, or go to bed early enough to wake up for it. The former sounds like the more fitting option for Vegas, don't you think??

RJHI4edkLWvg96TPJ0kP5w.text: Babycakes, Babycakes, Babycakes...  Red velvet pancakes, red velvet pancakes, red velvet pancakes....  These words have been dancing around in my head for months now ever since I read a bunch of reviews about this place. I finally got the chance this morning to go to Babycakes and discover if all my lingering dreams of RVP's would come True and they definitely did.  My boyfriend and I arrived today (Sunday) at about Noon and the place was packed. I knew as soon as we drove up that we would be waiting, but never the less we were going to eat here no matter what. It ended up being a 30 minute wait, actually not bad for a brunch on a Sunday in my opinion. Would I wait that long during a week day? I'm not so sure.  After our wait we were escorted to a table in their very small dining room. Yes, this place is TINY!   I ordered the Huntington Omelet and I upgraded to the red velvet pancakes ($1.50 to do so), and my boyfriend got the full-stack of RVPs. Okay, so all the hype is True - these pancakes are freaking amazing. My boyfriend said he liked his, but he didn't finish the whole plate. Probably because they're extremely rich.   But here's what I really liked, their omelet and and serving of hasbrowns were perfect sized. Not too much, not too little. It's not like going to IHOP where they bring you out an omelet the size of your head that you're never going to finish. I appreciate that.   The prices were spot-on, the service was super sweet (they kept my coffee filled, always a plus!), and the food was DELISH.   Babycakes, Babycakes, Babycakes,,,,,

57OqBpRgpKX56f8Nfn18wg.text: Kalula pork instead of beef patty on the Loco Moco.... YUM!  And I swear the hubby thought he heard angles sing when he tried the Banana's Foster Pancakes!  To DIE FOR!!

apk1S3ExK0wPJG4mpk7qYA.text: Food is delicious, but overcrowded. Got there at 1:20 (Sunday they close at 3pm) and the doors were already locked.

oi-OxCxV3cE7KcBN_umiJA.text: Headed (way) off-strip to try this little cafe with my son, based purely on the strong Yelp review. Despite being some twenty minutes from our hotel, it did not disappoint!   We arrived around 8:30 on a Saturday and waited about 20 minutes for a table. Not too bad considering the size, which is pretty small.  My son ordered the standard Buttermilk pancakes with a side of bacon and I had Honey Whole Wheat pancakes. In a nutshell, everything was terrific! The bacon was thick and generous and the pancakes were a good size and prepared perfectly! I resent not ordering the Red Velvet, after seeing it delivered to the table next to us, but that is what next time is for!  Certainly worth the trip if you're in the city and want to avoid a $40 room service omelet or the ridiculous buffet lines. Can't wait to come back and give it another go!

un4BE83ZUS_nKRJUcchLOw.text: I have been delaying my 200th review...  Why????  My 200th review need to be amazing, needed to be mind blowing, needed to be inspiring and of course needed to be just.... awesome.  I am not talking about my actual review of course, but of the place that I am reviewing.    Babycakes is worth my 200th slot and my 300th and my 400th and so on.  It is that good.  I was visiting Las Vegas from Houston a few weeks back and my family and I wanted to go get some fantastic breakfast.  My fellow yelpers told me to try this place out and after reading the reviews, I decided it was worth the try and the drive from our hotel.  After a bit of complaining from my family as we drove there and found a bit of a wait, the complaining stopped the second they took a bite out of their omelet.  The four of us go different omelets and I decided to get the Macadamia Nut pancakes with my omelet.    "BEST OMELET I HAVE EVER EATEN!!!" - Family  "........mmmmmm......." - Me  I am having trouble finding the words to describe the food they have here.  Everything is amazing and the pancakes were RIDICULOUS!!    For example, the food was so good I ended up buying one of their mugs.  Their little Babycake mugs.  Just so I will have a memento of my favorite breakfast place on earth.  Thanks right  MY FAVORITE BREAKFAST PLACE ON EARTH!!!!!!  I feel like going to Vegas, but only for the Babycakes.  Peace

rib61nj-l2EFnusN_a0Gfg.text: Heard a lot about this place and their red velvet pancakes.  A lot.  We called one morning and asked if there was a wait to gauge if we should attempt this infamous place.  We were told there's no wait, come on down!  So we jumped in the car and got there literally 5 minutes later and there was *surprise* a 25 - 30 minute wait.  There were only 2 parties in front of us, so I figured it would probably be less of a wait.  Well, we ended up waiting 40 minutes.  That put a little bit of a bad taste in my mouth right at the beginning of this experience, going from no wait to a 40 minute wait.  But that's the nature of the restaurant biz, and I wanted those red velvet pancakes!  We ordered.  I ended up getting an omelet and upgraded my bread side to the RVP, my husband got the fried rice adobo, and my mom got the Eggs Benedict.  When the food came out...I was surprised by how crappy it looked.  Sorry to be blunt, but that's how it looked: crappy.  I expected more after hearing so much buzz.  My omelet, which was supposed to have swiss cheese in it, had 2 slices of processed-store-bought-fake-sandwich-slice white stuff barely melted on top.  My potatoes were obviously from a frozen bag and blandly seasoned at that.  My husband didn't mind his fried rice, but said it was very dry.  My mom's eggs benedict was just ok, and it also came with the frozen potatoes.  I couldn't believe the lack of quality.  The RVP were the only saving grace for the place.  They truly are delicious and I'm glad I got to experience them.  However, I definitely would not be able to eat a whole order of them as they are extremely sweet.  So in short: the wait is long, the food is from frozen and processed crap, and the pancakes are delicious.  Would I make a trip back and wait that long just for the pancakes, though? No.

QoeGc822oo7cHCZbETMl6g.text: Wonderful Breakfast!!! Country Benedict is Awesome!! Sooooo friendly too!! Will be back!!

2z--AdNgcibhTClSz5cJVg.text: I applaud the success of BabyStacks, but expecting your customers to stand packed elbow to elbow in the waiting area for upwards of an hour in hopes that you can hear your name being called is horrible.  The lack of reservation options, lack of waiting space, and unfriendliness of the staff offsets anything good I have heard about the food itself. I won't be attempting this place again anytime soon...

a3x6AHrJVVhkzi6TlFVQSQ.text: Although it has been on my bookmarks for some time, I am plagued by the Vegas reluctance to drive more than 20 minutes to get to my destination. Going to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets North cut the trek in half and gave me a reason to explore this beautiful side of town.  My sister and I thought that we had outsmarted the regular rush but there was still a wait on a Wednesday afternoon. It makes sense since Babycakes can only seat 50 people and has a total of 10-15 tables depending on how they breakdown the seating.   The place is quaint. The hostess/cashier saw us come in and placed us on the list without us having to approach her. Fifteen minutes later we were sat. It took another ten minutes and a few puzzled glances to get a waitress over to take our drink order. Once we were noticed, the service improved.   Between the two of us we shared the lemon ricotta crepe/pancakes and the adobo fried rice. There were three thin cakes, dusted with powder sugar with butter, lemon wedges,maple syrup, and more powder sugar on the side. The crepes were crisp. The traditional lemon and sugar combination was nice. We did not taste the ricotta though. I wished it was thinly layered on each instead of mixed into the batter. My Filipino friends will probably scold me for getting such an easily made dish, but the adobo was decent. It was more salty than sour or sweet, but balanced well with the omelet wrapped around it. Not being a big fan of mayo, we subbed the mac salad for house potatoes. They were seasoned well, but could have been more brown. For both meals, we left satisfied for less than eighteen dollars before tip.

73j3inTRqeZJ7OHR_wP2nQ.text: Waited an hour and was disappointed by the food.. I had banana pancakes and a breakfast skillet.  The pancakes were chewy.  The skillet had no flavor.

T0yEAB1y9mSEF3VJyMAY8w.text: RED VELVET PANCAKES! I don't even like pancakes and I would never choose to get pancakes, but these pancakes I absolutely love and can't get enough! Genius combining red velvet with pancakes! So good. Must get this is when you come here.  It comes with whipped cream with chocolate shavings and like this white syrup. I don't know how to explain what the white syrup is, but it compliments it really well. It taste similar to the normal frosting of a red velvet cake in syrup form.    This normal breakfast dishes are good too! Small for the price, I think.  But the quality is noted.  I got the portuguese sausage with rice. MMM... Lots of Filipino influenced dishes on the menu.  I heard the Adobo omelet so bomb too.

ky_WtJWMZ4bb3zyyWaLBTQ.text: This place was really awesome. They had so many delicious choices on their menu, but my best friend recommended their red velvet pancakes. So glad I ordered the red velvet pancakes! It was to die for! And the sauce that came with it made it even more that delicious! It's been a week since I've been to Babystacks, and I am so craving for them! I'm from California and only came to visit last weekend! Too bad they don't have anything like Babystacks near where I live. Till next time I get to Vegas!

wHlK8nvAyXtssfdqv-ARrQ.text: Great pancakes !  The pancakes come with all your eggs and the service is quick and friendly.  Such a great find for those traveling through town.   I had the hashbrowns with the sausage links and banana pancakes and eggs.  I wish we had this place in California.

UXTgpjkMuqe5clmzSK05xA.text: So this is not the place to go if you are counting carbs because even if you resolve to be strong, the gorgeous plates going by will make you feel deprived. I would suggest diving into the experience, this place makes the fall worth it. The waitress was very patient with us, it was a difficult decision!   I had the red velvet pancakes as a dessert with my turkey club sandwich.  The sandwich was really good, the avocado was just right, lettuce crispy, all was yummy...BUT THE PANCAKES should have a soundtrack of angels singing.  First the color was an amazing red on the edges and the portion was just right.  They were served with fresh whipped cream on top and a cream-cheesy-butter-syrup to dip or pour over them.  I dipped and dipped again.  I will definitely return to BabyStacks.

CFofoubKtu5L_5zAEGm6SA.text: Once you try the pancakes here, all other pancakes will be ruined for you! These are hands down the best pancakes I've ever eaten. Very light and fluffy, and surprisingly not as sweet as some of them seem. I've tried some of their other menu items and they are excellent as well. Everything I see on other people's plates looks delicious. I love small family owned restaurants like this! I've taken all my visitors (family, friends) here and they've fallen in love! The only downfall is that since it's a really tiny place, there's ALWAYS a wait. They don't take reservations either :(

tz0JGS5yUkCDXc54KwFEsg.text: This place is ALWAYS packed so get there early! It is totally worth the wait, the portions are more than sufficient and the atmosphere is super family friendly.

zGJlsz3EyY1MUStEsggY0Q.text: My friends Austin and Andi had mentioned that they checked out this breakfast place called Babycakes that had RED VELVET PANCAKES. I immediately called my best friend Lauren and made a date for the following Sunday morning.  Ok, let me just pause to tell you here, just now, I was thinking about the menu and my MOUTH-WATERED. IRL. JUST HAPPENED. Ok, so not only do they have Red Velvet Pancakes that are served with Whipped Cream, Chocolate Crumbles and CREAM CHEESE SYRUP (more like a not so think icing) but they also have S'MORE Pancakes, Peanut Butter and (Jelly, Banana, Chocolate...you pick) Pancakes and one of my personal favorites, Bacon Pancakes (aka: a one stop shop).   They also offer a variety of traditional breakfast options, as well. We wanted to try the Red Velvet Pancakes but knew that it would be sweet overload so we opted to also get the bacon and eggs breakfast. Their seasoned potatoes need a little more seasoning but other than that, delicious. A great savory balance to our sweetest ever breakfast.   The place is totally CHARMING with high-top tables, flowers and a GREAT waitstaff. I spilled my drink all over our table (in typical Katie fashion) and we had 2-3 staff members come over to help us clean it up.  The best part was as we were wrapping up (our $20 bill....bang for your breakfast buck!), Andi and Austin, who recommended the place to me, walked in the door. Andi said she had woken up saying "Pumpkin Pankcakes...." and they headed out the door.   I'll be heading out the door every weekend to my new favorite breakfast place.

6BRdlOyt4p2rxwjbjDoeRw.text: Wowsers. Walking in the door I was struck by a hand-written sign: White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Pancakes... need I see more? No need to even give me a menu... but then they did -- and perfect got even better.   Red Velvet Pancakes with Chocolate Chips, Whipped Cream, and Cream Cheese Syrup...  Done. Ordered. Devoured. . . Delicious.   For those who don't want to die of sugar overload, they also have normal pancakes, an assortment of yummy breakfast foods (many with a Hawaiian flare), and sandwiches/burgers for lunch. The Eggs Benedict were very good (add a slice of avocado to make them awesome).   I'll be going back again soon... that's a promise.

rQ2Gdnf9k6BxrRtSiKg5jA.text: We've been here several times. The food (especially the specialty pancakes) and service are both excellent. We have never tried anything from the lunch menu though. The prices are very reasonable. The only downside is the actual restaurant is quite small. Because it's so popular there is usually a wait to be seated (can be up to an hour). We usually avoid the wait by going there late in the morning or in the early afternoon for breakfast. Usually we only have to wait 15 minutes during that time of day. I would highly recommend visiting this place at least once.

8g1hEl2yEgZC72pqZ2cIvA.text: I was sick and tired of all the RAVING about Babycakes... So I got my day pack together and saddled up to the journey to Summerlin..... well, I got a ride, but hey!  This place was definitely not as I expected: it's quaint and it aims to be a neighborhood joint... props to them! Thankfully, and to my happiness.... there was no said line.. nor a wait. Also, it was a Wednesday morning, so that should be accounted for. Yesss. So we were seated right away... upon being seated right away.. We were waited right away!   I'm not going to lie... I came here just for the red velvet pancakes, sorry to disappoint and to OBVIOUSLY jump on the Yelp bandwagon. I was kinda upset I just ordered the pancakes because their menu is huge and original... just another something to bring me back.   I got the half-stack which was plenty for me. Yet another review... yes. The pancakes are THAT good. Pancake Perfection! How does one make such consistent, fluffy cakes all the time.. day in, day out? The world may never know... My cream cheese icing syrup(?) was put on the side and I used it for dunking rather than drenching. Red velvet Pancakes 4 Lyf.  I will soon be back to indulge in their Hawaiian and Filipino breakfasts so I can get some SPAM.. (i have a secret liking for that stuff) ... at that time I'll hopefully have something else to review... and I can UP my rating:]

wY0bSB6E1gTaPzL1saxfdg.text: Came here for the red velvet pancakes. My niece found a long strand of hair in her omelet, nasty. Came once before it was ok, this time it was sub-par. Never again.

DP4uuMkimpTR5oRLuX_B1w.text: I can never be happy at iHOP again, now I know what a great pancake-place should be like.  So many choices! and everything was yummy. We had red velvet pancakes, omelette and coffee with hash browns and toast on side. The quantity and happy service are both great.   Too bad it's so far away :(

OgKTJ1Yltra4PMkBwLuI9g.text: Time Matters!  We tried this place for the 1st time last recently.  The hostess needs help with her perception of time and service.  I showed up with my family and was told 30-35 minutes was the wait to be seated.  The place was packed and decided to take a chance on the wait.  It was in a shopping center and we weren't going to wait outside with 3 kids.  I took the kids to go sit in the car while my wife went an picked up an item at a nearby story in the center.  After 15 minutes, I asked my daughter to go check and see how the wait was going.  She came running back saying that they had called us several times and we needed to go or we would lose our spot.  I grabbed the kids an ran into the restaurant; however, the hostess asked if we were all together and I told her No, but my wife will be here in a moment.  The hostess said, "I can't seat you unless you are all together."  I replied with, "You are going to seat us and if I need order for my wife, I can since I know what she likes."  The hostess told me, No again. I told her that we would not be in this predicament if she would have been more accurate on her time.  So, she sat us down.  Some may be excited that to see that they wait wasn't as long as suggested, but when you're juggling 5 people.  That task is not as easy as one might seem.  Luckily the food was okay.  But due to the service at the beginning, I have no intention of returning.  I wish I recalled her name, but it was an older woman with a grumpy attitude and who likes to yell.  A hostess is a critical component of a dining experience.  They are the first person the customer sees and the last one too.  Centennial doesn't have many good breakfast options, but I don't mind traveling 10 miles to get the experience I expect.

dGxwJUFuWc3Sh6yQEdlsEQ.text: Long wait but it is worth it,   I went here on my bday with my family, All 5 of us ordered something different and everything was delicious. My personal favorite are the red velvet pancakes and fried adobo rice.   and there is  a cute boy that works there. another reason why it's my favorite breakfast place :)

VDhYQCSDX2Ts0hjws_dJBQ.text: Had breakfast here. I got the western skillet with 2 buttermilk pancakes (included or with toast instead). Restaurant was busy. About a 10 minute wait. Service was good even though they were busy. Restaurant looked clean. Dining area is not very huge. This wouldn't be the location I would pick for a big group. 2 person tables are kind of small for all the plates and stuff they bring out for breakfast. Skillet was good, pancakes were great. They have a bunch of specialty pancakes too.  It's a must try if you are a pancake fan

lK3BzL4uD2RC61OLipvM8Q.text: If your favorite cake flavor is Red Velvet, the Red Velvet Pancakes will hit home for you like it did for me. I'm a Red Velvet fanatic so I was in immediate heaven as soon as I took my first bite. I am typically not a fan of extras like whipped cream or chocolate chip toppings, but I welcomed each and every savory bite. This menu item also came with its own cream cheese syrup but I felt like the pancakes were so fresh and perfectly done that it didn't need any extras. I even ended up eating the entire thing after my Spam & Scrambled Eggs order!  This is definitely one of my top breakfasts spots. I can't wait to come back again to try the rest of the menu. The place is small, but I wouldn't be surprised if they are already considering an expansion or additional locations because it was so busy when we got there. No wonder this place is so popular, the food is great, service is served with a smile and everyone is very friendly!

mJQ6mK5kuUBg4pfCVC1f4A.text: Super good food, love the strawberry cream crepes!! Not a long wait to be seated. Staff is pleasant.

Kl0Uw203ZmiwjpF5Er6c3w.text: A must see. The place is a tad small but very friendly. The Red Velvet pancakes are a must... Light, fluffy and all together a good tasting pancake without that cakey taste. It's not as "red" as the pics on Yelp. They were also willing to do a egg white omelet with no problem. Choose a time and be willing to wait a bit, it's worth the wait and everyone was super nice.

YNh23PHs63JZHyJp2OoOaA.text: Red Velvet Pancakes! Makes me want to drive to vegas just to have Babycakes' Red Velvet Pancakes. Also, the adobo omelet is very good (I think its called Rick's Adobo fried rice)   Place is pretty small although our party had 11 people they accommodated us.  So when you are in Las Vegas drop by this place for breakfast. It's yummmmyyy!

RNjR53vxTuy5yoDpsoLonQ.text: Hands down best pancakes I've ever had period.  If u r in Vegas u need to eat here well worth the 8 mile drive from the strip. Service is great Felicia was awesome and I will b coming back every time I'm in town

_L3Ai18Fm8r1n6rFulUyfQ.text: My Ratings: Quantity: 4 - Good Quality: 4 - yum! Price: 4 - just right Location: 4 - cute but small Parking: 4 - parking lot Service: 4 - Friendly and nice Speed: 4 - Pretty good  Overall: Good food! Recommended for all! I would go back for more.  My Opinion/Story: I got the groupon special and prepared myself for when I go to Vegas. I had an agenda to check this place out and I was happy to have made it here.  Of course I got their red velvet pancakes but as good as it sounds, it wasn't enough for me. We got two medium size pancakes and it made me crave for more.  Thank goodness I ordered an omelette and another got their White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Pancakes. Now that was delicious. I guess I like all the ingredients in that one.  Hubby got their Adobo Omelette which was different but also good.  Service was good, friendly, quick. I like this place.

8I5h7P_OxHl28UqDcg-VJw.text: 3.5 stars  being that this place is the hottest ish on yelp i hadddd to try it.   on a friday around noon there was no wait for 4 people. yay!   i had the loco moco which comes with 2 eggs, gravy, 2 home made hamburger patties, rice, and mac salad. let's start with the good. eggs were cooked just right and the gravy was reallllly good. the hamburger patties were just okay. it seemed like they had been pre-cooked and re-heated. the meat was very tough. it was like a day old bbq hamburger patty. i'm used to the really tender thin hamburger patties so this may just be preference. the mac salad was not good to me at all. there was a lot of black pepper and something else i couldn't quite figure out. i shared this with a friend but it really wasn't enough food to share. he didn't like the mac salad either but enjoyed everything else.  sooo the real reason why i came here was to try the red velvet pancakes everyone is talking about. and yes. it lives up to the hype! the pancakes are very light, fluffy, and not overly sweet. the whipped cream on top seems home made and can be compared to a marshmallow flavor. yum! the cream cheese syrup is sweet and has the perfect syrupy consistency.   my other friends shared eggs benedict and half was done well and the other half was overcooked. they also got regular pancakes and really like them.   overall service was friendly but on the slow side. it took a while to get our food. the tables are set up in a way where it's very congested and it's not a great place for groups if you have more than 6 people.   i absolutely fell in love with the red velvet pancakes but i'm not sure if i would come back for their lunch.

K9WQuuCLfgobJHmHlv2NEw.text: Great experience!  Wait staff very friendly and food was wonderful. Our first time here. We split the country steak and eggs with pancakes upgraded to the red velvet. Potatoes were seasoned perfectly. Pancakes we're sweet and rich but not too much of either. Steak and gravy was yummy. Perfect sized meal to split between two. I think we just found our new fav breakfast place!

xE2AeN3BLzkej4q6Zkqhmw.text: I'll start off by saying I love BabyStacks. My boyfriend is a huge Cragged Egg fan (which I am not) so getting him to even try this was a struggle. The first time I finally convinced him to give it a try he ordered the chicken fried steak. It was okay, he of course preferred the one at cracked egg, and after tasting it, I agreed. After coming back a next time, he tried the mexican skillet. That's his new go-to. I'm giving only 3 stars because of the service. Coming in for sit down, theres never a problem. Lately we've only been in the mood for take out & its only a minute drive from Desert Shores. The past 2 times we've been, the take out service has been horrible.I don't think I'll be ordering from BabyStacks anymore due to our past 2 experiences. First time, we called in to order the mexican skillet to share. The hostess said it would be about 15-20 minutes. We got there about 20 mins later, thinking we would actually be late because although they say 15-20 mins, it usually never is. It took an additional 20 mins for our food to come out!!!!! 40 mins for takeout on one item? okay, I get it, they're busy.. but PLEASE give me an according time. It bugged me, but I understand it happens, so I let it go. A few weeks later we decided to order the same thing. We called in and its the same 15-20 mins. We got there in about 17 and were greeted by a new hostess. We told her we were here for pickup but she informed us the hostess was in the bathroom and she had not learned the system to cash us out yet (not her fault). So instead of waiting in front of the tiny cashier table because people were sitting on the bench to our left, we took a step back to give the people some room. Upon waiting 5 mins, a group of ladies walked up to the cashier to check out and stood in front of us. While the new hostess watched. My boyfriend wanted to say something but I told him to not to, reassuring him that the new hostess would tell the other hostess that we were there first. 5-6 mins later the hostess came out. I decided to try to inform her that we were there first(nicely) while she was walking towards us just incase the new girl forgot. I started out with "Hi...." and immediately got cut off with a "I'll be right with you" Being a hostess for 4 years and now a server, I thought that was extremely rude. So she proceeds to the cash register and starts checking out the ladies who stood in front of us, while the new girl watched and didn't say anything. Of course they wanted to spilt their bill. Another 4 minutes. After receiving our food, we took a bite in the car because I was starving, and to no surprise found our food to be extremely cold. The ladies cutting in front of us was not the hostess' fault, but to cut me off trying to tell her, is. I was so upset after this experience; it bugged me so bad I highly doubt I will be returning. Not for a good while at least.

okzZUNCDsLGkJ9fr4fVSSQ.text: Their pancakes are great, especially the red velvet. If you're not a pancake person, their cookie crumble french toast (I think that is what it's called) is just as great as their pancakes, it might be a little too sweet for my taste. The huevos rancheros and seasoned potatoes are good.

fUhVSQDLSAeT2YHXVDaW6g.text: We came here on a weekday around 1pm and there was no wait. Yay.  There were so many things I wanted to try, but I can only eat so much, so I got the kahlua pig benedict. My hubby got the spam scramble and we got a short stack of bacon pancakes to share.  We both liked the spam scramble the most... so simple, yet so delicious!   The kahlua pig itself was also good, though I'd have to say, as a benedict with the hollandaise sauce, the two flavors were competing with each other.  And they didn't quite go together, in my opinion.  The bacon pancake was just okay too. I had such high hopes for it, since I love both things.  I was hoping the bacon was crumbled inside the pancake, but it was more like two strips of bacon plopped onto a cooking pancake. The pancake also seemed too fluffy to me.  Maybe as a meal on its own, it would've been delicious, but since we already ate other entrees before trying it, it became too much.  I give 4 stars overall, because the service was superb, and there are so many more things I want to try from their menu!

lW3iPhsSzAn1C27c1RGu5Q.text: I was searching on Yelp for a breakfast place near our hotel.  Since we were up early at 6:30 am we decided to go to Baby Stacks when they opened.  Baby Stacks is located on the corner in a shopping center.  I ordered the Cinnabon pancakes and my BFF ordered the Red Velvet pancakes, corned beef hash, and potatoes.  She wasted the corned beef because she didn't like it.  I enjoyed my Cinnabon pancakes.  I would recommend ordering the short stack with a side dish.  If you have a sweet tooth, the red velvet pancakes were good too.

rGN6Gz18xxqE7zEvfWmINw.text: I decided to try this place after reading the reviews about the awesome Red Velvet Pancakes. I'm a huge fat kid at heart so anything RV is right up my alley.  There was about a 15 minute wait when we got there (noon on a Monday). The place is pretty small so the wait times are to be expected. The menu is pretty big. They have about 12 different kinds of specialty pancakes, omelettes, crepes, breakfast items and a few lunch selections.  I ordered the omelette which came with 2 pancakes that I of course upgraded to Red Velvet for an additional charge. The omelette was delicious and the breakfast potatoes were pretty good as well. I saved the best for last: The Pancakes. It was like dessert and breakfast all in one. The cream cheese "syrup" is more like icing but it gives the pancakes the real RV feel. The pancakes themselves aren't too sweet so it is a perfect balance.  Next time I want to try the S'mores pancakes but that's a whole different review. :)

V_1UuuMTzmACzJ37LlVBTw.text: Maybe it was because I was blazed but the red velvet pancakes are one of the best things I've ever had in my life. Everything else we ordered was good too. Prob the only "casual" breakfast spot ive been to in vegas that actually made over-medium eggs the way i like- No runny whites (yuck) Highly recommend! Seating isn't very cozy but it works..

Enl07_LvkznbVoUG2-TS9A.text: This place was delicious with a wide variety of pancakes as well as tons of different kinds of omelettes! AND it was pretty reasonably priced.   They are located in kind of an awkward place that you would have to drive by a lot to know it was there, so spread the word!!  Also, just has the leftovers from my Red Velvet pancakes and they were almost even better the second time!!

atfEK69-z7FIAgnwb1zN_A.text: Loved this place and would definitely go back for more! Tried the cinabbun pancakes, and classic eggs benedict, which was really good! Others in my group ordered the red velvet pancakes, spam scramble, cookie butter french toast, adobo omelette, which i got to try a bite of each. It was so good to the point the we ordered to go and brought it back home to california! The wait wasn't long, and service was not bad at all.

heKnJWq9o24VGLjy7_aPSg.text: The pancakes are inspired by cupcake flavors so why do people complain about it being "too sweet"? it's a panCAKE. Do these complainers want it salty or something!? The pancakes are delicious and has just the right amount of sweetness! The servers are friendly and knowledgeable about what they sell. No complaints here! They are "The Best of Las Vegas" for a reason and definitely worth the wait! Oh yeah, try the Loco Moco or Adobo Fried Rice if you wanna be in a food coma for the rest of the day :)

1vk2DIbEl0liZqno9p12Kg.text: Went with of a group of ten we tried alot of different dishes. Country fried steak was really good. The strawberry pancakes (full stack) was more than my son could eat. now that is crazy! Every dish was awesome. they had Filipino dishes and other unique menu items. The strawberry syrup seemed to be most popular. A Must try breakfast stop when in Vegas. A bit out of the way I think in Summerlan but well worth it.

uCknHL-7iKltehyvDbjI4w.text: OMG this place is so good. My friend and I went yesterday for the first time and I really enjoyed it. The wait is long but worth it. I had the sausage and eggs breakfast with a small stack of banana pancakes so good.

HTwD6uB02i1MaJjztqb8Iw.text: My wife and I drive by one of the other locations to come here. The staff are friendly and the food is great. I take many clients here for an early breakfast meeting.

1YJUu_temU2wo5BIy4j5uw.text: brunch fanatic? you HAVE to try babycakes out, trust me, your stomach will THANK you!  what i ate: - daily special: breakfast burrito: potatoes, bacon (your choice of breakfast protein), eggs, cheese. everything inside was cooked to PERFECTION. im not kidding you! the potatoes were crispy edged fluffy potato pillows. the eggs werent overly mushy or overly hard. the cheese was melted. even the freaking tortilla was soft and hot and oh so yummy. i cant believe im raving so much about a breakfast burrito. my only gripe was that my korean tongue wanted more of a KICK to the burrito so i added globs of cholulu hot sauce. i wish it had come with some pico de gallo or something for some extra heat.  - daily special: cinnamon bun pancakes: this was cinnamon toast crunch cereal in PANCAKE FORM. the texture, the flavors, the buttermilk was all there. delicious - short stack of the FAMOUS red velvet pancakes: hands down the BEST red velvet pancakes ive had. the pancakes were cooked perfectly - the edges were cripsy, and they were cooked all the way. they were tender, but not mushy. just enough bite without being overcooked. the cream cheese syrup? genius! huge dollop of whipped cream with chocolate shavings on top? this was PERFECTION - pig omelet w/hashbrowns: we had to get it cause of the name. the pig omelet? filled with various porky products - ham and bacon. we added spinach because we thought a lil green wouldnt hurt, espcially with our sugar overload. also cooked perfectly. the eggs werent tough, but tender and the cheese was perfectly melted. the hashbrowns were thin and crispy and cooked!  - coffee: MUST get the coffee! its a great cup of joe to help wash down the rest of your meal  pros: - FOOD. i cant speak for their lunch menu, but from what ive eaten from the brunch/breakfast menu, i have to say that everything was cooked so well. nothing was over or under cooked. everything was seasoned well. i was happy to see some hawaiian/flip dishes on the menu too! definitely want to try those next time - service: staff were all friendly and courteous. service with a smile  cons: - the WAIT. my friend and i waited about an hour for a table for two at 11am on a sunday. the place is SMALL and tucked in some random corner of a very dead plaza. but to be honest the wait was WORTH it!  - off the strip. this is definitely a locals joint! kind of far to eat if youre staying on the strip  would i come again? YES YES YES!

r6T3LrnPXhSin0SKboZClQ.text: Good little -- and I mean little -- breakfast place. This place is tiny! Expect a wait. Pancakes are their specialty, and there is something for everyone. Good experiences, waitstaff is very friendly and prompt. The smallness does detract, like other reviewers have noted. It can be a little loud too. Check it out if you are in the mood for pancakes and have some time to kill.

e4oHQVOWbYaoaT_b6LvbEg.text: Oh, how the mighty have fallen!  I arrived here around 8:10am and was seated relatively promptly.  My order was taken and water on my table by 8:15am.  This is where this turned from a great experience to a bad one.    I know that this is a relatively small eatery.  It's a mom and pop type business.  The pancakes were good--  a tad too chocolatety... More so than I remember, but I could have just been in a bad mood after waiting 1/2 hour for pancakes.  Are you kidding me?  I'm a solo diner.  I watch full stacks brought out to the table to the right of me and short stacks to my left--literally.  If it didn't take me 1/2 hour to get there, I would have left.  Finally, my waitress notices "Hmmm... I think she probably came here to eat" and asked the kitchen where my food was.  They start to argue about if it was put in or not.  I'm thinking, "Hey, I'm sitting right next to you guys. Can you be more discrete?"  So they start making the pancakes.  Do I get an apology, an explanation, a "are you still doing alright", "your food will be out in a bit", or at least some water in my empty glass? You guessed it... No!  That was the insulting part.  Look, I eat out a lot.  I do probably more than I should.  I know that things happen and mistakes are made.  That's absolutely fine.  There will be some human error.  What is not acceptable is keeping the patron in the dark-- especially if I can hear the whole he said/she said conversation... This right here is where restaurants are defined, and this place failed miserably.  To add insult to injury, they put the check on my table literally 3 minutes after I got my food.  I eat fast but really?  Again, really?  You've got to be kidding me.    I WILL NEVER EAT AT THIS PLACE AGAIN!  They need to hire someone to teach them how to run front of house or at least get some manners.

8AhEeSlVpi7YHc9N6vyrQA.text: Ok was in Vegas last month rolled in here about 20 minutes to close on Sunday.  I used to wait tables you are a jerk if you do this and stay long after the establishment you are bs'ing in has closed. Now I told my friend we weren't going to be a jerks like that.  Despite us rolling in the girl who took care of us was really cool about it.  I told her upfront we would tip her well.  This is a Vegas must if you don't leave the strip to get here you are missing out big time.  I'm not even going to get into it all's I'm saying is I was impressed and this is a foodie breakfast heaven! Carry your a$$ on over there.

smPzRV4OTxIhN6wLka7d5A.text: let see..... come early. bring a book, your ipad.. a game device... something because you are in for a wait.  truly though.. it's well worth it.    all reviews are raving about the red velvet pancakes and every positive review is the truth!  it's so moist and yummy it's unexplainable.    so my little family of 4:  2 adults, 2 tweens... each ordered something different so we could all share.    mom: loco moco : which was tasty.. nothing special.. all beef patty with yummy gravy over rice, topped with an egg over easy. dad:  adobo fried rice : super filling and yummy.. this omelet of chicken adobo fried rice wrapped in an egg is huge.  share. daughter:  s'more pancakes... and a side of egg son:  spam scramble... it is what it is.. and it is goooood.  :D  and of course... the red velvet pancake!  YUUUUUM-ME!  totally be prepared for the wait.  it's a wait.  they tell everyone 20 minutes and it can carry over 30.  the place is small and with a million people waiting to get in, it's obvious why there's a wait.  i can't wait till this thing spreads like wildfire and chains open.. or they make it bigger.. we definitely need one of these babies in the southwest area!!!  *hint *hint!

9j8MdJZthm69zhrV5Httuw.text: Great pancakes  and lightning fast take out. We had the Red Velvet and Smores pancakes and will definitely come back.

x_OF9JIvvqZqlI-yJR3iwg.text: An hour wait was worth it!  I had the Mexican omlette - delicious with a fresh pico de gallo on top.  My only complaint was that I wish it was fresh jalapeno and not pickled inside the omlette. Subbed the house pancakes for red velvet and omg...mouth watering and taste-gasm. I will definitely be back!

3Edsrp1SY9kCIwMDJobX_g.text: The pancakes were really good. They were light and fluffy but packed full of flavor. You can tell they put a lot of care into their pancakes and perfecting cupcake-like pancake batters. They had many flavors like lemon ricotta, peanut butter, strawberry and we had a hard time choosing. We decided to go with red velvet and carrot cake pancakes. Both were awesome and served with a cream cheese syrup. One suggestion for them, selfishly speaking, would be to create a pancake sampler to give customers an opportunity to try a variety of their flavors. We had to order two separate dishes just so we could taste more than one of their flavors.

UrEl9Gh04Om_rT3w9O7MZg.text: Great service. Adobo Fried Rice Omlete was delicious.  The restaurant itself is a bit small, but since it's breakfast, table turnover is pretty fast. My boyfriend got the Sausage & Egg breakfast which also came with hashbrowns and 2 buttermilk pancakes. It was good, but maybe we needed to get a different pancake dish.

WROANX-QX0OGonxW_Dm75Q.text: Well worth the drive from henderson! Red velvet pancakes a MUST! I got a short stack and it was plenty! Take the trip there! I promise you wont be dusappointed

KMZcY89mw4HAOGZtA9in3g.text: I enjoyed the red velvet pancakes and the cream cheese syrup.  I also liked the kalua pig benedict.

abCFxauO0yQDElsX1RbSTw.text: Definitely coming back to this little place when I go back to Vegas!! :D This place is soooo delicious, especially the Red Velvet Pancakes!!! Came in Thursday 11AM and there was still waiting line.. Imagine weekends!! But the wait is sooo worth it!

xSSdtExFhEZ8FL3N8Xk7oQ.text: BabyStacks Cafe is definitely going to be added to our list of favorite Las Vegas haunts!  Thanks to all the positive Yelp reviews, we decided to go on an adventure  and check out this place.  We were not disappointed!  Warning....the restaurant is small so expect to wait.  We noticed that there were several empty tables while we were waiting.  Maybe this is to allow the wait staff to provide all their customers outstanding service.  Hubby ordered Rick's Adobo Fried Rice.  The omelette is stuffed with shredded chicken meat and rice.  Served with your choice of Mac salad or potatoes.  Huge!    I had Portuguese Sausage, Rice and Eggs which is served with your choice of BabyStacks pancakes or toast.  I upgraded to garlic rice and Red Velvet pancakes. Mmm...mm good.  Don't scrimp, it's worth the extra charge.  Red Velvet Pancakes are a definite must!  Portions are generous.  Come hungry!

FeAbKUYf-pNpEeDOFuGlgA.text: Ok. Here's the scoop. Loco moco was good, very good. RV pancakes without the chocolate, very tasty. I took to go orders of the banana pancakes. To try at the Volley ball tournament. The line can be outrageous for parties greater than 2. So waiting will be long.(expect up to 45 minutes)

Kj4H9oK6_xEwJsQv1m8fJQ.text: Fantastic pancakes - the red velvet are a must try, although I liked the banana bread ones more.  The cream cheese syrup is a bit on the sweet side, but it paired perfectly with the flavor of the pancakes - regular maple would not be nearly as good.    The Eggs Benedict was also very good, although the ham was a little on the tough side.  There can be a super long wait here and they aren't always accurate with their quote times.  We were quoted 20 min and ended up waiting 45 min for a table.  They had many tables clear of people, but the one busser couldn't keep up to get people seated quickly.  They could get a lot more business if their service was ran more efficiently.    Nonetheless, I would return for the fantastic food!

s7BzBXAcwt6M6KJPvbL1dQ.text: Hmm, where do I start on my review...let me first tell you, I am not a breakfast person at all, the mister, however, loves his breakfast.. So one Saturday morning we decide we'd check out Babycakes.  I do happen to love red velvet cakes when done right so were looking forward to the red velvet pancakes, even though I'm not a pancake fan.  Anyhow, we arrive at about 11:30 on a Saturday and the wait is 45mins, okay, we say, let's hope it was worth it.  It wasn't too bad, the actual wait time was about 30mins and we were seated.  There was all types of people, lots of families.  I order the Kahlua pig Benedict and half order of velvet pancakes, the mister got something ( can't recall so it was probably not that memorable) and banana pancakes.  He said his was just okay, but he tried my velvet pancakes and fell in love.  My Kahlua pig was so good, it had cabbage and shredded pork, just the right amount of hollandaise.  My velvet pancakes is were I was hooked, which is a lot for me considering I am not a fan of pancakes.  The pancake was soft and warm and the cream cheese syrup had just the right amount of sweetness....Babycakes has made me a fan of breakfast!  I will definitely be back, next time with my daughter cause I know she will be hooked just like her mama!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig Benedict, yum!!!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet cakes is too die for!!

w03IaKhSoIhNdycKybkLlQ.text: Enjoyed breakfast here on way to Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area.  The arrangement of food is nicely place, suggesting care and pride.  The service was pleasant and attentive.  On this trip, the red velvet pancakes and the loco moco were the pleasure of the morning.  The red velvet pancakes, the Hawaiian style menu items and the reasonable prices will draw me again on my next trip to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0w2SrBFz6D_rPxc2FOjiwA.text: So we decide to try another location so I got the Portuguese sausage and over easy eggs with the garlic rice so freakin bomb I killed it and I'm a female for the hipe on the red velvet was eh but I don't care for pancakes my bf ate both meal and pancakes crazyyyyy service was good

i2iRovy17vi5ILunQvCoIg.text: Food- we ordered the kalua pig eggs benedict, adobo fried rice omelette, and short stack of red velvet pancakes. Kalua pig eggs benedict is so good!! Adobo fried rice omelette was good too, though the adobo was a bit dry. But still very good. And last but not least, the red velvet pancakes. Let me start by saying that I am not a fan of red velvet anything or a fan of pancakes. We ordered this just because we saw it on everyone else's table. LOL! but man, are we glad we did. They're sooooo light and fluffy, not like denny's or ihop where they're dry. These pancakes are Soooo fluffy!!! (I already said that, didn't I) And they taste so good!! I'm now a fan of red velvet!!! Well, maybe just a fan for BabyCakes red velvet. Heehee!! (see my pictures of our orders).  Staff - very friendly and kept busy. Even the owner (Liberty) was seating people, checking up on customers, and even cleaning tables! Wait staff is also very attentative. Every worker was all smiles!   We'll definitely be back, it was worth the drive across town. And we'll definitely be taking our out-of-town guests here for breakfast! Yummmmm!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes

M8ZW4XNsmz-bnCFrhQq3GA.text: Was it insanity or a senior moment?  I have made the same mistake in the past when we stayed at the South Point, but I thought the restaurant would be reasonably close to Sam's.  It wasn't so don't do it.  This location and its S. Buffalo counterpart are always busy for breakfast, but we lucked out and did not have to wait for a table though a waiting line formed shortly thereafter.  My wife ordered the banana cream pie pancakes, I ordered crepe-like lemon ricotta. Even after drizzling the pancakes with 2 containers of cream cheese syrup and lemon segments, mine were virtually tasteless.  Hers was delicious, mine was not.  She finished hers, I did not.  She was very happy, I was not.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife&#39;s plate
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My unfinished pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crepe-like lemon ricotta pancakes

enKgPTtOf1yhd_BeiYAbKg.text: This place deserves a 5 because I over ate like a mofo and got sick for doin so LOL   So the PIC was so over that brekie from Bouchon the day before so he wanted something off the strip. I fired up the yelp and it was between that and some other spot but these pictures from here won me over!   I don't know Vegas and what part we were in but getting there was almost nuts because it was flooded getting there. Damn storm in Vegas kinda ruined my Vegas mojo. Oh well. So found the spot in a shopping center next to a donut shop I wanted to get a donut BUT the food coma after this orgasmic meal stopped that LOL.   Since this was a weekday brekie, we didn't have to deal with the weekend rush that I kept reading about, so :p Walked in and sat at the counter so I can watch some tv while stuffin my face. The service was good . We had a dude that I think may have ran the place himself or family. Anywho scaled the menu and was drooling over the options. So typical me :D  Finally  we figured out what we wanted after trying to figure it out for damn near 15 minutes. My fault HA!     I opted for the build your own skillet. With the eggs ,spinach,bacon,mushrooms and cheese. Under that is a bed of breakfast potatoes. I also added two red velvet pancakes for an additional charge. Still came with toast OH LAWRD LOL. Pic ordered the Ricks adobo fried rice and also we did a side of portugeuse sausage and kailua pork. Man this sounds like were some mad fat asses LOL.  So im getting excited for all this food to come out. Thank god we had the whole counter to ourselves HAHA. We start piggin out. My skillet was delish BUT I didn't care for all the potatoes under my fixins. I like hashbrowns much more than breakfast spuds. The eggs were nice and fluffy. I could have used more cheese but im a cheesehead LOL. The red velvet pancakes were CRACK! Thats pretty much did my tummy in! I kept eating them and eating them and eating them. I usually hate pancakes but these were OMAZING. The cream cheese syrup was so damn good! The chunks of chocolate chip with the batter and syrup made it a perfect bite! Damn now im starting to day dream about those.  The portueguese sausage was a good amount and cooked perfectly. The kailua pork was a lacking something, some kind of brown au jus with a touch of sweetness would have made it more enjoyable. His dish was  good as well but not the best fried rice. But still good and he ate it all!    We walked out stuffed as hell and we were going to go shopping BUT I couldn't take knowing that I would have to walk amongst the crowds, so I said F it take me back to my room so I can sleep LOL. Can't wait to come back here!!!!!!

1uMCgqcbeQgzWIKG9SVXBA.text: I consider myself a breakfast enthusiast..........always in search of the BEST!  Today, along with three family members, I ate at a friends brand-spankin' NEW restaurant called Babycakes Cafe on Buffalo and Smoke Ranch.  I find myself rendered speechless; it was so FANTASTIC! We're a sharing family, the only way to eat out in my opinion, so I was able to try a little bit of everything.  ~If you like a little KICK, eat the Portuguese sausage! ~Rick's adobo fried rice and eggs with macaroni salad.......WTF?  FANTASTIC!  ~Perfectly cooked over-medium eggs! ~Hash browns.....YAY, HASH BROWNS! ~Benny's, oh how I love thee....! ~Lastly, pancakes...........my favorite food of all time!           *Red Velvet- Better than actual cake!         *Bacon- So delish!         *CARROT CAKE- (SIGH) These are hands down the GREATEST             pancakes that I have ever eaten!  I am without words..........!  You'd be doing yourself a favor if you go to Babycakes Cafe! =)

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham &#39;n&#39; eggs...

CWM9L_BuREQhqEL4dk3XFg.text: WAY TO END ONE HELL OF A VEGAS TRIP!  Hit up the spot on a Monday around brunch time. They estimated a 10-15 minute wait but we actually got a seat within 3-5 mins.  Ordered the banana cream pancakes, garlic fried rice, adobo chicken omelette and kalua pig rice. WOWWWW talk about DELICIOUS! I've had the banana cream pancakes before and I actually like them more than the red velvet pancakes, not saying the red velvet pancakes aren't good because they also deserve 5 stars but the I just LOVEEEE banana cream anything! The food was quick, delicious and so original! I wish I could have taken food home or wish there was a spot like this in Cali.  Definitely a must if you can get your ass off the strip! Reasonably priced too!  Total spent $free.99 (Bill was a little over $30 but my friends got me)

5w7Pffk6MyVkla5xH8BMGA.text: I went there on a saturday morning with a party of 4 and it was packed like crazy. We waited for 35 minutes and I'm not sure it was worth it but still glad I came.  When it came to ordering our food the service was friendly and quick. My hub ordered the eggs benedicts and I ordered the basic 2 egg breakfast with potatoes, bacon nothing out of the ordinary. I also tried some of the pancakes and wasn't impressed, but I'm not really a pancake person to begin with.  The prices in this joint seem to be fair for what your getting, but I don't see myself  making my way back any time soon because it just didn't make a lasting impression on me.

D00iuuGwRsnK0b4KLt0qFA.text: Good luck trying to get a table.  Showed up at this location and the wait was over an hour just to get a table,  drove to the second location and it was just as bad.  We ended up eating breakfast somewhere else.  I figured that if getting a table is that backed up, the kitchen probably is too.  Clearly, they need a bigger restaurant since we weren't the only ones leaving due to their lack of ability to accommodate weekend traffic.

j_DLAdT3tcjYnwXv6SAgRw.text: What a great place for breakfast!  I likes that you have a choice for smaller stacks of pancakes so you can try a few. We tried the red velvet and the banana cream pie pancakes. Hard to choose which was better. They were both wonderful.

_M-sDJsO8pnuzsHqrn21jQ.text: Ate here for breakfast on a Monday morning. Great menu. I ordered the Kahlua pork eggs Benedict and white chocolate and macadamia nut short stack. The service was great and the food came out very quickly. However I was disappointed that the Kahlua pork and cabbage didn't have very much flavor, and the white chocolate and macadamia nuts were served on top and not baked into the pancake batter.

CGhDKWr8ys7ZQxVinzaVpw.text: Very good pancakes, the red velvet are like eating a doughnut and the adobo rice is awesome. The staff r friendly and atmosphere relaxed and pleasant

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Becky trucker

DzvVXS0nL0L9NRk5gFp_Mw.text: I super love their red velvet pancakes!  Make sure you come early on weekends if you don't want to wait.  Say goodbye to IHOP once you try this place.

zIwRsfFNVojjmRTp-qNF6w.text: Place is terrific.  We were visiting Vegas with friends this past week. We like trying food places and found this great place for breakfast/brunch.    We went here as party of 12. The service was so attentive and kind.  Food was the bomb!!!  I had the kahlua pig benedict and a hazel nut pancakes.  Had some of my son's adobo fried rice (wrapped in egg) and it was delicious.  My son says it was one of the best fried rice he's  ever had.  I'd recommend this place to anyone in or visiting  Vegas

g2O1jGkF7RsbWaQ-VRA4Xw.text: Our first time here, the pancakes were not as fluffy as expected.  The kalua pig was delicious but some of the cabbage was alittle bitter for some reason.  I asked for well done hash browns and it was slightly done.  It was yummy but the next time I will try the loco moco or the adobe fried rice.  I wanted to try the garlic fried rice too.  We went during the week and there was no wait so that was a good thing.  The sweet pancakes were just dense.  Our friend loves it here and our son.  I don't usually order pancakes personally but I do like to take bites from who ever I am eating with.

-rJa0xxSJ_E_ztYt4PqAuA.text: This place was great. We ordered the garlic rice, portuguese sausage, and fried eggs plate. Also the red velvet pancakes with all the sides, scrambled eggs, and bacon. Would highly recommend trying this place. Gave 4 stars because the wait time is just so long.

vemXXl95X2_d09G6oHsgZQ.text: I hate the service here. Literally I hate it. I don't understand how unorganized one can be here. But its on my list of places that have scarred me because of service.   Regardless. Food wise--they do take the cup for the best red velvet pancakes and burgers.   Make sure to get the red velvet pancakes :)  I recommend going to the other one down south

TL9DWKnQHDK_Ao4G22QgXA.text: Apparently I missed the  Emperor's New Clothes breakfast.    Dreadful coffee  Mediocre Ranchero Omelette  Lackluster seasoned potatoes  Gummy and banal bacon pancakes  Uneventful RVP with synthetic tasting cream cheese syrup  But there was some great service in a local atmosphere!
