qb91MlZDev3rlqokuBhDBA.text: Love this place the food is absolutely delicious!! We waited about 30 minutes for a table but the food was absolutely wonderful the waiter was very friendly we had a large group of people and they served us in a timely manner great great great experience

U89rAkZGCiL4v-6EUCj5Bw.text: You will catch me with my family here every weekend! It's not just about the great food and wide variety of choices, but it's the people that make this place extraordinary! They are like my second family. When the staff remembers your name and orders, they are dedicated to customer service. Absolutely love this place!

XMmPbThJgrrEOYS2sj00PA.text: Fabulous brunch! Loco Moco with the Kahlua pork and garlic rice was so yummy! My son had the regular Loco and said he felt like we were back on Maui! The orange cream? Pancakes were to die for. We all had so much food we couldn't finish, but everything was great! Super great service too!

ynaoUrwcd-GxFz71gKqDTw.text: I've been here multiple times already, but I keep forgetting to review it. This review is based on my experience today only.  Service: This place is always busy, so it took them about no more than ten minutes to get us seated. I'm not complaining because there are other days where the wait is an hour (sometimes, more). Anyway, the servers here are always very nice and prompt. Ours was definitely perfect to us today; she was wonderful! They check on you often, and they don't take forever just to serve you or bring you your drinks/food. A+ for their service, seriously. I've never been disappointed.  Food: They have a lot of Hawaiian-Filipino-American fused food items on their menu, so I love that this place is very original for that. I ordered 3 spam and eggs over easy with garlic fried rice & hash browns on the side. I also upgraded my pancake. They're known for their delicious red velvet pancakes with whipped cream and cocoa powder sprinkled on top with cream cheese syrup (yum yum), so of course I upgraded to that. (Almost) Everything came out delicious and hot! However, I wasn't the biggest fan of their garlic fried rice. The rice was really oily and the garlic tasted burnt... I don't like wasting food that I paid for, so I ate it anyway. But I have learned my lesson. Other than the rice, the rest of my food was delicious!  Overall experience: I really do enjoy this place. It's one of my favorite places to go eat at. It's affordable, inexpensive, and delicious. Service is great. The food is delicious. But never again with the garlic fried rice.

xDMlvqPVbakWcAqklbMi5g.text: My girlfriend and I gave this place a try last weekend after hiking in the Red Rock Canyons. We have been trying to eat somewhat healthy, and this showed up under a search for 'healthy breakfast' haha well after reading about red velvet pancakes, all bets were off. We turned on the GPS and headed over.  We waited for quite awhile, probably a half hour or so, because of the fact that it was Saturday at around 11:30. We really hit the rush because right when we sat down, like four or five tables got up and they didn't get re-seated (do we stink or something!?)  The menu looked INCREDIBLE. Banana cream pie pancakes, carrot cake pancakes, orange creamsicle pancakes, SMORES pancakes, and I believe cookies and cream pancakes (there were plenty others but these stuck out to me). We had choice overload, because every single one sounded unbelievable. Since we also read about the homemade corned beef hash, I also wanted to try that.  We ended up getting the meal that comes with eggs, corned beef hash, and a couple of pancakes, and ordering a separate short stack as well. We got the short stack of red velvet, and the other 2 were banana cream pie.  Well, first, the corned beef hash was FANTASTIC. I would come back just to have that for breakfast again. For some reason I was craving it, and man did it hit the spot.   The red velvet pancakes were probably the best I ever had, and mostly because of the creamcheese sauce they put on top. If I wasn't 'eating healthy' I would have asked for some extra, because that would have made it the best thing in the whole world.  The banana cream pie ones were also really good, but my girlfriend felt they tasted a bit too artificial. I personally really liked them.   The bill was something like 20 bucks, and for 2 people including coffees, we were more than happy with that. The two woman that were at the front were also really friendly, and chatted with us about our experience afterwards.  Great value, great breakfast, and incredible pancakes. Will definitely be back again.

iMVH4x0DvUwueHGQSNfsWg.text: I love everything about this place except the wait but the wait is worth it and tells you it's good so that's NOT a "complaint". The service is great and fast. I've been to 2 of their locations, both on Buffalo and was equally satisfied. I love their banana fosters and red velvet pancakes and I get their omelette made into a skillet.. Tlkn about it, I think I'll go get one again today. I moved here a year ago and always bring visiting family to this spot and they share my love for their food. Highly recommended especially if you like pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington omelette with over medium eggs and banana fosters pancakes.. Excuse me while I indulge!

uA8PW0ru0KpzXvrk3gyZuQ.text: Meh...  wait was really long, the service seemed disconnected and the food was expensive for what it was.  The bathroom was dirty and so were the floors.  Just a bad experience for me, I will have to give this place a second chance since everyone loves it so much.

AS0yGYj5dss0_PsDIw494Q.text: First eating here and it was so yummy. I had the Banana's Foster pancakes. Delicious.

zTAuGYcu5jGR6zOfMkllEw.text: Bookmarked forever.  Read a ton of reviews.  It's like a group mantra.  RVP RVP RVP RVP RVP RVP RVP RVP.  We were so excited to finally come here and it lived up to the hype.  Got the large stack of RVP and an order of their homemade corned beef hash which came with eggs and home fries along with a short stack of S'mores.  Is this breakfast or dessert?  Holy pancake overload, Batman!  Everything was delicious.  My wife said it was the best corn beef hash she had ever eaten.    We finished everything and went into a  total food coma.  3pm turned into nap time and I don't think we had dinner that night.  Not sure if it was the carb overload or the sugar crash or both but wow.  I'm gonna do something eggy next time with a short stack so it doesn't kill me for the rest of the day.  This place is definitely worth the trip though.  Friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RVP

P-nddK9ksZ62nkMn0A-SlA.text: Great service. My waiter was Mike, he was really nice and efficient. I asked for cheese on my scrambled eggs, I didn't get it, but I don't think he heard me. Not his fault.   The restaurant is small! There are other locations, I went to the one at Buffalo and Smoke Ranch. Expect to wait on a Sunday (even with football at 1pm) but I promise it's worth it!  I couldn't decide on what to get. Red Velvet Pancakes are their best seller, but chocolate isn't really my thing.  Everyone around me ordered them...they must be good. I was torn between lemon ricotta, hazelnut and banana cream pie pancakes...(they need a sampler plate! For real!) I asked my waiter, Mike, his suggestion and he told me lemon ricotta was the way to go. Delicious!! But the pancakes are way HUGE. I mean huge. Bigger than your head. Think the size of a large dinner plate. The short stack is three pancakes. I went famished but finished about half.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were thin halfway between a pancake and a crepe and had a nice lemony taste. I squeezed on some fresh lemon and butter and dipped them in cream cheese syrup (WHAT???) and had a foodgasm.   I am going back to try some more!  My bill came to $16.50. Very reasonable.  I had coffee, oj, short stack of pancakes, and a side of scrambled eggs. I'd probably skip the eggs, not great...and since the pancakes are so huge I wouldn't have needed them if I'd known.

tv-k0a62zjlEZ9YVDPcghg.text: Visited this place based on the raves we read on yelp. I ordered the spam, eggs and upgraded to the garlic rice. Def reminded me of what mom would've made on a weekend morning. Wait was long so don't come hAngry! Service was decent. Not that it was bad or anything but it was just OK - wouldn't go out of my way when I come back to Vegas. Maybe should've tried the red velvet pancakes as that seems to be the rave in most reviews.

CHnecoz9B_HDehB-VvFNeQ.text: Fast service, good food, short wait, nice server. I got the honey toast and I literally wanted to screen shot my tongue just to remember how flippin good it was. M'lady got ye mocha chip pancakes which were like chocolate chip pancakes except hipster. I never got the the bottom of my coffee cup for more than 30 seconds.

oGtM4uHs6739zdqEtA03Hg.text: We came in here once before and got great service and food so we decided since we were in the area to come by again and sure enough the service was impeccable and the food was great again!!! Amanda is amazing and I really enjoy all of the Hawaiian infused options!! Keep it up guys! You're amazing!!!

4y-qa2Q7TnnWkpYkfJSOAw.text: We've tried to eat at BabyStacks several times, but the line was always too long. Today was my husband's birthday, so we decided we'd go no matter how long the wait. We got there a little after 8, and luckily there was no line at all! (Not the case when we left, though. I guess if you come after 9, you're out of luck.)  I had the adobo fried rice omelet with a side of red velvet pancakes. The birthday boy had the country eggs benedict with hash browns. All were excellent -- even better than anticipated! My omelet was chockful of chicken and rice, and the marinade made the chicken taste almost like pork. (It reminded me of my grandma's pork-fried rice, and that's a good thing!) The only bad thing I can say is that I loved the adobo so much that I can't imagine ordering anything else. (Maybe a different side dish, although the red velvet pancakes were delicious.)  This place is tiny, which is part of the reason why there's usually a line out front. But the main reason for the wait is that the food is just that good. Maybe next time we'll come with  friends so we can try some of the other dishes on the menu. It's definitely worth the wait!

_IjfdW3GSPrCd9Ql_YY2xw.text: My favorite thing besides the food is the service Top notch they make you feel like family the food is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ZTjfVOaNPlEp0fF4PR0Sg.text: Good thing I love the food here!! But same host from the last time I was here sat people before us and forgot about us. How do I know even the cashier corrected the host telling her that she sat people before us. Hopefully this won't happen!! Happy Holidays!!

8wowW4RcwuZw5bfv2euUIA.text: I was told that because my wife wasn't here yet, she was going to be here in 10 minutes, that they would not seat me until she was there. I mean I understand why they do this because it's a tiny tiny restaurant but maybe they should reconsider getting a bigger location. The great thing is however that this is Las Vegas and there are a ton of great breakfast places to go to off to Cracker Barrel!!!

UkvlMc0JLpWc1PFuA3ImEw.text: Good but not sure it's worth all the hype.  Went there with a fairly large group of friends and had to wait a pretty long time to be seated.  It's a small place and right now very trendy so be prepared to wait.  I found their red velvet pancakes a but too sweet and definitely overrated.  I love red velvet but when you add in the chocolate chips and their icing it was just too sweet.  It was better without all the other stuff but then slightly dry.  Liked their buttermilk pancakes more.  Nice and moist and delicious with the butter and syrup.  Believe I also got corned beef hash - it was very good but the potatoes with it were meh.

BTHUdHzLHjfDg2WH9wIiCQ.text: Wow this is the best breakfast brunch I've ever had. I ordered the kalua pig Benedict and the small stack red velvet pancake. Let me tell you the Benedict was heavenly. Never had it with kalua pig and it was genius. If youre in the area go here.

mzLvBZXQ1yF6AJcr4yYx7w.text: Would of given it  5 stars but the acustics are hard on the head very loud. But the pancakes top notch great service and nice decor

v8BKoHcuHN8_WjuQ4UOaGA.text: O-M-G! I don't even know where to start. The place will blow your mind!  The point is, you just need to go!  Don't ask questions. Just go!  Everything about this place is worthy of 5 stars.  The food is delicious!  Red velvet pancakes, get it girl!  The service is wonderful everytime.  The facility is clean and the environment is relaxed and perfect for flavored pancakes and more!

Axerkixb7nWxPRADcU_kwQ.text: Service was great! Really nice menu, with a lot of options. I had strawberry pancakes, which were very flavorful. Also had mexican omlette, which had carnitas, jalapenos and pico de gallo. Very good. We love the variety of dishes offered. You can choose to go simple, or can choose something with a little bit of a twist and not be sorry. We will definitely be coming back.

P-o42UgIZXDGYU4qoNqVwA.text: Had breakfast at Baby Stacks today for the first-time.  The red velvet pancaakes were OUTSTANDING!!  I wasn't sure if the cream cheese syrup would work for me, but it did and how. The service was excellent..friendly and efficient.  I was a party of one  and got seated immediately, but I noticed others had to wait.  They gladly accepted my discount certificate.  It was a wonderful dining experience and I will return again even though it's a 20-mile drive to get there.

l4xadbWopMRPH83IeRTjcA.text: Red velvet pancakes were really good. The cream cheese icing sauce made them too sweet in my book. I just dipped a few bites in the sauce. The whipped cream that came on top made them sweet enough. Service was fast and friendly.

feZTF_ue76NIIzNI0dC7nw.text: I loved the food. The cookies and cream stack is outrageous. The service was excellent, even with a party of 8.

negYZdEKDLYdlwvz4tkLJA.text: Looking for a new place for breakfast, we stumbled upon this restaurant. This has become one of our favorite places for breakfast. We make sure to take everyone that comes to visit. I have yet to be disappointed with anything on the menu.

vLUtF3ZUFNzNU-SQpLtPvQ.text: Awesome red velvet pancakes.  Worth a 20 minute drive.  Coffee is ok.

h-YlVuTAibKRLKpLVGmGmw.text: I wanted some pancakes and heard this is the place to go. I picked the blueberry short stack because it seemed like the only item that wouldn't give me diabetes. It's the middle of summer, when cartons of fresh blueberries are widely available for cheap and Babystacks is using frozen blueberries in their pancakes? Really? That, and the batter tasted bland. Like any other chain restaurant pancake. Although $6 for breakfast isn't bad. Come early (8am) and beat the crowd.

R_ydqN2GaxkPOn-5SpgLRQ.text: I really thought we were going to love this place, but it was just okay.  The red velvet pancakes were really dense, no cocoa flavor or any flavor!  The smores was a little better, but nothing that blew us away.  I expected great service, but our server was not very friendly or attentive, had to track him down for coffee refills.  Once was enough for us, not going back.

-YP9bZF1jnIQ8LxfkyCNbw.text: Wow! Red velvet pancakes were awesome! The service was great, the portions were large and the food was awesome! We have lived in Las Vegas for a few years and have been looking for great breakfast places and this one hot the mark. So excited to eat there again!

fL4U4W1d5_n2ovGuWRUbrg.text: There's always a wait bc it't so good.  The nutella crepe and red velvet pancakes are the best!!

tJ_UIRLVIcgExOsBqxl73Q.text: To summarize our experience - LONG WAIT & overrated.   The pancakes were definitely delicious.  The omelet was average.  Your typical American brunch place with some Mexican & Filipino influence.  We'll probably go back for that "specialty"... but I don't see us frequenting there.

1gixD36Z2Ol3A5QA-dAFQA.text: I'd give this 5 stars, but they really need a larger space so that more people could be seated. My kids LOVE the German pancakes. My husband really likes the Loco Moco, and I just like a simple eggs/sausage/pancakes combo meal. If you like this place, you'll be back. If you want to try it for the first time, you'll wait the 30-40 minutes to be seated. Overall, we like it, but we have to be willing to wait to be seated in order to be motivated to go. What I love about Las Vegas is that there are plenty of breakfast places to eat at, so we have no shortage of that type of food here.

58BT9LHuQto_mPilrMdChw.text: I have been here a few times with my boyfriend and each time has been great! Got the strawberry pancakes and the banana pancakes and couldn't have asked for better!

BtR5gUdC9WOrDlHuM0fdqQ.text: Babystacks is by far the best breakfast place I've been to so far.  The hostess/waitress was so sweet. She kept asking us if we are doing okay and smiles. The place is clean and nice. Great atmosphere. There's also a flat screen tv that you can enjoy. The place is kind of small. I have no complaints because when I go, there's only a few tables occupied. I usually go when they first open.  The food is good. Their Red Velvet pancake is a must have. Nom nom nom. My mouth is drooling thinking about it. Well the Red Velvet is nice and fluffy. It's not chocolately like a red velvet cake. It has that perfect balance to it. The icing and dollop of whip cream I think with mini chocolate chips makes the pancake taste even better.

mJ0Kr1KU2KlVGVRgUDLCCg.text: The lines were so long. This place keeps busy. My friends and I waited for 40 min. I came here for the red velvet pancakes. I must say it was pretty good. Also enjoyed the other breakfast foods along with adobo fried rice. The portions were pretty big. BUT I gotta say.. I have tasted better adobo and can even make most of the stuff that we had ordered. Altogether I was pleased, but not too overly impressed therefore not giving this venue a perfect score. However, I do intend to come back and bring friends with me for the experience of red velvet pancakes.

VhfUCpFzREQaaqTLRPg9zg.text: This place is amazing I recommend you try it's like going to a sushi bar but for breakfast it's quality food at a great price

aPLhBb8ZDltTN1vTfpxRlA.text: Great food.. I'll be back.. This is a good place to spoil yourself. I've been back to BabyStacks quite a few times and they never disappoint.

AgwG7W6vtkdgi2p9gQT5mw.text: I can't wait to come back to Baby Stacks!! I decided to stop in for breakfast with my best friend that is visiting from out of town. We both agreed that this is a great place for breakfast! The pancakes were honestly some of the tastiest pancakes I've ever had. I ordered the hazelnut short stack with strawberries...wow! They drizzle Nutella with whipped cream and chopped hazelnuts on top! Plus the fresh strawberries made it even better! Every single bite was delicious..I actually finished the short stack! I don't think I could ever order a full order though! A short stack is perfect! I ended up ordering two different sides of potatoes, the hash browns and the breakfast potatoes. Both were good but I will probably stick to the breakfast potatoes next time! I spent about $14 for a short stack with strawberries and two breakfast sides and was not upset about it. Like I said I can't wait to return!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast potatoes!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash browns!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My best friend ordered the Rocky Road pancakes!

WWGZRiE4d2gteZ6hL6Le7Q.text: The pumpkin pancakes were delicious!! BUT my friend ordered steak and eggs and I'm not quite sure it was steak...I wish I could have taken a picture. It was so gray and it looked like it wasn't even cooked correctly. It looked like a year old steak. I'm hoping he doesn't get sick..

ULubvBDBeS57_4bKzu3dqw.text: Babycakes has the best pancakes that I have ever tasted!  The Red Velvet Pancake litterally melted in my mouth.  That is what I call a GOOD pancake.  Anyone know the recipe?  J/K  The fact that I was with family and the atmosphere was fun, made my experience all the much better.  Oh, make sure you try the Filipino dish: Adobo Fried Rice.  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5FhcfTS_nfOq56hiwZhDjA.text: This place is amazing!!!!!!!!!! My wife and used to frequent this place every weekend.  The food is delicious and the waiters and waitresses are great.  Their red velvet pancakes are awesome - you can never go wrong with those.  The cookies and cream and banana foster pancakes are great also.  There eggs and meats are just like any other breakfast place, but the reason to go there is for the pancakes.   Get there before 8:00 AM to avoid the wait on the weekends.  It's worth getting up early!

X0nOVTtQvvtEdNWB9uy2wg.text: IN NO WAY AM I SAYING THE FOOD IS NOT DELICIOUS... BUT THE SERVICE NEEDS IMPROVEMENT.   Normally I go to the Smoke Ranch location but I was on my lunch break for work. I have never had a single bad experience till today. I ordered the Chili Moco, new item on the the menu and it sounded interesting. Came out barely warm. Waiter not in sight for quiet some time. My  daughter who I was having lunch with had to go to the bathroom. Cant put off a toddler going to the bathroom, so we got up and went. By the time we got back, my food was ICE COLD. I could see why since the restaurant was FREEZING.  I Finally got the waiter and informed him of the situation. He did ask if I would like it heated up ( microwaved eggs... YUCK!) or remade. I let him know I was on my lunch and had to get back. My family was already finished with their meal by this time. I was a little upset to see that I was charged for a) something I did not consume and b) something that was not to my satisfaction.  After further talking to a "Manager", I was told that it was my fault the food was cold and that they normally don't take items off but this will be a one time thing. Like really? It was my fault the food was barely warm to begin with and I don't have the time to wait for them to make me another dish. I inform my server as soon as he was around. I did my end, sorry I was an inconvenience. Never have I felt so talked down to for something I have no control over.

FCpaqjMH-0ONNNNGLF1b4A.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE.  My favorite  meal is the Hungington Omelette and the Red Velvet pancakes (of course).  I swear they get their eggs from some super secret chicken farm in Narnia or something because their omelettes and skillets and spam and eggs are delicious. By the way, LOVE that they serve spam and eggs.  Brings me back home so it's really nice.  And their seasoned potatoes are out of this world. I don't really feel like I need to say anything about the red velvet pancakes, just walk in and look at all the articles on the wall.  The staff is great.  It helps that I discovered a long lost friend works there.  They're really prompt and friendly and I enjoy very much eating there.   I could have brunch there every single day.  I may suit up for it next time.

BnJbgDUNsj97IsYiLy0TgA.text: We decided to try out this little cafe strictly based on the Yelp reviews. We are so happy we did. Although the wait was a bit long, we are used to waits from other happening spots like The Bagel Cafe, Hash House-a-Go-Go and The Omelet House. So, 20 minutes wasn't too bad, if I was starving, yes, it would not have been good.   The cafe is little, and there were a couple large parties that definitely slowed things down a bit. I'm not sure if there is a best time to come but it was worth the wait.  We had the red velvet pancakes (to die for), the honey french toast (deliciously large and savory) and the s'mores pancakes (divine!)   We also shared an omelet with cheese, bacon and sausage and potates.   The former Becker restaurant is closed - maybe they can take that place over so there's more seats and less of a wait - just a thought :)   Overall, we were very happy and full! We would definitely come back again. The cafe is quaint and you feel like you are at a local's spot, which is always very nice. This is definitely a once a month treat because I can only imagine how many calories are associated with food that tastes so heavenly!   Yay Babycakes!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;Mores Pancakes - Yes, S&#39;More Please!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette with bacon, ham, cheese and season potatoes - Fantastically Filling!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey French Toast - A Whole Lot of Happy

Wa-YAjpw3q-1DURaJYoteQ.text: Yum!  Order the garlic fried rice with . . . everything!  We've been there twice and everything we've tried so far has been so good, I can't wait to go back -- and we live in L.A.!

EAMN9Cc6YWS9FagcNHWVbA.text: Yes, the red velvet pancakes are awesome--make sure you ask for extra cream cheese "syrup". But....there is no way I could eat a stack of them for breakfast!   So we went at lunch time and ordered a stack for dessert! I will admit that they were just the tiniest bit dry but once you pour on that delicious cream cheese syrup, it didn't matter. We thought they might have been just a tiny bit better if they had mini chocolate chips in them (ala red velvet bundts at Nothing Bundt Cakes). We shared the Kalua pulled pork grilled cheese which was solid. Really good pulled pork with muenster and cheddar grilled on sourdough.  The fries were crispy but my son said they reminded him of the Ore Ida frozen fries that are marketed as "extra crispy fast food fries". He's right, that's totally what the fries are like. But not terrible.  Youngest kid had a kids meal of scrambled egg, bacon, and hash browns with a s'more pancake on the side. Pretty standard fare except for the amazing pancake. It's a pancake with marshmallows, melts chocolate chips, graham cracker crumbs and marshmallow fluff.  So yum.  We went on a weekday close to 11am and had to wait close to 30 minutes. I'm sure weekends are crazy. Our server was great (and cute!) and very apologetic when our red velvet pancakes were delayed due to another server swiping them.   We'll be back every time we are in Vegas.

vV_YhhHC7kkFdqCujhMgTA.text: I love this place for breakfast strawberry pancakes are delicious. I love the skillets my favorite is the cow boy. Every time time I go here it never fails.

lxuyzutTyrV-o7H6STlOYA.text: The absolute BEST banana pancakes I have ever had! Seriously.... These cakes are legit!  Great service and friendly staff. We will be back.

y7-LmqUaWGpHNW7O5UmiaA.text: I drive by here a lot but I never really wanted to eat here. But, when my mom came to town she kept noticing the sign whenever we drove by. She thought the girl on the sign was cute and she also thought it looked like Heidi from the classic Japanese series: "The Girl of the Alps". So after seeing that, she really wanted to eat here. I really think that BabyStacks is one of those places that could be the next Starbucks... What I mean is that if they tried to franchise and expand, we could be seeing one of these BabyStacks locations in just about every shopping center. They should try to expand to California or something.. I am a big fan of those Hawaiian-Filipino style pancakes. They are pretty hard to find on the mainland(outside Hawaii). So I was very happy to find out that they had one of these places only walking distance from where I live. I was not disappointed when I showed up. The country gravy here is the best I have ever had. It's not that canned stuff, they make there own gravy here with bacon, milk, and flour. The biscuits & gravy and the chicken fried steak are the best things they got here. The customer service is superb. They got very social and friendly workers here. The only problem I have with this place is that they don't open for dinner. I'd be here almost every night if they opened late. Also want to address Kevin A's review of this place. His profile is here: yelp.com/user_details?us... If it isn't annoying enough that he runs around and gives every single local restaurant in the summerlin/north west area a 1-star rating, claiming they have "bugs" and "insects"... he gave this place one star because he didn't like that there were "too many Asian's here". And according to this profile the dumbass is married to a mail order Filipino woman...what a loser! Get the F*ck out! 5-Stars to BabyStacks. It's the best Filipino-American restaurant around. It's so good, I'd even recommend it to the King of the Philippines(aka Manny Pacquaio) if by some chance I ever met him.

6KWv5qcCkjwqC8opgIzAdg.text: The food here is always tasty. The staff is friendly. It's kind of small,  so there's often a wait at busy times.

BPVeg7hXiHrCZIzMnfik2g.text: HOLY PETE. Next time you are in Vegas, and want a quality breakfast - go to this place. This was the best commercial breakfast I have ever had. EVERYTHING was fresh and hot. I had the Texan skillet. Bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, cheese side of papas, comes w two of the most light and fluffy pancakes. I do not know who they have cooking in the back, or running this place but it is wonderful. Friendly staff too. A little bit of a wait as place is small, but absolutely worth it! Salsa was good. Made with fresh tomatoes and the flavor was beyond good. Love this place and will see you next time!

-FCkCyUSKjbbI7mXel4SUw.text: Always had great and friendly service and the food was delicious. We had the Orange cremecicle pancakes, Butterfinger pancakes & Banana creme pie pancakes. I recommend BabyStacks Cafe to everyone. The wait can be long however it is worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Creamcicle pancakes.......SO good!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie &amp; Butterfinger Pancakes! Delicious :o)

hebKYxAqpxy8p2-7Y3-19A.text: OMG this place was fantastic!   Well worth the 45 minute wait (we waited next door at the Sierra Gold cassino).   Kalua Pig Eggs Benedict was so unbelievably amazing!   Fresh Holindase sauce.  We tried the Red Velvet pancakes and they were like nothing I've ever had before. So delicious! We will definitely come back before we head home to try more of the pancakes.  This place does NOT disappoint!

pq0_PzRbyMdBk2HCA2JeFQ.text: It was 4th of July, wait was about 30 mins at 10:30am, definitely Cafe space since we were elbow to elbow in the inside wait area.  Smiles were abundant during our visit and service was great though!  We gave the Portuguese sausage and Corned beef hash meals w/eggs over med a try - with an upgraded order of garlic rice in lieu of potatoes.  We also upgraded to Red Velvet pancakes and Lemon Ricotta crepes in lieu of the buttermilk/toast that is included in the Breakfast Favs on the menu.  We came back 3 more times during our 1week stay in Vegas - we just wanted to try the other menu goodies and we loved all of it!

0IPyuUJfY8LTYoHfwao9IQ.text: after watching the sunrise at red rock canyon, this was a great place to stop for breakfast!  they have decadent pancakes (red velvet, Cinnabon, s'mores), or if you're feeling lighter, a make your own omelet option complete with a choice of whole eggs or egg whites.  you won't regret it!

kDiauJeQ2yw6_HP1eEllKQ.text: The pancakes are spectacular!  I had the S'mores short stack pancakes and my husband ordered the bacon pancakes with a side order of hash browns.  The S'mores pancakes are light fluffy pancakes, with chococate, graham cracker pieces, marshmallows and topped with cool whip.  They give you syrup on the side but you really don't need it.  My husband thought the bacon pancakes could have used more bacon but still enjoyed his breakfast and the hash browns.  The staff was very friendly and our waiter was spectacular even with the restaurant being packed full of customers.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table but the wait is worth it.

xQYcbLkme26EctChaU4h0g.text: I always love this place and have been going for a few years now. I'm seriously addicted to their red velvet pancakes but have also had their banana foster ones to and they were just as delicious. My kids love their s'mores pancakes as well. Once you have pancakes here then other pancakes don't taste as good.

2bGA0QBGyKgwsSf3HD8Emw.text: This was my first visit and my last. We arrived at 8am to a 25 minute wait, im thinking this place must be awesome. I kept things basic and ordered a short stack of buttermilk pancakes. I was disappointed when my rather thin pancakes  were placed before me with a plastic cup of syrup and a pat of hard butter  in a foil wrapper. The pancakes were like rubber, requiring a fork and knife to cut them and slightly  warmed over. I ate 1/2 of one and my husband tried the other half. I left the others on the plate.  My husband ordered the basic bacon and eggs. His eggs were cold, English  muffin barely toasted. Nothing to see here, move along......

SQa3iJhTZ5aDadadeJG1Uw.text: The place is fairly small. Great friendly servers. It seemed like the kitchen was just as big as the dining room. This place is famous for their red velvet pancakes served with a sugar glaze. At the end of your meal you pay at the front counter. Make sure your whole party is with you as they will not seat you if you are missing people.  I thought the huevos rancheros plate was kind of all over the place, still good but more cheese would of made it better. Also served along with home made potatoes.

lYmj7gRegBXSswEwMCLl1A.text: Let's just say I don't like pancakes and I loved theirs! I wasn't planning to get any but the pictures on yelp looked so good I couldn't resist. The German Chocolate pancakes with bananas are to die for! 10/10 recommend. The service was really attentive as well. Also, for a party of 5, it came out to $60 including tax. Not bad! I'll definitely come back again when I return to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. German Chocolate on top and the Hazelnut Pancakes on the bottom.. The German Chocolate one was soooo yummy!!

VmprbyI3lCwEayAWVjHsOQ.text: First and foremost, I love that Baby Stacks is a family owned business. They are obviously doing well since they now have 4 locations in town. I have heard nothing but good things about this place and was finally so excited to be able to try it. I was most looking forward to the famous babystack pancakes. I do think I will be the odd man out when I say that this place was just A-OK though.  The bf and I wandered in for a late brunch around 2pm, and we were seated right away. This place is super small, so I can see how there would be a wait during peak hours which is from 9a-12p Sat and Sun. They take to-go orders, but not during peak hours so be advised. They are open 7 days a week from 7a-2p on weekdays and 7a-3p on weekends.   I ordered the loco moco with garlic fried rice (+$1) and for my side I upgraded to a small baby stack and got the red velvet pancakes. My boyfriend had the piglet omelette with seasoned potatoes and toast. The loco moco is a Hawaiian dish which has 2 burger patties topped with 2 eggs and brown gravy, all sitting on a bed of rice. I loved the garlic fried rice, it was soo tasty and went well with the rest of my food. The burger patties were underseasoned, but the gravy was really flavorful and definitely made the dish come together. I tried the pancakes the minute they arrived at my table. This should be a dessert they were soo sweet. They were good though, but I didn't think they lived up to the hype. They were topped with whipped cream and cream cheese syrup which came in a little cup on the side. I did really enjoy the cream cheese syrup and found myself scraping the little cup to get the last bit of it onto my cakes.   My boyfriend's omelette was 4 eggs stuffed with bacon, sausage, ham and cheddar. He also added jalapenos for a small charge. While it was plentiful, it was nothing memorable. It was $23 for both of us which I though was very reasonable. We only ordered waters though so drinks would have been a bit more. I plan to come back and try some other yummy pancake flavors, especially the lemon ricotta and the banana cream pie.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bf&#39;s omelet in the back
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

ZOrjvr7Mfcb-lLWCmoyOZQ.text: Nom Nom Baby Stacks!  What I really loved about this place, was their perfect portion sizes.  I ordered a combo meal, hashbrowns, eggs and upgraded my pancakes.  Ordered the Rocky Road pancakes.  All were really good.  My friend had the red velvet pancakes, which are really sweet.  I want to try so much more, some other time.  Expect about a 30-45 minute wait for a table.  It's a small place.  Worth it.

mho2c9e4dPUqNJp7x-bCbw.text: Danielle Danielle Danielle!! OMG, it has been years since I came into a restaurant and had service like my wife and I got from Danielle. We're vacationing up from SoCal, staying over at the Marriott  and just picked this place to drop by.  Food was a great value - tasted great, came pretty darn fast, but seriously, if I lived here I'd be in there every week just to go in and have a waitress like Danielle bring me my food. If you're a waitress and you're in the service industry,  you wonder why you don't get tips or you wonder why your tits aren't big enough, come on by here and take a look at how it's done!  just unbelievable! Whoever is running the place,  I hope you're paying her enough because this gal is not going to be here forever!! What a gem!!

c-gghavvVlurxTMgkoJcYQ.text: My mission is to try every single kind of pancake they have on the menu. So far, my favorites are: red velvet and s'mores. Although I make good red velvet pancakes, the thought of waking up early to whip up a batch from scratch is totally  unappealling so the best option is Babystacks! The food tastes like they were homecooked...and I don't have to do the dishes afterwards.  They have "exciting" pancakes that are worth trying like rocky road, s'mores, and cinnabun. Gone are the days of boring old commercialized pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky road...chocolate overload
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot pancake...had my sister eat this

5ky8FTDcs0rw23Sbt110ow.text: This place is fantastic. Be advised that seating is extremely limited, and they don't have a bar where you can first come first serve sit. So come early or very late. Or wait!   The banana fosters pancakes are the stuff dreams are made of. They serve every pancake with a wonderful cold, rich cream. Loco moco hits the spot. Not the best I've had but still great. You can combo up your pancakes as a side for only a buck more!   Definitely eat here if you are in Summerlin.

wYMri2jBjExXl-JRtXkadA.text: Absolutely worth the 30 minute wait on a Friday morning!  I got the lemon ricotta pancakes which were to die for and my husband got their corned beef hash, red velvet pancakes and Portuguese sausage.  I have NEVER liked corned beef hash. I've tried it a million times in a million different ways and I have always thought it was disgusting, but their has is PHENOMENAL. It has a great crust, texture is perfect and the flavor is outstanding.   This was our first time going and we will absolutely be going back!

D-c2Q81goldXtcP638I4Dg.text: Loved it. Awesome food and awesome staff. Thanks for the great recommendations, Danielle! I'll be back!

8S0mOzIhhNCnEq-ZOG04dg.text: We went on a weekday, about 9:30..... they weren't very busy... plenty of empty tables. We sat down right away, waitress came over got our drink order. Then they asked us to move tables to accommodate a large party. No big deal we didn't mind helping out, except then they squeezed us in the tiniest table in-between others, when there was still plenty of empty tables. UGH.... Food was average... if that... Wheat toast was BAD!! Inedible!! (EAT, downtown has spoiled me forever on REAL toast) but this was stale and hard. YUCK! Eggs were not good, tasted horrible! My husband had the breakfast burrito, he said it was average.  Better breakfast at several other places in town!

ISFkcBlgi1ntGSMFjA50uQ.text: Babystacks is always the bomb but even better with Monica as your server.  She s quick, friendly and super fun. We will be back!

ud-8_u6JQTJdIVsyTCPW7g.text: Yay! My fave place in Summerlin for brunch. Super friendly staff and great food to boot! So far I've tried the adobo fried rice (like an omelette with rice) and the spam scramble. I chose to opt for the upgraded garlic rice and I had 'no ragrets.'  Their pancakes are delicious af too. Eat some there, take some home for a snack later -- can't go wrong with that! I definitely recommend this place

F0h3I-ObF1uv-hQt0D_cKQ.text: Wow! So glad I found this place on yelp! I got seated quickly despite what other reviews said about wait time. All the reviews raved about the red velvet pancakes so had to give them a try, & they did not disappoint they definitely lived up to the hype, they were DELICIOUS! & on top of that my meal was only $8 and some change!! Can't beat that!

JrNrv1ke59oUL-OVnmv_wg.text: Love this place! The staff was friendly and fast. The food was delicious. We were dining with our one year old and they made sure to bring out his fruit right away so that he had something to eat. I would definitely recommend to anyone

UqB8w3T34VyUZ1TeqGjSfQ.text: The red velvet pancakes, wow! There are a variety of other pancakes to try, but this one instantly caught my eye. It is also the first pancake listed on the menu, so it must be their signature item. The red velvet pancakes were so delightfully sweet and tasty that no syrup was needed. The combination of the oozing butter, the melted chocolate crumbles, and the whipped cream  added up to some of the best pancakes I've ever tasted.   i also ordered the Adobo Fried Rice which also comes with a small macaroni salad. They wrap the rice in an egg, resembling an omurice. I think they added too much soy sauce to my rice, because it was quite salty.   Friendly service and atmosphere. If I ever have a craving for pancakes here in Vegas, I definitely know where to go :)

IR4EINwGCebWZ2yx3XFoNw.text: Had to wait for a table got no acknowledgement from the hostess at all regarding wether or not a table was getting prepared for me but the waiter made it up with wonderful service and good food will definitely come back again only because the food is worth it not the service

ctn5apmyiFtbFh7oTnjOqw.text: This place is one of my favorites every time I come through Vegas. The crepes and Pancake creations are the best in town.

CQXGzKZtCaxtJY_68naXWQ.text: A Hawaiian breakfast place in Vegas? Very cool. Establishment: clean, Wait staff: kind, energetic and tentative. Food quality: 5/5 portion size: 3/5 which coincides with Food price: 3/5 Good food but a bit pricey for the portion sizes. But overall I WOULD return

Ny5BnriHVMrE_rlg5U28og.text: The food here was great. The service was good as well. I had French toast with Nutella pie crust crumbs, cinnamon & whipped cream (I think) I can't remember the exact name of it. The French toast was so amazing I ordered another portion to take home for later! Ugh soooo good! would definitely go back they have a lot of different things to pick from on their menu. It's such a great place I wish it were a little bigger! They definitely get a lot of business. The food presentation looks amazing & tastes amazing. If I ever come back to Vegas I will definitely come back here for a good breakfast/brunch!

AmJmFWVKrolqbRkH3fMNZg.text: The MAIN reason this got 4 stars, was the home made potatoes. Not the cardboard taste of 95% of the potatoes, (or are they?), served with breakfasts of the norm..  And yes, like the name states. Baby Cakes makes their small size cakes with so many combinations, you'll always et what you want. Like it folks. But, it's not a love affair..

4cVmSZQzoBGqbUtk3UxsrA.text: I have not loved a place more than I love this place. It is a small restaurant so keep in mind there might be a wait but it is worth it.   It is Hawaiian food and most people that work there are from the island. I had the moco loco with chili sub sausage instead of patty with garlic rice and as the waitress said it was "fire"   The flavors were amazing and chili is from hawaii, i have had dreams about this breakfast since leaving and think I am craving more.   We also ordered an omlete which was tasty added avocado.   now lets talk pancakes! Now I am all about pancakes and I got the smores but cant wait to go back and try rocky road. We also ordered strawberry pancakes which were delightful.   To top it off (no pun intended) the service here feels like home. They were always topping off the coffee, making sure we were taking care and the servers represented everything hospitality. The price point was amazing.   I could not rave more about a place because there has been no place that has made me as excited. I did a happy dance multiple times during my meal.

r8msQYGSiFnQ63CtzDRZ9g.text: I have been here a few times before and it was never this bad. I can honestly say for living in Vegas with hundreds of breakfast places to go to, I will NEVER be returning to this hole. When I walked in the hostess said it would be a 20 minute wait which is fine. So as my daughter and myself were waiting more tables started walking in. The hostess sat every table that walked in after us before seating us. And no they didn't have a call ahead or they were not waiting outside. When I asked her about it she just apologized. But while sitting every table she made sure to avoid eye contact with me. Then when we got sat our server you could see just got double sat, which again was fine we were not in a rush. But to hear him give his speech and introduce himself to his other tables, then to walk over to us and say "what do you want to eat" and not even as to check on us one time. My steak was over cooked, my potatoes were unseasoned, and the buttermilk pancakes were flavorless and cold. Then when we went up to pay the other hostess asked how everything was and when I said terrible all she said was "okay your total is blah blah blah". What a horrible place filled with incompetent people. I regret wasting my time and money here. Never again.

icMxvdxVQdyvs_fybCeCUw.text: Service was great. The wait wasn't too long even though there were a lot of people waiting.   Our waiter. He was super nice. He asked us what hotel we were staying at and told us where the nearest salon, Macy, and in&out burger joint was at. We really appreciate his help!  I tried the red velvet and lemon ricotta. It was ok. I thought it would be like extremely-popping-different-good but I had better red velvet from Aulani. But at least i tried it out. I always wondered!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red velvet and lemon ricotta

fMnQn0IPko6eBk2IfPdblg.text: Soo good!! TONS of different flavored pancakes. You wana get there early, waited a lil while to be seated & they close early. Everything on the menu is good with good prices.  A HOT SPOT!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White chocolate macadamia nut pancakes

W3uMbC__kw4Cxklx8zscQw.text: I still love this place. They've added more Hawaiian items to their menu. I went with their Special, Portuguese sausage fried rice (sausage, bacon, mushrooms, onions and so much flavor) with eggs. They also added some cool pancake varieties: Carrot cake pancakes, Lemon Ricotta and Mocha chip. Not enough time to try them all.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake pancakes with pecans and cream cheese frosting
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese fried rice and eggs. Side of mac salad

OnDNdik5Szc85h_Yn1k8mA.text: Went here on a Saturday morning, and while busy the wait was worth it.  Had to wait about 20 minutes, but once we got our table our waiter was super helpful and nice.  We went with the headliner: the red velvet pancakes.  Also got a set of regular pancakes and some chocolate chip as well.    Food came fast and was really fantastic, the pancakes are rich and sweet without being over the top.  You definitely want to plan your flavors as some of the sweeter pancakes probably don't pair as well with the traditional salty elements like bacon and eggs, but still they are delicious.  No complaint about the food or service!

jn29hXZgpq-6QrC52j3XnA.text: Everything here is 100%  yummy! I always have such a hard time picking what I want to eat because everything is so darn tasty!!! The variety of different flavored pancakes is the best, and if you haven't already read from everyone elses reviews the red velvet pancake is a popular favorite! Mine included. I don't know what it is, but thier batting for the pancakes is delicious. Soft and perfect for the pnacake enthusiast.  There is almost always a line, especially if you have a big group. But I think its worth it, the staff and gals here are awesome too!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jFKKWM_k2Kwxd3bJz-9YeQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot. I get the bananas foster pancakes. I love the flavor combination. Once in a whole I get the lemon crepes. Also a good choice. I've been coming here for years and the quality is always good. They can be very busy on the weekends.

0atmmr3FDfB0aHTMDgUrQw.text: Although smaller than the Buffalo and Flamingo location I go to, it still serves the same delicious food and same great service.   The wait for seating didn't take too long at all on a Thursday morning. When we were sat, they took our drink orders promptly and then our server eventually came to see us. She came and saw us pretty frequently, which I appreciated, especially since members of my party had to look through the extensive menu. When we ordered, it didn't take too long for our food to come out, which was pretty amazing. The food tasted just like how I was expecting. I'm glad the food quality and taste is consistent among the different locations. Babystacks regardless of location, is an amazing place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington skillet with hazelnut pancakes

-zu92dWTly-zR3gezKMDXA.text: I don't often enjoy breakfast places, I'm somewhat of a night owl and True breakfast places usually close before I get up, and aren't very big a lot of the time, meaning you are cramped in with a thousand other people and don't truly get to enjoy the ambiance if there is one. This place being nearby my school I wandered in one morning and I was pleasantly surprised. The place holds a decent amount of tables, no hole in the wall, but there's elbow room. It's not suffocating, and the food is fantastic. I came in here twice this month, once ordering lunch and once ordering breakfast. Both meals were excellent! I tried their cry baby jalapeno burger, don't let the name fool you it's quite mild but it was cooked to perfection and I love their fries! They have a light batter on them but it's pretty light and they were perfectly crispy! Breakfast was even good, baby chick skillet was great, most places can't do spinach without that bitter taste, this place nailed it. I will be back everytime I'm in this neck of the woods hands down. My only drawback is their pancake gimmick. An entire side of the menu of pancakes ranging from the typical blueberry to the outright insane orange creamsicle. The breakfast came with a side of pancakes and that was truly the worst part of either trip. They are VERY dense and cakey. If you like that then great go for it, but I wasn't a fan. I won't let pancakes stop me coming back, though. This has got to be one of my new morning favorites!

QB-dxRL7z1V05e_Yi_q4pA.text: Honestly, I prefer the S. Buffalo Babystacks, The N. Buffalo is just so DIRTY! My friends cup looked dirty, and my friends spoon was still covered in the last customers chocolate "something". This is just horrendous, and the meal waiting time was too long, we ordered before the next table next to us and they got their meal first. Also, one of the waiters gave an attitude because they gave us something we didn't order. Someone should really refer them a unexpected health inspector, this is ridiculous.

grGstVDYYLyxkJlDxOtMYg.text: Went here with my wife today for the first time. We moved to Vegas in August of 2017 and have been searching for a Breakfast place that we would want to return too and this is that place. Not only was the food incredible but the staff was extremely friendly and attentive, not only to us but to every customer I saw them helping. The Breakfast choices are wonderful with both sweet and savory choices. I can't wait to go back and try something different.

deVIPhBBHGtEA5VePjlsbw.text: I had the velvet pancakes with sour cream syrup, a Mexican omelette with a strawberry lemonade. Food was hot when it arrived and just so fresh and good. Our waitress was so delightful and even gave us to go cups for our strawberry lemonade. There was a large group who checked out before me and my friend; but the staff took them quickly. We were in and out for brunch after church in timely fashion. I will definitely come back once I'm in Las Vegas again.

RLCh5nkt6W_-JfiQn-6KXQ.text: Excellent!! We took the family out for Breakfast and everything was good. We had the Mexican Skillet, Red Velvet pancakes, Smore Pancakes, Strawberry Pancakes and Corned Beef Hash. It was 10 of us at the table and nobody complained about their food.

BOXyK1NQT5ZwkqlDxSvcyg.text: The wait was long, but totally worth it!! I ordered the corn beef hash but eggs and it was serious so amazing, my mom and brother also both agreed my dish was the best one. With that came a side of pancakes that I also polished off, perfectly fluffy and delicious!

qCPM78MXtBuyMy_W5js8Aw.text: Incredibly wide range of breakfast foods! We tried the red velvet pancakes and the cream was among the best whipped creams that I have ever had. On top of that, the pancakes were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1HAqs7HPoiBSIwgZiAFmMg.text: My favorite babystack location, it is about half the size of the flamingo location, but I feel like the chefs are on point at this spot. The garlic rice is what makes me come back to this location, they make it just right here.

wqyecnEouk8JiiwLn-OAug.text: Food so nice we came back twice on our vacation.  I recommend the red velvet pancakes

NtzHwuqx5ZyaVCBtnO4lmA.text: Very good and speedy service. There was a line outside but the turnover was quick. A little small size restaurant but it was only 2 of us so if you have a larger group I suggest calling ahead to see if they take reservations. My fav was the Adobo fried rice and loco moco. Huge portions. I did order the Banana Foster but it was ok. The bananas are carmelized, I prefer fresh and no coconut syrup. The Mac salad needed Best Foods mayo. Their mayo was too runny.

ErAqvC4-UZhjW5FB04-e8g.text: Although I have only ordered take out from baby stacks, the food has always been good. I really enjoy the Portuguese sausage, rice, & eggs. The service is always good, and the food is prepared in a timely manner. The only negative is that both times, the toast has tasted a little stale, but toast is so minor compared to the rest of the food. I do plan to dine in for breakfast very soon.

AZjNMhwaI3F31Q1wBN89kg.text: I LOVE their lemon ricotta crepe like pancakes. OMG... I squeezed and mixed the lemon into the cream cheese syrup and poured it over the pancakes, which resulted in a party in my tummy. Wow! The taste was DIVINE! The pancakes were thin like a crepe and it was sufficient since I ordered that with the corned beef hash with rice and eggs. The corned beef was ok.   The servers were very friendly, helpful, and quick.  When I return to Vegas, I'm definitely going back for the pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes with the corned beef hash, rice, and eggs.

4lIoDUmuHEBcmcq856XXvg.text: Like!  However, don't understand why half the place is closed off for more customers. We've asked to be seated to the left and always get seated to the right. No matter time of day. Even when there are other customers to the right. Just find it odd. It's been that way every time I've gone in over the last 4-5 years.   Nice servers, service time is average and food is good.

AoiKmMQisjeHCA66HCMLaA.text: Love this place!! They went above and beyond. Excellent service and food. Just wish the place was a little bigger. We were a little smooshed in it was so packed.

hSEmP7IekIB_bHySIVC3ag.text: Terrible service  Hostess cant even estimate the wait correctly and looks confused about his job.  Manage is terrible at her job also takes our seats because she miscounted. Waited over a fkn hr for nothing.

WhwuY7QeS1J1qrTXbjbOrg.text: I can see why they have a long wait! The food was amazing. Asked waiter for recommendation. The eggs Benedict he suggested was amazing! The pancakes were super fluffy. Wait staff was pleasant and attentive. Definitely will go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B7iN2lgR24LAGoHCAjm-Pw.text: I really like baby stacks , but today must of been their off day . My boyfriend got the spinach Benedict, when he was eating, he found pieces of the egg shells in his food! Absolutely gross. Very disappointed at this location.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pieces of egg shell in my food.

-TJcJ_oS5SjgsNT9ZBwWvw.text: I've been a loyal Babystacks customer for the last 8 years and I've never been disrespected by employees until today. I don't know if I will be back and if I do it will just be for the food.   I called them at 1pm to see what time their last seating was since they close early on Mondays at 2pm. The employee I spoke to on the phone was so rude. I live clear across town (20-25 mins) and called because I didn't want to be refused service after a long drive. I asked the girl on the phone when their last seating was and this is how our convo went   Me: "hi I was just wondering what time you guys stop seating" Hostess: "we close at 2 so any time before that" Me: "okay are you sure if I show up at 1:55 you guys will seat us" Hostess: "that's before 2, right?" Me: "okay I was just making sure because we are on our way right now"  So we show up to the doors at 1:50, a time before 2.... right?! And guess what the girl tells us?! Any guesses?   "Oh I'm sorry we are actually closed right now"  Hahaha and in my head I'm like youre f*cking kidding me right? So we ask to talk to a manager and this girl brings out a little teenager and she was trying to tell me to my face "no we didn't get a call" "nope that was a different location" so rudely and then she asks the girl who brought her out to me "did you get a call?" And she says "yes" lmao. Oh management, these kids running the business are going to ruin it for you. The fact they had no empathy for the mistake they made was mind blowing.   If I ever come back to Babystacks it will be for the food and you bet your ass this service doesn't deserve a tip. But honestly I think I will have to boycott red velvet pancakes for a while *kanye shrug*

GOlx0fsyf5Z_EbSVm3h6VA.text: First time at BabyStacks and we'll be back for sure! The menu has so many options, including of course, the many pancake options! It's hard to choose! I had the cookies and cream pancakes and if you like sweet things, these are amazing! It tasted like an Oreo in a pancake! I got the short stack which has 3 pancakes, with cream cheese syrup!  My husband got the Kalua Pork Benedict which he said  was pretty good but wouldn't get again. Not enough flavour.  Excited to go back though and try something else!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kjUBS9rLq73O1w0lftYVmA.text: Every time I go to Vegas I have to go to BabyStacks. They have delicious breakfast options. My favorite has been the huevos rancheros with the hazelnut pancakes. It is A LOT of food, so come really hungry! Since I've only been a few times, I attempt to try a new pancake each time. Nothing has disappointed me.

6zC8HlzClgjo02NCKMzktQ.text: Staying in Las Vegas on the strip will STRIP your pockets down to the point where you are begging for better food, service and prices. As my wife and I are constantly disgusted with the sub par food and the prices through the moon, we decided we had enough. We looked for some of the best breakfast food around, took an Uber and went straight for BabyCakes!  BabyCakes did not disappoint! The selection of pancake stacks was almost overwhelming with some monthly specials, but whatever you choose you will not go wrong! The prices were more than reasonable and the service was fast and the servers attentive! We were so relieved that we had excellent service and reasonable prices while eating the best meal we had in Vegas .... OFF THE STRIP!!!

B3U7ulXipVI_G2B8xRoWUQ.text: Love this place for breakfast! Even though I always get the same thing (kahlua pig eggs Benedict) I've tried lots of things on their menu & everything has been fantastic! I usually order for pickup but the few times I've dined in the service was excellent and the coffee even better! Try the bananas foster pancakes - they're to die for! Also the sweet cream crepes are a personal favorite but don't forget to add bananas!!

FaiReCKGtbQrPHehstqQFw.text: Very local friendly! The food here is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! Their service is well worth the wait, now listen, it's a wait but as I said, very well worth it! The fusion of food's here is nothing short of amazing, the staff is ALWAYS friendly, the place is clean and the selection is great also! Give it a shot, I recommend the red velvet pancakes, of course! Also check out the fried rice omelet, you can't go wrong!

SJtSN7Ga-_HOYtwpvgfcDg.text: Holy smokes do you need to come here. But get here early or pick a weekday for lunch.  The service is amazing, prices great, food fresh, diverse menu, clean, nice music, not too loud, free and easy parking. Awesome to have the Hawaiian influence.   Go go go, and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KxFfRI0Y00_uHCG0IBX02w.text: I understand Sunday is a busy day but I suggest you talk to your staff that answer the phones.  Two weeks ago the lady continued to speak over me and raised her voice when we corrected her about our order.  Today after waiting for 15 minutes I was hung up on.  My husband was already there so he placed a to go order and witnessed the staff hanging up on customers.  The food as always was good but front house staff need some training.

rjG61_4UVb0WwadJZPytUQ.text: We came here for breakfast when staying on this side of town. The reviews were great so we tried it on a Sunday AM. The guy told us it would be a 40 minute wait but we didn't wait more than 20 mins. It is very clean and bright inside!  We ordered a full stack of chocolate chip pancakes with the Huntington omelet. Everything was delicious!! The only thing i would say is the full stack was way too much!! The service was friendly and fast!

1zUcDZnX0LW9O3VDoU97mA.text: BabyStacks is solid gold!  They have multiple locations (5 if I'm not mistaken), but this is the only one I've been to, as of the time of writing this review.  So far we've tried: Country Benedict, Country Fried Steak, Patty Melt, and their famous Red Velvet Pancakes.  Everything was stellar! My favorites are the Country Benedict and the Red Velvet Pancakes. I'm not a huge sweets person, especially not for breakfast, but their RV Pancakes were unbelievably good. I kept taking bite after bite, thinking how are these so damn good? Hands-down, best pancakes I've ever had!  Their gravy is terrific, so anything smothered in it, like their biscuits and gravy, Country Fried Steak or Country Benedict are great dishes to try.  Whatever you end up ordering, do yourself a favor and order some pancakes for the table to share!  Now, onto service. Everyone here has been amazingly nice and friendly. Danielle, who happened to be our server both times, was so great, I'd come back just to say hi to her, even if the food wasn't worth coming back for, which it most certainly is!  Can't wait for more of those Red Velvet Pancakes!  Food: 5 Ambience: 3 Service: 5 Value: 5

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak with hashbrowns and sunny-side-up eggs
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Biscuits &amp; Gravy
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benedict

f_iLq-evX3v9bHdLU42xKA.text: First time here. Its a small location but dont let that fool you. The service is amazing! from the hostess to the servers. Friendly and attentive. We never ran out of coffee! The food was delicious. I had a Mexican skillet, served with carnitas. I was expecting a few chucks of meat but I was surprised of the amount I recieved. The carnitas were so good! The pancakes are amazing! They are soft, fluffy, sweet and yummy! We also ordered the senior breakfast and I was impressed at the amount of food that comes with this meal. My mothers doesn't eat much but she ate it all, even the pancakes. I will definately be coming back.

PsRgGgwyb4K-p_dwDSfiKQ.text: This place.....by far the BEST most delish pancakes I've ver had! Loved every bite, I want to go back again today! My husband got the orange creamsicle pancakes, I got the lemon ricotta. The orange tasted like an orange roll with frosting, the lemon were super moist and flavorful! That cream cheese syrup is to die for! We also ordered the Kalua Eggs Benedict which was very flavorful and eggs were cooked perfectly, the square potatoes are crispy and perfect. We also got a piglet skillet, we literally ate every bit. It was all sooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r7s3QEgU0h_XL9epZat6zQ.text: I love this place. Every time I go to LV I make it a priority to eat here.  Service is great. Food is delicious. They have televisions and great music playing. The cookies and cream/red velvet pancakes are amazing. I also get the eggs Benedict or the omelets, all are delicious and filling. Highly recommend this place.

HNRGjfo-VXuHqSMPSFcOHg.text: Tried this place out for the first time for a late breakfast in Vegas and it was very good. Tried the bacon pancakes and velvet. Both very good. Also had the Portuguese sausage, very tasteful! Can't wait to try out more of their cakes the next time in town. Great service too, got there 30min before they closed and they still served without issues.

pm8eHHIwAEnOCxSV_OFVYQ.text: It's just really good food, expect a 30-40 min wait, but worth it, pop into Sierra Gold next door for a drink while ya wait.

zf_yMZAayWjDBTNSpDvFsA.text: Great food, great service! Hazelnut pancakes with Nutella drizzle was a nice way to start my day.

Mkrvf-sZigoyThPogL3iIw.text: What happened to their Macaroni? It used to be really delicious but this time around it was really bland. That is the reason for the one star downgrade. It was disappointing because I was really looking forward to it. I couldn't eat it after two bites.   The spam, egg whites and rice were yummy. I also tried their Lemon Ricotta crepes which were also good but a little thick.   BabyStacks was still busy for a Friday but we didn't have to wait longer than 20 minutes to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and eggwhite scramble
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta crepe

nGAu_fppihyLS-Kuh6XCZA.text: It is the best pancakes in Vegas ! If you like red velvet , banana fasters , Cinnabon just two name a few if you can think it they have or can make it !!! ;) I love baby stacks :p

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qAN080qcoZBbtx2vtgVf0Q.text: So I've been to the SW location and loved it. This location...not as much. It's aesthetically more pleasing, it is just as small. Staff was helpful and pleasant, and the place was clean. It was a Sunday morning, the crowds weren't there yet, I think the line out the door started around 9 or so. My husband ordered a Chocolate Milk to start, well I think they only put the C in, it was the lightest chocolate milk I ever saw, our friend ordered one too and his looked the same, I think one drop of chocolate syrup was added to each cup. For breakfast he ordered the Breakfast Burrito with a short stack of S'Mores pancakes and I got a short stack of the Banana Cream Pie Pancakes with a side of Bacon. So my main gripe is about the pancakes, they weren't as light an fluffy as the SW location, they were also a tad over cooked and dry and my pancakes hardly had any bananas inside. My husband agreed that the pancakes weren' t as good this time. The Breakfast burrito was good and so was the bacon. My OJ tasted a little off as well so I just didn't drink it.  I would visit this location again but with all the other Babystacks around town now, I think I'll skip this one until it's absolutely necessary.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lightest chocolate milk ever:(

snSNHRVn19bARxCJCz1Tww.text: Greeted and seated by a sweet local girl from Kaneohe, forgot to ask for her name, but she makes the place's vibe have that "Aloha feel"!! Then, the food part....  I ordered the Kalua Pork Benedict, German chocolate pancakes w coconut and pecans, & the red velvet pancakes!   Everything stay tasting Ono as f@(?!... Especially having a sweet tooth, gotta tell ya, those pancakes are like crack!!!!  It was a perfect dessert breakfast after breakfast lol...  Oh man, craving for that German chocolate pancakes again w that ooey goey coconut flakes right now!!! Wanted to try all them pancakes!!! I'm sure all of them are guaranteed to satisfy!!! Broke da mout!!! Mopped them all up!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broke da mout

YuKdMbHsy9bgTrbChN4wzQ.text: I got here at 11:15 and my food just being served.  Disappointed and the service was terribly slow.  Hostesses may or may not be high school grads.  I was let down.

8VIzzkzAIaCXTS_sl1S5wQ.text: Did someone say BABYSTACKS?!  They have a wide variety of food on the menu, but I usually only get a short stack of pancakes with a side of something else. Portuguese sausages are my favorite. I would suggest you try other pancakes BEFORE the red velvet pancakes because once you try those, it's all game over. You wont want anything but. It's also very affordable. I have yet to try the Nutella crepes, although they look decadent.   The place is a bit cramped and would like to see it bigger. The wait time can also tend to be quite long if you get there around 10-11.  I'm excited for the Centennial location to open; I'll be plastered at the door like a puppy to be the first customer..

IVRGUemSHvvolaYAWFi67Q.text: There is not much else to say other than Babystacks is hands down AMAZING. I come here at least once a month, if not more. I am never disappointed. Service is always on point. Clearly, all of the employees enjoy working there because they are always in a great mood. The food is also freakin awesome. I've tried so many things on this menu and have never once been disappointed. One of my personal favorite breakfast foods is biscuits and gravy and Babystacks has the best plate of biscuits and gravy that I have ever had.   If you want an outstanding breakfast, go to Babystacks.

tXO0HjeT6Nm0K9eRlQJIEQ.text: Babystacks Cafe, located in the Buffalo and Smoke Ranch area is superb.  I would give it 5 stars but on some days I'm fighting with flies to eat my food.  You can order pretty much anything and what you read on the menu is what you'll be served with.  I enjoyed everything I have ordered so far and if I were to order an omelet dish I would get a special short stack than the plain ones for an extra small fee.  I find it funny how an infused Filipino dish get mixed in next to items like the Red Velvet Pancakes.  But they work.  They have TVs in there but if you see a line outside please be courteous and get moving.  We want yummies in our stomach too!

P1JOS4kqzaF2JiRVJ4KHJQ.text: Baby Stacks Cafe will be our breakfast stop on our trips out to Las Vegas from now on.  We ended up going twice on this trip and I had the HM1 in both the omlette and skillet style.  Service is great, fast and the food has never let me down!!!  You will never go wrong coming here!!!

8OBHwgBpv8DoktseFOjCPA.text: Awful service by teenage children who were more concerned with talking to one another and playing on phones. After waiting over 20 minutes for our party of three to be seated when there was an abundance of open tables (they didn't want to push two tables together to accommodate our party, yet sat parties of two at large tables...hmmmm) we walked out. Food is decent, but not worth the wait or lack of service.

_56Rj9bJqledeQARzXYK4A.text: I'm a tourist, but came here since we read the Yelp reviews.  Was not disappointed, and would recommend to everyone in the area.  Pancakes are the specialty of the house, but my omelette was very good.

oMFiI983KT96oIJBwZe-dg.text: All I can say is: ORDER THE RED VELVET PANCAKES IF YOU'RE A PANCAKE LOVER! I PROMISE IT WILL NOT DISAPPOINT YOU IN ANY WAY, IT'S PERF, okay?   Best breakfast and brunch place ever to exist. Better than iHop? Yes. Better than Denny's? Uh, no shit. Better than Egg Works? Hell yeah. Better than The Cracked Egg? Don't even, YES!  I highly recommend this to any breakfast/brunch persons cause you will not regret it. I was introduced to BABYSTACKS by an ex-boyfriend and that was probably the most amazing thing he's ever done for me in our entire relationship. Haha, seriously just go

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only picture I have of BB-Stacks // don&#39;t mind my ex and I lol

-x_KqrWs_77mZo54PcenbQ.text: It's too bad my new favorite breakfast place is in Nevada.  I'll have to visit this place every time I'm in Vegas.   It's worth waking up for.  It's worth driving to.  And it's worth the wait.    Everything I tasted was phenomenal.   The Red Velvet Pancake was out of this world!  The cream cheese syrup with buttery whipped cream really made this velvety pancake unforgettable.  I can have this for breakfast everyday!   I thought their Rocky Road pancake would be too sweet.  It was perfect! Impressive that almonds and marshmallows were inside the chocolate batter as well as on top.  As a peanut butter fan, I went bananas for my PBand??? pancake.  With peanut butter in and out of the pancake, I can taste how any topping would go well with this pancake.  Elvis would be proud!  He'd probably be here everyday too!    I had an omelet with ground beef, bacon, cilantro, and green onion.  It was like a marriage made in heaven.  Every flavor came out and I enjoyed every bite!    The Adobo Fried Rice was amazing too.  With marinated shredded chicken mixed with rice AND wrapped in four eggs, this unique omelet is definitely something to brag about.    Service was flawless, even with a long wait.  Their large size cups are ingenious for less frequent refills (for water, orange juice, soda).  But the coffee kept coming.      Can't wait to come back for more of their fresh pancake creations and other breakfast specialties.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet goodness
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky Road pancake

RNMyt0SdDL36bogPfjr5pQ.text: While I do love the food, do not plan to eat with more than 4 people. It's extremely small and they won't put tables together to accommodate more than 4 people. Waited an hour and watched many tables turn over and get seated before our party of 8.

OXOzJ3rim1vWnqVUdJ39kQ.text: Reason for my rating. Everyone in our party that ordered eggs. Were cooked wrong. Over medium was cooked over hard for mine. The taste of the pancakes was not good. Them adding toppings to the pancakes will make them taste a little better. I would not wast my money again.  Employees were eating and drinking while working. Yuk!!!

fkwPAIVVY4iFseTt1DVFYw.text: The original Babycakes/stacks  Located on Buffalo and Smoke Ranch in the small strip mall next to Sierra Gold and a Hair Color Xperts. Plenty of car parks in the lot.  So your hungry or needing something sweet, Babystacks has got you covered from every angle. Traditional Breakfasts, Hawaiian breakfast, kids Meals and the Famous Pancakes are all on the menu.  I've been coming here since this place opened, and I'm never disappointed. The service is always prompt and the meals are always cooked and prepared in a timely fashion.  I Always recommended the signature dish of Red Velvet pancakes with white chocolate but in recent times I have been here, the Banana Foster pancakes have been outstanding!  Extremely kid friendly with high chairs and coloring to keep them occupied. Also adult friendly Flat screens with news or sports on tv to keep the grown ups occupied.  Weekends are a tricky one, due to the popularity of Babystacks the line up can get crazy so I recommend during the week.  Overall Food: 5-5 Drink: 3-5 Service: 4-5 Coming back: Yes

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small stack Banana Foster... (Small stack)
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana foster
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QT_D_zT4EH1FooIOykZJIw.text: Good food, but they need to chill out with there weird seating policy. They will NOT put tables together to seat 6 and they will not pull them apart to seat 2. And don't try to do it yourself when your seated. They will ask you to put it back. Weird and rude.

baB-MoF5zl8n8yqr20lLrA.text: I love babystacks pancakes and my mom loves the red velvet pancakes. The service is good. The people are very nice and the food is really good.

unAXAioJYUKTnuY7kc04fw.text: I'm so in love with this place! As soon as I walked inside I was greeted with a happy face and that happy theme followed thru out my meal.
